146 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
2
Recommandé
33.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2015
Для начала, чем DeadCore не является.
Это не Portal, скорее анти-Portal. кому хочется больше головоломок - берите Quantum Conundrum (на самом деле он скучный, игру спасают только адские комментарии и картины на стенах да полёты на мебели). В DeadCore головоломок как таковых нет, то что может показаться пространственной головоломкой является всего лишь недостаточно продуманным дизайном уровней. В ряде случаев имеются 2-3 решения одной и той же задачи (задача всегда одна - добраться до выхода), а также возможность срезать часть пути или пройти альтернативный участок быстрее и короче, но ощутимо сложнее основного.

К сожалению игра соверешенно не располагает к спокойному прохождению. Вся суть её в том чтобы (образно говоря) пролететь через три игольных ушка, закрепленных в разных положениях на гигантских вращающихся пилотопорах, пролетая на скорости 150 км/ч. А потом, ударившись об более мощную подбрасывающую платформу, проделать обратный путь на скорости 250 км/ч. Через те же самые игольные ушки на пилотопорах. Имеются вариации когда все это происходит противоестественным образом в области временно изменненной гравитации.

В такие моменты нет возможности остановиться и подумать куда и как лететь дальше. Хотя этому способствуют облака вокруг и (иногда) композитор, чаще провоцирующий би-полярное расстройство: в один момент уровня может играть довольно милый и атмосферный industrial ambient, позволяющий успокоиться и сосредосточиться, в другой - крайне бодрый, но очень специфический drum'n'bass, нагнетающий истерику, а не атмосферу, в третий - снова industrial ambient, но уже откровенно раздражающий, провоцирующий rage-quit'ы значительно быстрее самой игры.

Игровой процесс значительно ровнее звукового сопровождения, сложность нарастает равномерно по ходу игры, даже у весьма криворуких и тормозных граждан типа меня есть возможность пройти игру до самого конца. При этом количество уровней весьма скромное (5 штук, есть ачивка пройти за 60 минут), но они ветвятся, а половина игры вообще спрятана в режиме Speedrun. Фактически режим Story нужен для обучения и раскачки (игрок по ходу дела приобретает новые возможности), но сделан хорошо, так что даже если вы ни разу не запустите Speedrun, то игра не пройдет мимо вас, как это зачастую бывает.

Способствует получению удовольствения и продвижению по игре хорошее управление: максимальная отзывчивость и подвижность даже в воздухе позволяет (и требует) творить чудеса. В арсенале есть двойной прыжок, рывок вперед и аналог рокет-джампа. Сильно порадовали зоны с измененной гравитацией. Поначалу непривычно, зато формирует пространственное мышление и в целом предлагает «думать порталами» на местный лад. Пожалуй лучшая часть игры. А вот места требующие(!) рокет-джампа наоборот, ничего кроме усталости не вызывают.

Итого: трехмерный Super Meat Boy (на самом деле DustForce) с видом от первого лица. Кто желает вгрызаться в каждый уровень по сотне раз - берите не раздумывая, игре есть что предложить. Любители ненапряжных развлечений могут смело проходить мимо.
 
DJB
2,342 produits enregistrés
11
194 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
37 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
2
Recommandé
12.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2015
Basic Infos
Gameplay lengh: 3 - 20 Hours if you want to practice Speedrun, even more so if you want to raise to the top of the leaderbord ranking.
Required skill level: Medium to Very High - Experience can vary considering the creativity of the player
This game is for most audiences 12 years and up

About DeadCore
DeadCore is at its core (heh) is an interesting mix of well-known genres takes a step further. Think of it as Portal, but with an emphasis on movement physics rather than focusing on spartial problem solving. Its a rather unique mix that can be best discribed as a Jump and Run semi-FPS Speedrun game. Developer Team 5BitsGames tried hard to create a game that uses its game physics to create a very frantic game where shooting isn't the only important thing to do. The result is a unique mix of the two popular games Quake 2 and Portal.

And in my opinion it is much better than the Portal games alone.

Gameplay
While you still get to shoot flying robots and entities that are formed like Cubes, the gameplay is more about moving yourself in ways you wouldn't even think of in other games. More specifically the largest factor you have to consider before buying this game is the focus on movement and a calm and smooth aim rather then twitch reflexes. Furthermore memorizing each level, up of the entire game is essential for finding new ways to complete your quest in climbing the tower-themed world once again if you choose to play through it for another time.

Or in other terms, DeadCore is the perfect learn how to Speedrun game. From the beginning to end I never reached a part that was overly frustrating. The entire game really opens up once you see that this game wants you to Speedrun it instead of merely playing through it once.

As an example, the first level, which serves as a tutorial took me about 40 minutes to finish when I played through it for the first time. The second playthrough however, after a bit of foreplanning and with the small-but-useful skills you unlock during your first playthrough, took about 6 minutes to complete. A Leaderbord is included so you can compare the time it took to beat any level and even the entire game with your friends or everyone else if you choose to.

A Story does exist but the devs made sure that it is not rubbing you in the face. Rather then progressing with the story, you unlock bits and pieces explaining the setting by finding hidden Data Cubes through your journey, which can be accessed via a built-in journal. The Devs certainly knew that games like these focus on the gameplay. Its because of this focus on gameplay that the story itself becomes entirely a optional or even a entirely seperate factor, but it is still interesting to read through the bits and pieces you will find if you want to explore past the obvious routes. Theres also different upgrades to be found, which aren't needed if you want to beat the game, but should be gathered anyway if you try to speedrun the game. Otherwise you're up to a even greater challenge.

And that uniqueness the strongest point this game can offer to you. What may seem like a 5 hour long game that can be beaten in less then 20 minutes if you put creativity and foresight into it. Not with knowing about the route you went before, but finding a better way through the game that wasn't obvious to you during the first time. This is very similar to oldschool jump and run games, or games Speedrunners already have lots of experiences with. Or in different words, DeadCore is a modern game but with an very oldschool Heart and Soul. It takes the FPS genre, completly subverts the way people usually play these games and creates something that is almost unique.

Graphics and Sound
When it comes to the general artistic direction, this game does look very solid indeed. Mint colors and the familiar 80's Neon look define its artstyle, which is often inspired by the movie Tron and the game Tron 2.0 yet this game achieved to still have a unique soul on its own. Premodeled shapes like cubes and slopes are placed as part of this games world. Each levels has a slightly unique style which also comes with the different lightning and a truely excellent skybox to create a fascinating atmosphere.

While the artstyle is the most positive factor here when it comes to rating the visuals, with its corny-cyberspacy look and feel, the problem here is the quality of the models used to build the levels. Sometimes I noticed that it does look a bit cheaper than I would've anticipate by looking at the screenshots from the steamstore page. Considering how open this world is this is not a major issue but its still worth mentioning that the game isn't always this good looking.

The sound, at least for me, seems to be the worst part about this game. Don't get me wrong, I love EDM as a whole but for the music in this game seemed rather generic. The minor varity of it is still a plus regardless. It also doesn't add anything important to the good atmosphere of this game. Furthermore the sound effects also don't stand out in any way but like the music, still get the job done.

So while the Soundtrack and the sound effects are the worst part of the game, they're still good enough to not consider they're out of place. Its just that the game is excelling due to the phenomenal freeform-speedrun gameplay and overall great art design that any other factor pales in comparision.

Verdict
While not perfect, its obvious that 5BitsGames really cared about making this game "just right" without overblowing it with features or making it too short. In terms of lengh, one playthrough is about 2 times as long as completing Portal 1. And like Portal 1 this game allows you to think outside the box without being too condecensing if you don't and as a result it becomes expecially rewarding to play it on your own device, without any guide. Seeing that you finished one level in just under an hour in your first playthrough yet only mere minutes after the second one feels extremly good.

This game is a great example on the beauty of choice and out-of-the-box thinking right here. And this is something similar puzzle games like Portal 1 and even 2 could ever give to you.

Recommended food while playing
Mentos as a occasional snack or Peppermint Tea (I recommend Earl Grey, but tastes vary) if you prefer a drink instead
 
༼ つ ◕◡◕ ༽つ Dray2k

Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
This game is a giant jumping puzzle with extra lazers and robots and switches and one heck of a big tower to climb. It has good graphics, fluid and responsive movement and really well thought out level design.

It requires coordination, speed, reflexes, awareness and patience, none of which I possess in good measure. Right now I'm repeatedly falling out of the sky. Please send help.

Recommandé
43.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2015
20181230更新：
三年过去了，这个游戏对我依然有很强的吸引力，目前成就已达成90%
冬季特惠仅需15元，推荐喜加一，但是需要注意的是：
1，本作极其冷门
2，主线前期难度中等，后期难度极高，
3，部分收集品位置极其隐蔽，全收集极其困难，手残噩梦
4，没有中文（可打补丁）
5，优化较烂，可能会发生掉帧或卡bug问题，建议保护好您的键盘和鼠标
-
以下评测2015年发布：
一周目游戏时间10小时，纯剧情通关时间7小时30分钟（不包括暂停），总计死亡+重生1268次，游戏后期难度可以以变态来形容。
然而这种难度却给玩家一种：虽然我死了很多次但是我下次一定能不手残的感觉，相比较传送门而言，死亡核心是完全以游戏性为主而弱化了剧情成分，就售价而言还是比较符合产品定位。
对于我来说虽然比较虐心和毁键盘，但是它的确是一款优秀的游戏，但还没有达到出色的水平，以独立游戏来说已经做得相当不错了。
优点在于游戏定位科幻，题材新颖，也塑造出了一个相当令人满意的世界观，并不强迫玩家看完剧情而是以收藏物品的形式让玩家自己去发现巨塔之后的故事，作为一款FPS解谜游戏，可以看出5bits是在用心做游戏，我更希望看到的是类似于这样的游戏能越来越多，而不是拿着抢整天无脑爆人头。
然后让我们来说一下缺点，首先一点是不自带中文，有的人会说这不能算是缺点吧，的确不能算是缺点，因为整个游戏打完你看到的也就几个单词（看不懂这么几个单词我想你也不会花 六十几块去买这个游戏，甚至不会用steam），从体验的角度上来说有没有中文这无关痛痒，而如果你想去看懂游戏更深层次的故事的话这可能对英语苦手的同学来说就比较麻烦了。
而且如果对游戏剧情比较感兴趣的话必须在游戏过程中拿到收藏品，游戏中叫TLOG，这些附加收藏品隐藏的地方极为变态，不看攻略理论上是绝对拿不到的。当然这也有可能是制作者不太愿意让玩家去深究游戏背后的故事，所以设置得比较难。
5bits作为一个独立游戏开发团队，仅有6人就能做出如此优秀的作品不得不让人佩服。
但是这款游戏的优化有着严重问题，画质无论开最低还是最高，帧率永远是一样的（在没有打开垂直同步的前提下），单从视觉观感的角度上来说流畅的确十分牵强，而作为一款本质是属于FPS的游戏来说，在视觉观感上的流畅是最低标准
其次测试过少导致这款游戏bug满天飞，尤其是后期快结束的时候，卡到墙里面简直就是分分钟的事，而作为这种游戏节奏又很快的解谜FPS游戏来说，这种bug的出现对于游戏体验来说简直就是一场灾难
最后我想说的是，这款游戏有潜力做得更好，我希望看到南梦宫有所作为，而从更新记录上来看我觉得这个希望太渺茫，半年只更新了一次，这也是让人感觉有些失望的地方。
 
Cake_Tequila

Vidéo YouTube™: Indie Review - DeadCore (PC/Mac) 
Vues : 5,779
Le test complet : http://www.indiemag.fr/tests/deadcore-grande-ascension Retrouvez-nous sur : http://www.indiemag.fr Twitter : https://twitter.com/IndieMagFR Facebook :...

Que de chemin parcouru ! DeadCore revient aujourd'hui plus en forme que jamais avec des environnements grandioses pour toujours autant de plaisir manette en main. Pour une petite dizaine d'euros, les développeurs de 5-bit Games nous proposent une véritable épreuve de skill, le tout enrobé d'un travail (visuel et sonore) sur l'atmosphère qui force le respect. Hormis quelques soucis d'orientation lors de phases de changement de gravité, DeadCore s'affiche comme une franche réussite et nous vous le recommandons chaudement.

Lire le test complet : http://www.indiemag.fr/tests/deadcore-grande-ascension

Recommandé
10.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Let me start this off by saying I am in love with this game. The controls are incredibly tight and responsive, the story mode is paced very well with the diffuculty ramping up but allowing you to go back through with new techniques that will allow you to explore more areas and quicker on subsequent playthroughs.

With that said there is a slight problem with the speedrunning, I am on top of the leaderboards on a lot of the zones because there is a technique that I'm sure isnt intended that allows you to pretty much circumvent how the game was meant to be played.

I believe this needs to be fixed if the leaderboards are supposed to be a real competition.

Pros:
Tight controls
Nice pacing in difficulty
Incredible replay value
Timed speedruns
Multiple paths
Visually impressive

♥♥♥♥:
Broken technique allowing gamebreaking movement
Somewhat short
Some keys such as shift arent bindable

Things I hope are added into the game that I believe would make this game my favorite of all time:
Replay function to see other's runs
Fix the broken technique that allows for unintended movement
Community level creator
More content! (Expansions/DLC/Patches)

I rate this game a 9/10



 
Fidel Cashflow

Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2014
Три раза пробежаться по стенам, окончательно забыть где низ, кучу раз пролететь над пропастью, стать цирковым львом, прыгающим в огненные кольца, истратить весь боезапас на рокет-джампы, быть скинутым в пропасть чёртовым кубиком-шахидом перед самым чекпоинтом и выкинуть клавиатуру в окно. Определённо must have.

Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2015
ジャンピングフラッシュ+Quakeなゲーム。
Trailerを見ると一見Portalっぽく見えるけど、Portalのようなパズル感はほぼなし。
二段ジャンプや空中ダッシュを駆使して、高速移動しつつスイッチを正確に撃ちぬいて道を切り開きつつゴールを目指す。
そんなFPS視点のアクションゲームです。

動きのテンポの良さや空中での浮遊感など、爽快感が素晴らしくとても気持ちよくプレーできます。
難易度は高めで、後半になれば一つの仕掛けで10回以上は死ぬのが普通になってくるけど、リスタートの区間が短いのでストレスはほぼ感じないかと。
非常に良く出来ていて、ありそうでなかった独特のプレー感が秀逸な隠れた名作。超オススメです。
 
TAi7A

Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2015
Dieses Spiel ist eine Granate von Shooter/Rätsel Spielen.
Ich werde einfach eine Pro und Contra Liste, um das ganze schnell und präzise darzustellen.

Pro:
+ Grafik. die sich sehen lassen kann
+ Selbst auf "low Quality" sieht das Spiel immernoch gut aus
+ Viele und anspruchsvolle Herausforderungen
+ Verschiedene Möglichkeiten, Herausforderungen zu meistern
+ Viele sammelbare Objekte bspw. Textlogs oder Upgrades
+ Gute Steuerung und gute Erklärung der findbaren Ausrüstung

Contra:
- Story für mich etwas unverständlich und unübersichtlich
- plötzlicher Einstieg ins Geschehen

Insgesamt bekommt es von mir einen Daumen hoch.

Recommandé
50.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2014
Общее:
Динамичное сочетание Mirrors Edge и Portal, превратившееся в знатный биатлон. Развивает ориентацию в пространстве, меткость стрельбы и скорость реакции, местами и чувство ритма.
Геймплей:
Внезапно, 5 уровней, со препятствиями, которые проходятся максимум с 20го раза, местами вымораживал как Super Meat Boy. Секреты на уровнях. Причём игру я могу назвать реиграбельной, так как до некоторых комплексов препятствий можно добраться только с использованием плюшек, полученных на будующих уровнях. Вцелом, хороший тренажёр перед баталиями в UT.
Прошедшим игру - предлагается попробовать себя в забеге на время на отдельно выстроенных маршрутах.
Впечатления:
Выглядит действительно интересно. Но для тех, кто в нём тренажера не видит - максимум хороший забег на один раз. Да и после 2го прохождения - летаешь уже не особо ориентируясь, куда надо по уровню - полноценно чувствуешь себя богом и собираешь вкусняшки.
Сюжета - как такового нет. Но он и не нужен.

Вывод - годно, для большинства пользователей - на один раз.
 
Mr. Zekko

Recommandé
12.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2015
Si, es un plataformas en primera persona. Si, tienes una especie de arma, pero no, NO es portal. Desde luego si te gustó este último es muy recomendable que te jueges DeadCore pero no son iguales.

El diseño de niveles, la estética, los efectos de sonido, el control y una música futurista que asoma de vez en cuando son desde luego los puntos fuertes de este juego. Agrega muchas ideas orginales o vueltas de tuercas de otras que ya existían, que ♥♥♥ sutileza te va presentando en una curva de aprendizaje bien lograda.

¿Lo malo?

Es MUY dificil, especialmente a partir de la cuarta fase donde aparecen zonas donde la gravedad cambia. Se les ha ido un poco de las manos en este sentido, y de hecho tiene bastantes puntos de guardado, sobre todo cuando la dificultad se va disparando.

No tiene una historia muy consistente, despieras en un mundo extraño ♥♥♥ una torre gigante que debes escalar.

Voy por la mitad de la cuarta fase, solo tiene cinco, y llevo unas cuatro horas jugando, así que no es muy largo.

¿Lo bueno?

Todo lo demás, en especial el control que es muy preciso. Te recomiendo que si te da bajadas de frame le bajes la calidad porque es imposible acabar este juego dandote tirones.
 
asterissco

74 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
20.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
Первое что приходит в голову, когда начинаешь играть в DeadCore, это - Вау, впечатления игра дает, просто невероятные, местами захватывает дух.
Графика здесь очень приятная и довольно таки красивая, тем более что это инди.
Звук, он здесь ну просто на высоте, крутая музыка в самые крутые моменты, завтавляет продвигаться по уровню с бешеной скокоростью.
Головоломки, весьма интересно и очень классно сделаны.
Сама задумка игры, забраться как можно выше, по башне, которая появилась из ниоткуда, здесь нужно очень много прыгать и стрелять по всяким предметам, которые дают возможность тебе либо подняться, либо наоборот.
В целом игра просто супер.
10/10.

2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 octobre 2014
The game pretty much exactly lives up to what you would expect from it. It's fast, it requires you to think quickly and act quickly but not to a level it get's really frustrating.

The artwork, well you either hate it or you love it. It's very simplistic with neon like effects at the same textures over and over again. But who gives 2 ♥♥♥♥♥ about that anyway, the game is beautiful in many aspects. The music fits too, which ingame is much more ambient than the trailer(really didn't like the music there so that's a good thing too(piss dnb)).

Few things you're not going to find in this game:
->A good storyline. There is one, and it consists of logs to clear up your lost memory(doesn't get more original than that hur dur). They aren't awfully well written either. I just looked at them and was like 'mmwyeah lets ignore those' lol

->Puzzles that require more than 2 braincells. It's just not a thinking game. Not to be confused with Portal, which has a somewhat similar style

->Enemies that are actually a treat to you. lol the enemies are probably the worst thing so far. They're just ''kamikaze cubes''(it's worse than it sounds though) and they're extremely predictably placed over the map. They've got a different color than regular cubes so you can just pick them off immediately. Somewhat saddening, but I didn't really need enemies in this game anyway.

Later on there're some more advanced enemies which I won't spoil. But they aren't really anything either, they're all pretty uninteresting by design(to me at least)

What you can expect however is:
->Some neat-o floating sky platform-world which makes as much sense as the idiot who came up with the idea of giving this game a '' storyline ''

->Smooth gameplay, apart from some minor pointers like getting stuck on the edge of some cubes here and there

->Clever level design

->The level design actually rewards you if you decide to go for an alternative route, which there're suprisingly many of.

->Some damn sweet and fitting sounds. Including the music

I mean for 40 euros this game might've been really dubious in more than 1 way. But for 10 euro, ah hell naw boii. You better get this, it's great.
 
Ambiguous winkyface
3
27 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
9.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2015
Les pour (+):
  • Graphismes et ambiance très réussis
  • Gameplay précis, motivant et très bien pensé évoluant au fur et à mesure de la progression
  • Jeu très motivant qui vous donnera toujours envie d'aller plus loin
  • Difficulté très bien dosée pour les habitués de Die&Retry (vous fera rager juste ce qu'il faut)
  • Le jeu fait des efforts pour s'éloigner d'un bête "couloir" en proposant plusieurs chemins pour obtenir un même objectif, à vous d'être inventif

Les contre (-):
  • Quelques bugs peuvent forcer de recommencer un niveau (checkpoint buggé, passages dont les mécanismes ne fonctionnent pas comme ils le devraient et bloquent la progression,...)
  • Les sauts sur des petites plateformes manquent de précision, il est très difficile de bien jauger sa hitbox

Notes supplémentaires (+/-):
  • Aucun scénario. Pour un jeu de ce genre c'est inutile, mais c'est à souligner si pour vous c'est important
  • Si, comme moi, vous n'êtes pas doué en fps, notez qu'il faut avoir un minimum de skill en visée rapide
  • La durée de vie du mode histoire est de ~4h en découverte si vous ne cherchez pas à refaire le jeu pour parfaire vos scores et débloquer les secrets ni à traverser les niveaux speedruns, ce qui est peu; il s'agit clairement d'un jeu à score/speedrun ce qu'il faut prendre en compte
  • Le rocket jump est très mal fichu à moins de comprendre parfaitement comment le faire fonctionner -ce qui n'est pas mon cas-, heureusement il n'est pas nécessaire pour finir le jeu.
  • Certains passages sont très flou, il est parfois difficile de savoir où aller (surtout sur le 4ème niveau et ses passages à gravité inversée) et les ennemis qui vous poussent de partout n'aident pas pour chercher, mais majoritairement, vous ne serez que rarement perdu.

Au final...
Un bon "petit" jeu indépendant très réussi et étonnament -pour ma part- très jouissif. Fan de die&retry mais peu de fps, ce mélange des 2 genres m'a bien surpris et s'est avéré très agréable à découvrir. L'adrénaline offerte par le jeu donne envie d'y retourner pour améliorer ses scores, en tout cas si vous accrochez.
Très sceptique au début, j'ai finalement beaucoup apprecié alors que je ne suis ni un super bon joueur, et surtout pas de fps, ni un speedrunner, je recommande donc volontier ce jeu, en prenant en compte les notes ci-dessus.
 
Surt
0

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
6.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
Fast, precise, with a well balanced learning curve. The Leveldesign makes the movements exhilarating. You will rejoice when clearing several sections without a stop.

DeadCore fuses the needforspeed pleasure of Trackmania, the precision and nonstop pace of golden FastFPSs, and the instinctive and quicktolearn leveldesign of Portal2.
The audio/Musical layer of minimalist electro is highly dynamic : it gives the beat to your bloodcells and encourages you to keep at it when you're struggling on a section.

On top of that, the technical work is flawless : it gives high framerates, a wide and adjustable FoV, and amazing visuals !

Also, you can turn the game into a race and battle on the leaderboards.

***********************
Français :
Rapide, précis, courbe d'apprentissage bien dosée ! Le leveldesign rend les mouvements jouissifs. Et on jubile quand on arrive à enchainer les sections sans s'arrêter.

DeadCore combine les effets grisants de trackmania Stadium, la vitesse de mouvements ainsi que la précision des fastFPS, le level design instinctif et instructif de Portal.
Et une couche audio/musicale électro minimaliste est très interactive : elle donne le rythme et encourage à insister quand on bute sur une section.

Et en plus la réalisation technique est sans faute et visuellement c'est beau et impressionant ! FOV Modifiable !

Si en plus vous aimez un minimum les challenge, tous les niveaux sont chronométrés et vous pourrez vous mesurer aux chronos de tous les autres joueurs.
 
Vanlock - Bottle Angel
1,324 produits enregistrés
3
24 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2015
Bereits der Trailer zu DeadCore machte mich ziemlich neugierig und entgegen meiner Skepsis hält das Spiel auch wirklich was der Trailer verspricht.

Es gilt einen gigantischen Turm zu erklimmen. Der Weg dorthin ist übersäht mit Hindernissen, Fallen, Wachrobotern, Laserstrahlen und einigen Rätseln. Ein riesiger Hindernisparcours also, den es mit geschickten Sprüngen und Kombinationen zu schlagen gilt. Ein falscher Sprung und der freie Fall ist garantiert. Am Anfang ist DeadCore ziemlich einfach, das kommt einem aber natürlich noch nicht so vor. Man kommt aber gut voran und mehr als 5 Versuche sind kaum bei einem Abschnitt notwendig. Wie einfach die ersten Abschnitte sind stellt sich jedoch heraus je höher man den Turm erklimmt.

Ich habe mich manchmal bei dem Gedanken erwischt „Das ist jetzt nicht euer ernst, oder?“, wenn ich vor einem Abschnitt stand und den Weg vor mir sah. Nach ein wenig herumprobieren weiß man aber immer, was zu tun ist. Das richtige Timing für die Sprung- und Aktivierungskombos zu finden ist dann allerdings schon schwieriger.

Aufgepeppt wird das Gameplay durch frische Ideen. Neben der Gefahr herunterzufallen gibt es schießwütige Wachroboter, lästige Moskito-Drohnen (nach deren Stich man zeitweise die Laser nicht mehr erkennen kann) und unzählige Laser und Wände, die sich oftmals auch noch bewegen. Sehr innovativ und richtig cool finde ich im späteren Verlauf die Gravitationsfelder, die es einem erlauben an Wänden oder Decken zu laufen. Dadurch eröffnen sich neue Wege, aber auch neue Fallen sind garantiert.

DeadCore bringt den Erstspieler jedoch viele Male an seine Grenzen. Ohne Zähne zusammenbeißen und Ehrgeiz gewinnt man hier keinen Blumentopf. Die Savepunkte sind jedoch recht moderat platziert, der Neueinstieg nach einem Fehlversuch ist ziemlich fix und es entsteht ein richtig schnelles Spielgefühl. Auch wenn ein Abschnitt mal etwas länger dauert, es gibt immer mehrere Wege, die einen zum Ziel bringen. Nachdem ich an einer Stelle viele Male an einer sich bewegenden Röhre mit Lasergittern gescheitert bin, bin ich einfach mal auf die Idee gekommen außen auf die Röhre zu springen und sämtlich Gitter einfach zu umgehen. Ja, manchmal kann es doch so einfach sein, wenn man viele Male gescheitert ist. Oftmals ist aber auch Glück dabei, gutes Reaktionsvermögen natürlich vorausgesetzt. ;) Abgerundet wird das Ganze durch einen Speedrun-Modus, in dem man seine Bestzeit eines jeden geschafften Abschnitts der Solo-Kampangne mit anderen vergleichen kann. Abschnitte wiederholen und schneller werden geht natürlich auch.

DeadCore ist für mich ein echter Überraschungstitel. Stimmungsvolle Musik und die mystische Umgebung des geheimnisvollen Turms sorgen für Spannung bis zum Ende. Für Leute die gern „Climb-Games“ spielen, in denen der Weg die eigentliche Herausforderung ist, bietet DeadCore genau das Richtige. Alle anderen, die sich womöglich einen Portal-Ableger oder einen reinrassigen Shooter vorstellen, sollten die Finger davon lassen.

Von meiner Seite her ist DeadCore aber auf jeden Fall empfehlenswert! Auch wenn das Ende ziemlich kurz geraten ist.. ;(

29. Juni um 18:12 Uhr freigeschaltet
Die Spitze
Schließe den Geschichte-Modus ab.
 
neXus

You hate it
You love it
You rage quit
You play for hours on end
You struggle to beat once
You finish your fifth time in 45 mins
You can't beat a stage in under 5 mins
You destroyed all the devolper times
You lose an hour
and another
its 12:00 am

Honestly one of my favorite games. This is the game if you are a speedrunner.

Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2015
仕掛けを起動させる銃を駆使して塔を上へ上へと上っていくゲーム。

結構難易度が高いので1週目はひたすらミスを繰り返しながら進んでいくことになる
チェックポイントがこまめにある安心設計なのでどんどん死んでどんどんやり直して欲しい
ルートはいくつもあり早さを求めて難しい道を行くもよし、確実に進める道を行くもよし。自分にあったルートを選べる

さぁ、1週終わったという所でもう1度やってみると1週目とはまったく違ったプレイができる
1週目では中盤からしか使えなかったダッシュを華麗に使いこなして駆け抜けていくのは大変気持ちのいいものです...
取り残したパワーアップアイテムやログを集めるのも楽しい

ポータルとかcloudbuiltとか好きな人にオススメの一品

Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2014
Well designed all around, but horribly, horribly frustrating.
I enjoyed the first few levels, but doing the same challenge 40 times because it takes millimeter-precission to complete is just not something I want to spend my time on.
The game has some great potential, and shines at the moments where it forces you to act fast and improvise, but a small number of insanely hard gauntlets stops the flow of the excellent platforming dead in its tracks.
Would recommend, but you need to understand what you´re buying, and like a serious challenge. Certainly not a game for everyone. Not for me, for instance.

Recommandé
19.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2014
Si je devais retenir un jeu de 2014 et en faire mon GOTY, j'hésiterais fortement entre TRI et DeadCore.

Et au final, DeadCore remporterait probablement la palme.

TRI est excellent, DeadCore frise le parfait. Alors tant qu'à y être, autant mettre hors du chemin ce qui me dérange : le niveau 4. Pas qu'il soit mauvais hein. Techniquement parlant, il est juste ignoble bien comme il faut - autant dire adorable. C'est juste que la tempête qui y fait rage semble tellement étrangère au reste du jeu, où les visuels se suivent et forment un ensemble cohérent, que j'ai même parfois du mal à y voir une partie du jeu.

Ensuite... c'est tout. Non vraiment. Je sais que certains n'ont pas apprécié les passages à gravité modifiée, ce n'est pas mon cas. Certes, ils ralentissent le rythme du jeu, mais c'est une autre forme de ces twitch-puzzles dans lesquels DeadCore prend son bain en se délectant et en faisant de petits bruits à connotation sexuelle vaguement répugnants à l'idée de ce qu'il va infliger au joueur. Autant dire que ça se tient.

Pour le reste... Oui, DeadCore est affreusement court. Du moins si on est du genre à jeter son jeu comme un Kleenex avant même d'en avoir fait le tour. Qu'est-ce à dire ? Simple : une "partie" de DeadCore, c'est un cycle. Un cycle, c'est la traversée laborieuse et douloureuse des cinq niveaux qui le composent. Un "bon" cycle, c'est moins d'une heure. Un premier cycle moyen, c'est trois à cinq heures.

Ajoutez un camion d'unlocks. Maintenant ajoutez deux fins, dont une dépend desdits unlocks. Planquez les unlocks dans des coins de plus en plus vicelards des différents tableaux. Ajoutez la possibilité de refaire les tableaux seuls ou dans leur ensemble (donc par cycle ou individuellement pour ceux qui suivent). Ajoutez dans les unlocks des sparks, donc des bouts de tableaux. Faites deux versions de ces sparks : une version individuelle et une version "cycle". Ajoutez un mode Speedrun dans lequel vous pouvez refaire les tableaux des cycles et les sparks, de manière individuelle, et avec des temps dev à battre qui vous paraîtront dans un premier temps impossibles. Ajoutez encore dans les unlocks, en plus des inévitables logs et musiques, des devlogs qui s'apparentent plus à des easter eggs qu'autre chose et des améliorations pour les unlocks que vous ne pourrez pas rater lors de votre premier cycle.

Tout à coup, la durée de vie du jeu monte en flèche. Il doit y avoir, pour le joueur acharné mais pas obsédé, quelque chose comme une vingtaine ou une trentaine d'heures à passer dans le monde de DeadCore. Rallongez la sauce si vous êtes un grand malade des succès et des scoreboards.

Tout cela est bel et bon, mais le jeu, alors ? Bah c'est simple. Si vous avez déjà joué à DeadLock, vous avez déjà une vague idée de ce qui vous attend. Vague, parce que le jeu a mûri et s'il se ressemble toujours, on a ici la différence entre un 7DFPS et un jeu fini dans toute sa splendeur.

Si vous n'y avez jamais joué... Y'a deux types de joueurs dans ce monde : les casu et les autres. Si suer sang et eau c'est pas votre truc, fuyez comme la peste. SI vous aimez cette relation conflictuelle entre un jeu qui vous en veut à mort et exige de vous de peaufiner votre gameplay sans fin et un joueur qui oscille entre la rage et l'acharnement, vous êtes ici chez vous.

C'est visuellement accrocheur (à l'exception peut-être du fameux niveau 4, donc, question de goût). La musique est juste terrible et avec les unlocks, vous n'avez pas fini d'en bouffer. Le gameplay est aux petits oignons (même si le rocket jump est plutôt chatouilleux). Le style est unique. La jouabilité est presque parfaite. Les puzzles sont exigeants, parfois jusqu'au ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, mais jamais impossibles. Bref, il n'y a strictement rien à jeter dans DeadCore.

Les niveaux sont par contre actuellement (nous sommes le 15/11/2014) exploitables à des degrés divers, n'espérez donc pas atteindre le haut du classement d'un claquement de doigts (ou même de manière totalement legit). Mais aux dernières nouvelles 5 Bits y travaille. Et même sans ça, c'est déjà un tel plaisir de se frotter aux temps des devs qu'il n'y a pas de quoi pleurnicher ; il y a déjà tant et plus à faire sans devoir en prime s'arrêter à ce détail.

GOTY 2014, donc. De justesse vu sa date de sortie, mais bien mérité. Et en prime c'est français.

Bon, comment on applique quatre "oui" à "recommandez-vous ce jeu" ?
 
Hyeron
3,478 produits enregistrés
2

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
23.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2015
//Сделал 100% ачивок, но обзор оставлю каким он и был изначально.

Изумительная картинка, потрясающая атмосфера и разнообразные задачи - то, что может понравиться и завлечь игроков в эту игру, но для тех, кто еще лет 7 назад в ксе прыгал кридз карты (kz_) или просто любит кинуть себе вызов и испытать свою выдержку, сконцентрировавшись на нужных действиях - это больше, чем очередной speed-ранер.
Самый кайф получаешь тогда, когда, на ходу, интуитивно, с первого раза, за доли секунд, выполняешь правильные действия, не зная заранее что будет дальше.
Здесь куча секреток, которые открывают новые, значительные части уровней, сюжетные записи-логи, музыкальные треки и улучшения оружия. На протяжении всей игры я думал и колебался над определением сложная ли она, но каждая задача сложна лишь в первый раз, а после проходится достаточно привычно.
В игре, в принципе, сложно отметить какие либо объективные недостатки, разве что можно было сделать более впечатляющим сюжет и разнообразить врагов. За 4 часа игры произошло всего 5 загрузочных экранов, что влияло на атмосферу еще более положительно, а разрешение экрана меняется прямо в меню без каких либо прогрузок вообще! За это отдельный респект, т.к., когда видишь сообщение в играх вышедших в последние годы, что игру для смены разрешения нужно перезапустить, то немного оxeреваешь от рукожoпости некоторых разрабов в 201? годах.
В отличии от других ранеров, как, например, CloudBuilt, здесь все более солидно, понятно и серъезно. Не удивлюсь, если разрабы и вправду были 1337 джамперами в ксе, т.к. помню много похожих популярных карт, например, с высочайшим деревом, на которое нужно часами забираться и т.п.
Проще говоря, то, что игра обещала и то, что я лично ожидал от нее, она дает сполна - 8.5/10
 
JacobyDakota

Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2015
酷炫的科幻世界。
优秀的关卡设计。
一流的背景音乐。
可收集要素被设定为少量角色升级与大量秘密CG文档和原声音乐。

没有动态模糊。
泛光系统优化不够好。
阴影开低比开中还卡是几个意思？

这是一款酷到没朋友的游戏。
与其用语言形容，不如你们亲自看宣传视频和截图。
正如画面中所示那样，酷炫到没话说，动作感也是一流。
而且还是独立游戏，9.5分真不算高。
顺带一提难度比起传送门系列可是只高不低，还有恐高症慎玩233。

Recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2014
The graphics and sound is really cool in this game, but what makes it really a good game is, that it doesn't hold your hand or shoves you along, just so that you feel good. If you beat this game, it is because of your own skill, not because the developers put in a hundred safety lines just to pull you along. You have to be very precise in your jumping and shooting otherwise you will fail. If you fail, you must try harder. As simple as that.

Playing DeadCore reminds me a lot of the old times playing Quake 3 or getting all the secrets in Painkiller, just without enemies. A definite recommendation to all who like FPS style games with fast paced graphics. I'm really glad that I found this game by accident during a sale because I haven't heard about it before.

10/10
 
[gg] Drill Instructor

24.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2014
I cannot reccommend this game enough, don't let this slip under your radar!

It's punishingly difficult at times, with absoltuely zero hand-holding or easing-into-difficulty, but it's also amazingly engaging and fun: you never feel overwhelmed, or as if things are just pointlessly/needlessly difficult and rage inducing. Instead the controls are tight, the game runs super well, all the challenges, while often tough have that magic element of fun that makes you grin ear-to-ear, flex your hands again and dive right back in to see if you can *just get that timing right*, or maybe even try a new path or tactic.

The music is also great-great by itself, and the perfect complement to the artstyle of the game.
The story, super mysterious (so far) is intriguing and engaging.

Downsides:
  • My hands hurt
  • I'm going to be tired tomorrow due to staying up all night playing this.
    [\list]

    10/10 would recommend.
 
FridgeSeal

Recommandé
39.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2017
TL;DR: DarkSouls the platformer.

I'll put the most important point first: THIS IS A HARDCORE PLATFORMER/ SPEED RUN GAME. IF YOU DON'T LIKE THE IDEA OF FLYING THROUGH DEATHTRAPS AT A BREAKNECK PACE, YOU PROBABLY WON'T ENJOY THE GAME.

For those of you still reading: Deadcore bases its gameplay around high speed platforming over a bottomless void. There are things that will try to push you to your death, there are things that will try to push you into laser grids, there are things that will try to flat out murder you.

Your weapon is a switch gun, which can deactivate enemies and activate objects in the environment. While it is entirely possible to take this game slowly and explore (there are rewards for exploration, in the form of lore, soundtrack and upgrade unlocks) the main goal is to find the fastest way to the exit possible.
To this end, all the levels have unlockable alternate paths that offer faster (and harder) routes to the finish line, giving a high degree of replayability. There is also a series of bonus challenges for when you complete the story.

Basic gameplay consists of running, jumping, shooting stuff to switch it on or off (enemies, jump pads, laser grids, gravity fields etc.). All these elements are brought together smoothly, and while there isn't always a direct explanation for what every new feature does they're quickly demonstrated through level design.

The art design is very thematic, and frankly somewhat bland- there isn't much variation (the main levels have general themes in terms of lighting and sense of space but no other distinguishing visual traits), but in all it helps build an air of focus to the world- this is a world designed to be viewed at very high speed, not strolled through.

The sound design is somewhat mediocre; while some of the music is enjoyable, I found most tracks to be rather dull and uninspired. Atmospherically the game is very quiet, beyond the whoosh of air passing by or the sounds of enemies there isn't much in the way of ambience, although I personally liked this.

Overall, this game offers a focused, challenging experience that will reward those who respect and appreciate it, and cause those that don't to write angry steam reviews about how hard it is abloo bloo bloo.
 
TwoHyenasInATrenchCoat
176 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 octobre 2014
Deadcore feels to me like it combines some of the best aspects of the first-person gameplay from Valve's Portal titles while at the same time incorporating the acrophobia-inducing platforming featured in Coilworks' Cloudbuilt. In the short period of time that I've spent playing the game, I have to say that it's as fun as it is beautiful. If ever I wanted to play a game using the Oculus Rift, this would be it.

Recommandé
12.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2015
Don't let the speedrunning nature of the game discourage you, it can still be enjoyed even by old people with slower reflexes. Some patience and practice can give a very rewarding feeling everytime you hit the next checkpoint.

The game at it's core is an obstacle course, where the main goal is travelling from point A to B through lethal traps and pitfalls.
Early on the game teaches you that you can use and exploit any object in the physics-defying architecture around you, sometimes even using a trap itself to propel yourself forward. This aspect of Deadcore adds a puzzle element to the whole experience, so it's not just a twitch-based runner. Combining the puzzle aspect with the branching paths in each level the game lets you carve your own trail opting for a safer or a faster route. Even though there are no walls, no ceiling or even a floor most of the times, you can still be creative in how you progress through the labyrinthine levels, since there are multiple ways to crosss each obstacle. The player can be slow and methodical at some parts figuring out the way for himself or use timing and platforming skills at others. At first you will only be able to traverse a basic path as the developer intended, but the more tools and power-ups you unlock, the more the game itself opens up to you.

Deadcore also rewards exploration and pushes the player to search for 3 different types of collectibles. First type unlocks more bits of the story helping you to understand your environment and it's purpose. Second type unlocks more music tracks, ranging from ambient to D'n'B and jungle beats. The third type opens up completely new paths in the levels, adding even more complexity and replayability.

The main and only downside that comes to mind is the game's lengh. Takes about 10 hours for a slow casual player like myself to make 2 full cycles of the game and unlock the "secret" ending. After that point, any replayability is based on speedrunning and ranking up in the player lists, or achievement hunting if that's your thing (all of achievements easily feasible).

In summary: Deadcore is a butt-clenching adrenaline fix with a unique gameplay experience, part puzzler part speed runner.
 
Arbs
4
64 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
7.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2015
Deadcore is a very unique game, but if i had to compare it to something, it would most likely be Portal franchise.

In essence, it is a very, very difficult and demanding first-person platformer based on combinations of few monumental platforming skills - double jump and dash. You also use a weapon, but game involves very little combat, as your enemies are just mechanical traps which the weapon disables for a brief moment. Game also features some mind-bending gravity shifting & jump-pad mechanics, which only add to the overall flavor of super tough experience.

You have to keep in mind - this game was designed with speed-running in mind. Given, i beat the game in 8 hours and my actual run time not taking into account all trial-and-error was 4:11 hours, you can see how much repetition can the game require from someone with not that decent hand-eye coordination. However, with perserverance you can definitely beat it and the pay-off, while confusing, in the end is worth it. Despite all the frustration, i do see it as a great, unique gaming experience and i do recommend it you try it.

+ Graphics - very, very cool and in places (especially epilogue level) breathtaking.
+ Level design - though some checkpoints are too scarcely placed it is manageable.
+ Sound design - very good, all actions you perform give adequate feedback and add to the mysterious sci-fi atmosphere.
+ Performance - first i thought it wasn't that great, but it was, turns out my integrated and dedicated GPUs were fighting about this game. However there are few notable locations in game where the overwhelming amount of enemy-trap thingies and visual filters murder the fps. That does not hinder game progress however.
+- Story - depends on how you look at it, there are logs scattered across the levels that tell the lore, but i did not find the story to be a significant part of the game. I will, however, look up all the possible endings cause i don't believe i can achieve them myself.
- Music - i personally didn't like that drum & bass here at all and found it a little unfitting, but perhaps my slow pace had something to do with that.

Overall score - 9/10. A great purchase, definitely not only on sale price. For a completionist there's more than enough collectible hunting and time trials.
 
forest fire

14.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 juin 2015
I just 100%'d the game (steam achievements) so I'm going to try and write a review. Yay!

DeadCore is a fantastic FPS parkour puzzle speedrunner game. The objective is to reach the top of a mysterious tower by running, jumping, and using your trusty Switch Gun to activate and/or deactivate switches, enemies, moving walls, and gravity fields, while trying not to get disintegrated by lasers or fall to your death (which is by lasers most of the time anyway because a floor of lasers follows you upwards whenever you reach a new checkpoint). Most of the enemies don't actually kill you, but the turrets and troopers launch you away (often into lasers) and the mosquitoes slow you down (so you can be killed by moving lasers).

The whole game can be speedrun in less than an hour, but it takes several hours to finish the first time, familiarise yourself with the levels, learn some speedrun strats, and find the hidden Sparks to unlock the game's true ending.

+ The controls are simple and responsive: WASD to move, E to boost, M1 to shoot, M2 to aim (personally didn't find much point in aiming), and M3 to blast.
+ The feeling of speed is very nicely communicated (did I describe that right?)
+ The graphics are very nice and sleek-looking, even on very low (;_; my computer)
+ The levels are well designed, with some tough challenges, often with multiple paths, and encourage a bit of exploration to find the collectables
+ Speedrun mode! Leaderboards! Beat the devs!
+ Beating the dev times, completing a paticularly difficult section of a level, finding short cuts, finding hidden collectables, and just being launched high into the air and boosting around, gives a lot of satisfaction.
+/- The difficulty ramps up quite a bit, and in the later levels you will die many times to the challenges. This is a personal thing, I enjoyed the difficulty but some people won't.
- Story doesn't really make sense. Or maybe I'm too literal-minded.
- You have no body and it's a bit hard to know what your hitbox is going to do

Overall a great game, I highly recommend it to fans of first person parkour or speedrun games, and people who like a challenge.
 
a banana
292 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
24.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 janvier 2016
Summary:
Deadcore was a simple yet well crafted platforming game that required high precision and skill to complete. The game feels very polished and well rounded. The story is pretty bare, which is fine because that isn't the game's main focus at all. The main goal is to get to the top of the tower using coordination, puzzle solving, and some minor FPS elements to disable enemies or traps. The campaign doesn't take too long, however speedrunning the levels can get very addicting. This game uses tight controls and good level design (most of the time) to provide an enjoyable experience to the player, casual or hardcore.

Pros:
  • Good graphics and world design to emmerse the player in the game. While it's nothing phenominal, it's definitely above average.
  • The puzzles and level design provide for entertaining gameplay and feel very fluid despite being very challenging at times.
  • Tight controls make the platforming feel fair and fun to play.
  • Speedrunning modes to put your skills to the test. It compares you on the global leaderboard and on your friendslist leaderboard.
  • The extra pickups are very well hidden and are a great addition for completionists.

Neutral:
  • The music is decent and adds to the atmosphere of the game. While it isn't the best soundtrack I've ever heard, it definitely fits the genre and helps keep a steady rhythm while you're playing.

♥♥♥♥:
  • The enemy placement can be a bit frustrating in the final few levels.

Overall:
8.2/10
 
TwerpOco

Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2015
空中制御しまくりのFPSジャンプアクション
セール中に300円代で購入したけどこの値段なら間違いなく良ゲー

長所
割りとグラが綺麗
基本思った通りに動くので操作に関しては一切ストレス無し
難しいパズル要素無し
ストーリーモードでは快適な即やり直し可能
至るところにショートカット出来るルートあり


短所
普通に酔った
重力スイッチ出てから急に難しく感じる・・そして余計酔った
スピードランでのリスタートがあまり快適ではない
お邪魔ロボット達が非常に煩わしい時がある
エイム下手なおじさんには難易度高かった
何故かおま値


総評

操作性が良くショートカットもあるので完全一本道という事もなく
安売りの時に買って楽しむには十分な出来だと思う
何より高所を飛び回る感覚はなかなかに爽快

酔いやすい人と死に覚えゲーが嫌いな人は要注意

Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2014
攀爬漂浮在空中的通天巨塔，在超大尺度，充满各种机关的地图中进行空间体验，画面精美，非常有趣的（极限运动？）游戏。

虽然只玩到第二大关，但是已经感受到鬼畜的难度了~~下面看到有把它和传送门比较的评论。仅就难度而言，这个远大于传送门。游戏中起跳后滞空时间很长，而且可以在空中控制自己移动的方向，而传送门在空中按下方向键对运动方向影响不大。所以当面对一些需要连续动作才能通过的关卡，传送门里只要关注手里的枪朝哪打洞就行，而这个游戏就必须兼顾各个方面，起跳时机，方向控制，射击需要激活或是关闭的机关，射击来捣乱的敌人。。。

游戏有五大关卡，每关中通过收集隐藏物品来解锁小的独立关卡，隐藏物品在常规路线上看不到或是摸不着的地方，所以可能需要反复探索。游戏中每隔一段距离会有检查点，抵达检查点就可以返回去作死找其他路线和物品了。因为是“爬”的游戏，你甚至可以纵身跳回这关开始的位置。开发者好像在社区中提到短时间里不会有地图编辑器，所以已目前有的关卡数目，10刀值不值就仁者见仁了，反正现在打折只要4刀。或许以后会有DLC增加关卡数目。

游戏很棒，至少很对我的胃口，至于后面关卡的难度会不会让我放弃，变成喜加一还不得而知。。。但是缺少重力感，少了一点身处云端摇摇欲坠的感觉。
 
☐ Fried Tofu ☐ ❶
682 produits enregistrés
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
30.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2014
パズルアクション。
パズルよりもアクション重視のスポーツ系。

二段ジャンプやダッシュ、ギミックを利用・解きながらゴールを目指すゲーム。
パズル要素に難易度は全くない。ひたすらアクションに技量が求められる。

操作性が素晴らしい。ストレス一切無く気持ちよく飛び回れる。
空中でも方向転換して素直に行ける。
滞空時間が長いため、飛びながら向かいたい方向も考えられる。

ストーリーモードは５面しかない。
しかし一つ一つのステージに相当なボリュームがあるため５面の数字以上に楽しめる。
とはいっても初回で２～４時間程度で終わるため、人によってはボリューム不足に感じるかも。
スピードランが用意されておりタイムが競えるようになっているので、より洗練させていくことが好きな人の方がオススメ。
ストーリーモード自体の単純なクリア難易度はそこそこ。
極めて難しいわけではないが簡単では決してない。ただ理不尽な配置が少なめで好印象。
物語性はほぼ無し。

クリアするだけでも楽しめますが、タイムを競う、動きを極める人の方がより楽しめるかも。
 
kune
0
20 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2015
So, Deadcore kind of appealed to me because it seemed like a fun puzzler in the style of the Portal series, it looked very futuristic/cyber and the overall graphics were very appealing. Additionally there's this whole mystery with "What's on the summit of the construct?!" -- these thingies always totally suck me in.

It's really a game that lets you jump around a lot with a very interesting mix of jump'n'run finger agility tasks and at the same time some nice puzzle elements. You get a few different abilities to play with (double jump, air dash, and the switch gun with two shooting modes, essentially) and you progress only via checkpoints after a big puzzle or a small set of shorter sequences. There isn' a lot of story or anything that would immerse you deeply. You can find some logs on the way to uncover a few flavor texts adding to the experience but in the end it's always about getting up and wondering what's up there. Besides the hidden logs you can find a few upgrades for your abilities (more ammo between checkpoints, higher juming, faster dash recharge, etc.) and some music tracks.

For me, as someone who can be an aweful jump-precision dyslexic, the game took almost five hours in total for one playthrough with not nearly all upgrades and logs. Later playthroughs will be faster since you already got a bunch of upgrades and more experience. Also, once found, you will keep all your abilities even if you replay some levels which opens up new pathways to progress. Other than that there's not a whole lot of replay value unless you want to do speed runs and fight for a spot on the leaderboards.


The Yummies
  • Great price for the amount of hours you play it
  • Good graphical presentation
  • Good level design
  • Nice ambient sounds
  • Cool enemy types
  • Basically no bugs encountered aside from maybe two avoidable issues at certain points
  • The option menue allows you to set the depth of field value so you can kind of regulate the felt pace/speed for yourself
The level design is cool and futuristic. It's super open and you can always see past levels below you which gives the game sometimes a continuing fun-house experience (interestingly enough my fear of heights never kicked in while looking down). The sound blends in nicely into the graphics and the setting overall. You don't have super loud stepping sounds, all rocket jumps from platforms basically blend into the surrounding ambient humming and there's nothing that will really piss you off. The only sounds that stand out are the different kinds of drones that will be in your way; they all have very distinct sounds that will make you go 'uh-oh' by the end of the game.

Speaking of the drones: What I like about them is that there's only a single kind of drone that can actually kill you in the end. All the other kinds of drones are just there to poke you and piss you off: One lets you see your perception of some colours so you won't see deadly laser barriers anymore, one just bumps into you and shoots you off a cliff, etc. They are highly annoying but you usually get a chance to safe yourself if you react fast enough.

The level design is mostly very good and there are enough ways to build a huge amount of interesting tasks with varying degree of puzzle factor and agility requirements. In a lot of cases you get to choose a super fast reaction route that can be very unforgiving or a path that makes you train a certain rhythm of actions to reach your goal. But most of all levels focus very much on a certain kind of agility training, so there is not a lot of real puzzles left (although I still had to stop and think at times on how the devs thought this will be possible to do at all).


The Bummers
  • No controller support
  • It can definitely make you rage-quit a couple of times
  • Background music ruins the cool ambience sometimes (unless you love drum&bass I guess)
  • Very bland story/additional information about the whole construct
  • Some tasks/puzzles are not clearly laid out
  • Sometimes the checkpoints are just put at stupid spots on the map
I was a bit disappointed by the lack of background music. Most of the time you don't hear a lot (which might've been a good sign because the music blends in but in the end it was just nothing noteworthy there to listen to) and when you hear it you want more than just the two minutes of it. Also, the music is kind of hit and miss. Given that I totally despise most of drum & bass I still found some very nice parts in some songs in the game but a lot of times I was kind of bored or annoyed.

The other thing is how hugely disappointing the mystery of the summit is. I mean, there could've been something but in the end you reach the thing, jump into a white hole and then it's over. There is no explanation whatsoever aside from a cutscene that basically just shows the whole construct moving a bit and then it fades out. The logs are just so horribly written that I didn't bother to read most of them really carefully since it was either some weird monologue about some of the tasks you are going through (and some of the drones/abilites) or a dialogue that mostly just talks some sensei-stuff that is utterly boring.

Finally, there is this whole rage-quitting thing a lot of people are complaining about and I kind of get it. It can be super annoying when the drone you just disabled wakes up just half a second to early or you fall down from that one doulbe-jump 'n dash sequence for the tenth time. Also, at some parts it's completely unclear how you should be progressing there without going for some healthy head-to-desk-repeat action. Also, sometimes checkpoints are coming in at a ridiculously high frequency where you just think "where was the problem here, I was just walking in a straight line?" At other times you will find yourself playing for 2-3 minutes going through an insane adrenaline rush inducing sequence that's really hard (and can let you die a couple of times) and then you respawn back at the beginnig. Some better ordering of the checkpoints might've helped here.


The Verdict
The main problem with most people playing the game is probably that they think you can play it like a Portal game. What DeadCore actually is is a side-scrolling jump and run that is played from a first-person perspective. For about 50% of the game I didn't know that myself and was at times pissed off about how some sequences are laid out. But in the end I understood that it's not about puzzles and thinking, it's very often just about running into something and figuring out the rhythm. Then you will get adrenaline rushing in your blood and after a longer sequence you land on a checkpoint, turn around, look at what you just crossed and think "Wow, how did that happen, exactly?"

Those are a lot of moments where the game shines and is super fun. At the other hand some sequences are so hard to manage or way too long that it makes you freak out and punch something Borderlands-Brick-style. But those are not most moments. It's a game with a high sense of urgency that is very real once you find a bunch of timers running inside your head on when to jump next. It's fast and keeps up a nice pace with only few moments to catch a breath. Oddly enough I found it very relaxing to play after work because of all those immense jumps, combined with the your abilities which give you a real nice sense of free movement in three dimensions.

All in all, if you're not sure about the whole rage-quitting thing wait for an 50% off or more offer but if you're into annoying jump'n'runs /and/ Portal, go for it and buy it.
 
Kub
0
17 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2014
Probably one of my top five games released in 2014. It's a shame practically nobody knows about it, it's super fun. So fun that I actually went out of my way to review it because I feel like it deserves more attention.

To sum up the game, I would say it is a speedrunning fast paced game based around mobility. If you played Dishonored and liked the blink mechanic, you'll love this.

The aesthetics, graphics, atmosphere, and soundtrack are all fantastic. The gameplay is super fast paced, but the overall pacing of the game is good. It introduces new mechanics at a good pace and doesn't overload you with information. Then, it tests you on it all.

There's a great feeling when you manage to pull off something crazy such as pulling off a crazy stunt that you think that the developers probably didn't realize you could do. But the thing is, the developers did know probably. The map design is phenomenal. Because the game takes entirely in the sky, every single thing placed is deliberate and every jump calculated. So, when you pull off that crazy jump, you know at the back of your mind that you beat the developer's challenge that you didn't even know they were challenging you to.

Deadcore is one of the few games that I've actually wanted to go back and replay. Because you unlock new mechanics and powerups, going back and replaying levels to see new areas that you can reach and collecting "sparks" (which reveal new parts of the level) is super satisfying. Beating a level five times faster than you did originally is a great experience that really shows off how much you've progressed, through mastering mechanics and unlocking the new ones.

Also, if you're looking for a good story, this game doesn't really deliver I think. The story is entirely given through text files which you can collect. I haven't really read them, so it's possible they're really good. However, I like to leave it up to my imagination to come up with an explanation for the game and I feel like reading the logs might ruin it a bit. I might be completely wrong, but just be aware that this is not really a story driven gamemode. Your goal is to get to the top, not to save the universe.

This game is almost flawless, but it is important to point out the flaws.

For one, even though almost everything in the level design is deliberate, I did manage to find a few things that I clearly was supposed to come back to later. For one, at the beginning of a certain level if you are observant enough you can find an alternate route. Getting to this route would normally require a powerup that you would unlock if you went the normal route, but you can use some of the nearby launchers to get there. Maybe this was intentional, maybe not. I did this in my first playthrough, and I was able to beat it without the pretty important powerup, as you don't actually need it for the alternate path or the rest of the game. When I finished the game and realized what had happened, I felt kind of punished for being resourceful and observant.

Secondly, similarly to the first, there was one point in the game where you could get to a "spark" (which, once again, unlocks new sections of the game which require mechanics you unlock later on) by playing around with the environment a bit. Once I got to the spark, I realized that I clearly was not supposed to be there since it was impossible for me to progress without the mechanic I hadn't unlocked. This one is a bit more forgivable since I had to go out of my way to get there and I felt like something was wrong.

Thirdly, one of the last enemies you encounter in the game feels really cheap and unpredictable and can really screw you up. For a game based around perfection and speedrunning, getting killed in a nearly unavoidable way is pretty annoying. Definitely the only parts of the game that I really disliked the design of and felt like it was more artificial difficulty than challenging.

Finally, there are some small bugs with the instadeath lasers and gravity fields. Sometimes they don't work, sometimes they're unclear, sometimes they don't reset properly. It's extremely rare when it does glitch out and typically it only glitches out at specific parts of the game, but if they get you killed when you're hauling through the level as fast as you can, it can be frustrating dying for no reason.

Anyways, if I had to give this game a rating I would probably give it a 9.5/10. It's almost completely flawless and easily worth the $10. One of the most fun games I've had. Provides a solid challenge while being fair almost the entire time, in a way similar to Dark Souls almost.
 
Dum
711 produits enregistrés
0
14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Very fun platformer and shooter (no gore). Easy to learn yet increases difficulty steadily.
 
Cyb3r 2th

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 septembre 2015
バンナムがSteamでパブリッシングしてるゲームで、そのうち日本で買えるものはF2Pのアレ含めて5作しか無いが、その貴重な5作のうちの一つ

とはいえダクソ2やProjectCarsと同様デベロッパは外部なんだがな！

とりあえず(多分)5面中3面までクリア、収集要素もあるものの現状あまり気にせず進めてる。

FPSスタイルで二段ジャンプや空中ダッシュ、ステージのギミックを作動/停止できる銃を駆使しながら謎の塔(?)を登っていくゲーム、

「人を撃たないFPS」という点ではPORTALに近いがあちらはアクションパズルなのに対してこちらは完全にアクションゲームであり素早いアクションやエイムが要求され結構な高難易度になっているが、リトライの待ち時間が少なく快適で、またレベルデザインがよく出来ているためギミックやアクションに慣れながら進むことが出来る。

ただ三面後半に高速で迫ってくる即死フィールドの隙間をすり抜けながら進むシチュエーションが結構あったのは頂けないかなぁ、FPSでイライラ棒とかちょっと無茶。

日本語訳はなく、日本語化も見つからなかったが、ゲーム中ではそもそも言葉自体ほぼ出ないのでゲームプレイ自体に支障はない、ただしステージ中で拾えるアイテムに文章が入ったものが有り、ストーリーを読み解くならこれを読むのは必須ぽい。


「酔う」というレビューも多少あるけど自分は酔わなかった、まあ初代Portal以外で3D酔いしたこと無いけど。


総括してセール値なら自信を持って薦められる良作アクション小品、定価でもまぁ良い気もするがこのペースでクリアできるならちょっとボリューム感に欠けるかな?
 
39raKyouko

19.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 juin 2015
Amazing 3D platformer. Traverse the beautiful world using double jump and horizontal dash. Toggle objects in the world with your gun. Avoid various obstacles and annoying enemies.

The game is difficult but not too difficult. Has frequent checkpoints.

It takes ~4 hours for the first playthrough to just reach the finish. But that's far from everything the game has to offer.

The exploration is really enjoyable. Each level is huge, and when you play them for the 2nd time you are able to find whole new branches with higher difficulty. There are also collectibles that are a challenge to hunt down.

And of course, there is the whole speedrun mode, for those who are into this.

Includes a lot of nice soundtrack.

★★★★★★★★★☆
 
BlaXpirit

33 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
2
Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2014
People keep making comparisons to Portal, so I'll just say this:

This is not Portal. This is not Portal. This is not Portal.

The entire point of the Portal series was to make games that are both challenging AND accessible to the widest possible audience. Valve tuned the levels specifically to get as many people to drop their hard earned cash as possible.

You can tell this is the case, because Portal 2 is not Portal, Only Way Harder. Even the first game pulled its punches in how far it went with the puzzles -- they wanted players to fully understand the mechanics without being overwhelmed by them.

DeadCore, on the other hand, is a game made for a very specific, very small audience: FPS speedrunners. It is not made for anybody else. The entire point of the game is for people who are already crazy skilled to show off how crazy skilled they are, and for everybody else to watch.

Note I said "watch", not "play". If you are not already someone who speedruns games, this one brick walls its difficulty starting around level 2.

It requires very precise movements, and demands twitch reflexes to pass the puzzles. It uses infinite respawns as an excuse to ambush the player with traps that cannot be avoided on the first playthrough. It makes the player (and the player's hitbox) completely invisible -- you don't even have the visual feedback of casting a shadow, so good luck navigating stacks of moving laser walls in 3D space.

It is a game that expects you to die over and over again, without any thought or consideration as to WHY you'd want to keep doing that. And why should it: if you're already committed to speedrunning a game regardless of how fun it is, then why should basic game design concepts like difficulty scaling and pacing even matter? The harder and more unfair a game is, the more you can show off.

To be clear: it is totally fine to make a game that's super difficult, and aimed at the hardest of the hardcore. But what that means in practice is that most people are going to be more entertained watching speed runs of said game, for free, on Youtube, than paying money for the experience. I actually recommend anyone who isn't a speedrunner do exactly that, spoilers be damned. If you're still interested, at least you'll have a fair idea of what you're getting into.
 
hwh6k
31
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2020
Не смотря на моё хорошее отношение к жанру платформеров в целом и от первого лица в частности, я не могу сказать, что прохождение Deadcore вызвало у меня однозначно положительные эмоций. И проблема даже не в какой-то излишней сложности, так как я не имею претензий к геймплею, заточенному на множественные попытки пройти один и тот же участок. Дело в том, какими способами эта сложность достигается и, наверное, в общем уровне продуманности и отшлифованности геймплея.

Цель нашего путешествия – забраться на высоченную башню. Зачем и для чего не понятно, сюжет отсутствует, спрятанные на уровнях записки хоть и присутствуют, но дают очень туманные представления о мотивации главного героя. Мне, честно, было не очень интересно в этом разбираться, игра в первую очередь про платформинг от первого лица.

В начале игры нам, помимо стандартных двойного прыжка и рывка вперёд, вручают специальное оружие, с помощью которого можно взаимодействовать с уровнем, в основном нажатием на «кнопки» выстрелами некими энергетическими зарядами. Также есть возможность на пару секунд обезвреживать противников и турели, которые будут активно нам мешать заниматься платформингом. Эта штука вносит хорошую долю разнообразия в игру и зачастую заставляет одновременно пытаться попасть в цель и контролировать перемещение персонажа.

DeadCore 
Une capture d'écran de DeadCore
Par : Wrong


Первые три уровня игрока откровенно балуют новыми элементами, препятствиями и нестандартными ситуациями, и я даже их с удовольствием перепрошёл повторно перед написанием обзора. Лазеры, трамплины и их различные креативные комбинации не дают заскучать, при этом сохраняя отличный баланс между сложностью и увлекательностью. Но уже тут появляются некоторые тревожные звоночки, например огромные вентиляторы, для отключения которых нужно попасть в точку на краю одной из лопастей, что жутко неудобно делать в условиях постоянного движения.

DeadCore 
Une capture d'écran de DeadCore
Par : Wrong


Когда в начале четвёртого уровня мне показали элемент, который при включении меняет гравитацию, позволяя тем самым бегать по стенам и потолкам, я по-хорошему офигел. Это оказалась действительно крутая фишка, которую разработчики обыграли на все 100%. Но, к сожалению, именно начиная с четвёртого уровня всё идёт по одному месту, к большей части новых элементов возникают большие вопросы, и происходящее в целом начинает заметно раздражать. Комбинации существующих элементов и препятствий начинают вызывать чувство мешанины, будто разработчики наполняли игру любыми идеями, что приходили им в голову, без деления на удачные и неудачные. Пропадает баланс сложности, чекпоинты могут быть в обилии расставлены на коротких простых этапах, в то время как на длинных сложных их с огнём не сыщешь. В некоторых местах из платформ образуются ступеньки, которые главный герой визуально вполне может преодолеть, но на деле это не так, приходится преодолевать прыжком. Мелочь, но смерти из-за такой ерунды вызывают злость. Появляются новые странные противники. Например, один из них может убить игрока одним выстрелом, от которого нельзя уклониться, в то время как до этого момента в игре не было смертельных противников, они просто отталкивали персонажа. Другой же управляет скопом небольших «комаров», только отключив которого, можно избавиться от всей мелочи, а выцепить его из общей кучи бывает очень трудно.

И вот из таких недоработок и странных решений состоят последние четвертый и пятый уровни. Я бы не окрасил обзор в красный цвет, если бы не тот факт, что эти два уровня занимают практически 60% игры. На основе всего вышесказанного, я просто не могу рекомендовать игру кому бы то ни было, её прохождение принесло мне не радость, а скорее раздражение, не могу гарантировать, что с вами не произойдёт такая же ситуация.
 
Wrong

Recommandé
71.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020
Deadcore a 2013 game released by a French development team called ‘5 bits games’ http://www.deadcore-game.com/team.html as a parkour 3D platformer designed especially for speed running. Plot revolves around you waking up at the bottom of a monolithic alien tower and climbing it’s 5 main story levels in the hopes of reaching the summit (level 6) to discover both its origin and meaning. Then you will discover a potential ‘True Ending’ is waiting for you and can be unlocked if you find all the sparks hidden in the many pathing’s of the previous levels.

Also hidden around are music tracks that can be discovered and unlocked for you to cater your own playlist, various upgrades that will make your speed runs and exploration easier and 10 logs that give you a very broken English, not really well thought out tease story. The French developers openly admitting that the games main focus was for speed running and with none of the developers being extremely fluent in English and the story being an afterthought, it was more slapped together quickly without really ironing out all the details and blatant contradictions.

Other than the 5 main story levels, there are an additional 13 speed run maps with all 18 maps featuring the challenge of a reasonable developer’s time to beat in order to get an extra achievement. In fact, after discovering how many hidden speed runner tricks are available to you, it’s amazing how quickly that level which originally took you 30 minutes can become shortened down to minutes, even just seconds. In fact, the current world record for the entire game is 1 minute and 26 seconds.

To help you get more enjoyment out of the game and take on those developer’s times here is a comprehensive list of speed running tricks which I personally found. By no means do I claim that this is a definitive list, it’s only the tricks I myself found. Have fun, jump around explore, test the mechanics, challenge yourself and practice, practice, practice…

Speed Running Tricks
Vidéo YouTube™: Deadcore - PC/MAC/LINUX - Basics 2/3 - Jumps & Blasts (Walkthrough Video) 
Vues : 1,440
Improve you game with this handy tutorial/walkthrough for Deadcore. Learn how to use jumps, Sparks and Blasts to climb the tower faster and to improve your performance in the Speedrun mode.


Double Jump: After 1st jump, wait half a second as you begin to descend and jump again this gives you the farthest jump you can make.

Dash: Dash will reset your velocity upwards or downwards meaning you can cut jumps short if you need to. Short bursts are faster, drawn out burst are further. Dashing in short bursts is quicker than normal walking.

Double Jump and Dash Combo: Jump first time and then use dash reaching the lowest level of the bar before completely emptying, second jump again in air and carry yourself using dash as far as you can go.

Wall clip: Dashing between 2 perpendicular walls with a certain angle will make you pass through them. This is used by speed runners in level 5 to get through the wall and into the closed off elevators. It’s how the world record is just over a minute.

Curve boost: Dash or rocket jump off of some type of curvature or slanted surface allowing you to have an extra boost upwards and forwards. Practice off level 1 the first slanted surface as you appear. You should be able to reach the top of the cylinder in a single jump.

Rocket Dash Jump: Hitting the dash button at the same time you perform a rocket jump. You literally have 1 frame = 50th of a second to get it right.

Wall Fling: Stay in contact with a wall or platform as it rotates allowing you to be flung upwards. To gain even more height, dash perpendicular to the movement of the platform during the rotation. Often used level 4.

Boost dash: Dashing and holding a dash on a jump pad, allowing for extra height. This gives a considerable amount of height, nearly as much as a super jump.

Super Jump: Jump at the same time you hit a jump pad. The jump acts like extra height. You literally can only touch the first 2 frames of the jump pad to get this right when you hit jump.

Super Dash Jump: Combining both a boost dash and super jump when you hit the first two frames gives you even a higher jump.

Mega Jump: Falling from a considerable distance away onto a jump pad then jump at the exact same time you hit the jump pad (first 2 frames). The velocity of you coming down adds up with the jump pad, allowing insanely high jumps.

Horizontal Mega Jump: Shoot the button that flips a horizontal jump pad around and be right next to where it will point, when you shoot it jump and when it turns your way, you will fly upwards insanely fast.

Horizontal Mega Jump (frame perfect): Fall from about any distance above a blast jump onto a sideways jump pad. Try and hit right in between the block (which is required for this trick, if there is none it won’t work) and the jump pad. You will go insanely high up. What happens is you clip in between the block and the jump pad, and the jump pad shoots you forward, but it will act as a curve boost.

Fan Dash: Dash around the perimeter of the fan it will give you an extra boost.

Fan Fling: Fan fling allows you to gain enormous speeds and travel in the direction the fan blows. Get close to the fan so you can feel it’s attraction, closer – the better. Pause the game and wait required amount of time. Un-pausing and you’ll see the effect. With so much speed you basically travel through any solids in the game and can easily get out of the border of the map.

Infinite Collision Climbing: Get into a corner and jump. Because of how collision climbing works – all your jumps will be higher than normal. Dash into the corner. You must dash enough to clip INTO the corner, but not enough to clip THROUGH it. The game will push you out, but since you just were in the solid, you regained your second jump. Jump and repeat.

Long Volley Snipe: Shoot a charged shot in the direction of an activation switch to activate it from a long distance away.

Checkpoint Miss: Deliberately miss checkpoints so that after you have activated a switch you can fast travel back to an earlier checkpoint instead of manually returning.

Dash Checkpoint Recharge: Dash into a checkpoint, immediately respawn and dash again. Because you respawn you immediately get your dash back, giving you a free one.

Enemy Boost: Sometimes the enemies can help you get to higher places by jumping on top of them as they continue to fly upwards. Also, sometimes turrets can shoot you to places you want to go. However, this is very rare.

If you enjoyed reading this review feel free to subscribe to my curator page. Thanks...

http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6843548/
 
Kyzka
