Recommandé
14.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juin 2015
Artık bu yeni nesil oyunlarda survival oyunları çok yapılır oldu. Elimi nereye atsam survival oyunu. How To Survive, Dying Light, Minecraft, Rust gibi gibi. Bunun yanında tabii diğer oyun türleri de aynı çitada ama yükselişte olan bir diğer oyun türü de SpeedRun oyunları. 5 yıl öncesine kadar sadece normal oyunların speedrunlarını görürken artık speedrun oyunları da çıkmaya başladı. Hikayeli , hikayesiz birkaç oyun var bu türe örnek olarak. Mesela Mirror's Edge! Mirror's Edge bu türün resmen bayrak temsilcisi. Hikayesi, grafikleri ve bir speedrun oyununda bulunabilecek mekaniklere sahip (özellikle kestirmeler :)) bu oyun tam bir yeni çağ açtı.

Daha sonrasında bu oyunu beğenen büyük bir kitle oluştu haliyle. Çünkü sonuçta türünün ilki ve en iyisiydi. Bundan sonra bağımsız firmalar ve ünlü firmalar da speedrun oyunlarına giriştiler. Buna örnek verirsek A Story About My Uncle 2014 yılında yapılmış , koşmalı olmasa da hızlı bitirmek için yarıştığınız ve hızlı bitirmek için size mekanik verilen bir oyun. Onun dışında Lemma diye bir oyun da bu yıl içerisinde çıktı. O da farklı bir dünyaya arkadaşını aramaya gelen bir kadını anlatıyor.

Peki Deadcore bu türün neresinde ve en iyi olmaya aday mı derseniz işte şimdi ona geçelim. Öncelikle oyunun ana temasına. Oyun hava boşluğunda duran kutucuklarda ilerleme oyunu. Amacımız bize verilen yolları açmak için bir anahtar olan bir silah ile ve ileriye doğru atılmaya yarayan botlar ile ileriye gitmek. Öncelikle basit gibi görünse de bu oyun Mirror's Edge'den tamamiyle farklı mekaniklere sahip yani özgün bir yapım.

Öncelikle temeli anlatırsak bu oyunda herhangi bir düşman yok. Tek rakibiniz zaman. Size hayvan gibi bir harita veriyor ve size nereye gideceğiniz hakkında en ufak bir fikir vermiyor. Oyuncu kendi hayalgücü ve mekaniklerini kullanarak yolunu açıyor ve ilerliyor. Çoğu zaman kaybolsanız ve milyonlarca kere ölseniz de vazgeçmiyorsunuz. Oyunda kendini tekrar etmeyen level sistemi etkin. Ve ayrıca kombo dediğimiz bir olay da var. Kısaca anlatayım:

Oyunda dash yani ileri atılma özelliğini iyi kullanırsanız ve toplanabilir içerikleri iyi topladıysanız inanın bana müthiş bir menzile sahip oluyorsunuz. İşin açıkçası bu oyun 4 saatte bitiyor. Fakat speedrun yapanlar için böyle bir olay yok. Level'ı bitirme süreniz parmaklarınızın işi. Eğer bu menzile sahip (tabii ki gitme menzili) iseniz işte o zaman kombolar başlıyor. Şimdi şu şekilde oyunun trailerına baktıysanız sürekli bir engeller ve engellerden kaçmak için de yollar olduğunu görürsünüz. Bu yollar tamamiyle birbirine bağlı olsa da kestirme denilen olay da var tabii. Kestirmeye gitmek için size verilen yollardan tavşan gibi seke seke gidebilirsiniz. İşte bu da kombo oluyor. Ve izlemesi de müthiş! Speedrun yapan amcaları kesinlikle izleyin.

Oyun kendini tekrar etmiyor demiştik. Silahınızla açtığınız yollar hep değişiyor. Ayrıca engeller de. Böylece kendinizi sürekli kafa yorarken buluyorsunuz. Fakat bu oyun gerçekten çok zor. Milyonlarca kere ölüp defalarca rage quit atabilirsiniz. Ama oyun sizi yine içine alacaktır. Çünkü o engelleri geçmek bir heves haline gelecek.

Oyunun bir bulmaca olduğunu söylemeliyim. Çoğu zaman yolunuzu açtığınızda geri dönmek zorunda kalacaksınız. Çünkü açtığınız yol belki de başta olabilir. İşte olay bu zaten. Sınır haritadaki kutular değil, hayalgücünüz ve mekaniklerinizdir. Oyun bunu sizden istiyor. Hikayesi olmayan bu oyun tamamiyle oynanıştan kazanıyor ki oynanış oyunu zaten. Speedrun oyunları devrimi bu oyunla tekrardan hayat buldu bence. Lemma , Mirror's Edge gibi oyunları sevdiyseniz ve mekanik oyunu istiyorsanız buyrun arkadaşlar oynayın. Kesinlikle eğlenceli. Ve parasının hakkını sonuna kadar veriyor.

Güncellemelerden bahsedelim biraz. Oyunda toplam 5 level yani 5 harita var. Oyuna gelen güncellemeler ile bazen kutucuklar yani yollar da eklenebiliyor. Böylece bu oyunu onlarca saat oynayanlar, yani süre yarışı yapanlar için (Pardon, sıralama olduğunu söylemedim. ) yeni bir zaman rekoru için de bir şans veriliyor. Oyun 18 liralık bir maliyete sahip ve bu kadar müthiş özelliklere sahip. Hayret doğrusu!
 
Wazowski

Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2015
This game is brutal. You will find yourself dying hundreds of times doing a single set of jumps. The patterns are absolutely unforgiving to the extreme. You have to be perfect to get through the challenges. To get the best ending you'll have to play through several times. Things get easier once you get the hang of the game, but it takes a while, and its really tough. Ill recommend it, but be prepared to curse at the screen a lot.

47.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2017
Vous aimez les grandes sensations et les vertiges? Vous aimez accomplir des exploits (tout du moins en avoir la sensation...)? Vous aimerez DeadCore.

Difficultés et challenges sans sentiment de frustration ni 'ragequit'! Personnellement j'ai adoré ce jeu et il mérite amplement ma première review. Pourtant ce n'était pas gagné d'avance car ce type d'univers tron-like n'est pas 'ma came' et les jeux de plateforme en vue subjective, beaucoup se sont cassés les dents... mais l'intelligence du gameplay, les sensations vertigineuses (même sans casque VR) et la jouabilité réglée au dixième de poil de uc', ÇA c'est ma came. Et ça doit aussi être la vôtre.

N'ayons pas peur Des mots, c'est un chef d'oeuvre dans sa catégorie!

15.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 octobre 2014
If you are a platforming genius DeadCore will be your ultimate challenge as the difficulty is raking the highest tops. It might even be so hard that certain players will simply drop off, but if you are not afraid of insanely complicated puzzles you have to give this a try.

A lot of skill, fast reflexes and quick maneuvering are keys to solve the riddle throughout its 5 levels. If it just had a few more checkpoints so it wasn't unbearably punishing then it would have been a 9 or 10, but I feel that it solidly earns a well deserved 8/10.

Recommandé
54.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2015
Une fois l'histoire finie, j'hésitais à retourner dessus suite à de nombreux passages qui mettront vos nerfs à rude épreuve. Et puis finalement se balader dans les niveaux, surtout une fois toutes les améliorations acquises (dash, rocket jump / blast, etc.), c'est un vrai plaisir.

Autant je me pose encore la question de savoir si les ennemis ont un réel intérêt en terme de game design et s'ils ne sont pas de trop, desservant le jeu. Autant une fois les épisodes de rage passés, c'est du fun pur. Fini en 5h36 (Temps en jeu / IGT : 3h59), j'y suis retourné pour ramasser toutes les améliorations que j'avais manqué ainsi que les autres collectables (musiques et bouts d'histoire / logs). Et je me prends au jeu du speedrun en m'entrainant tout doucement à essayer des techniques (j'adore les megajumps, même s'ils sont durs à effectuer), trouver le chemin le plus rapide, etc. Parce que oui, ce jeu a un gros potentiel de ce côté, d'ailleurs un mode speedrun est présent directement en jeu, avec le temps des développeurs pour les différents niveaux, et des classements. Les développeurs suivent d'ailleurs le jeu en réinitialisant les classements (tout en conservant les anciens archivés) en cas de correction de glitchs majeurs comme ils en existaient auparavant ("blast climbing", "gravity flying").

Bref, si vous aimez les jeux de plate-forme 3D, que vous voulez un peu de challenge, vous serez servi.
 
Harest

Évaluation publiée le 11 mai 2015
快節奏跑酷遊戲，立足點之間需要快速並流暢地運用已經獲得的能力解決機關前進
例如向下墜落的途中突然出現一個射擊觸發牆，要立刻射擊並且按下衝刺讓角色停在向後傾倒的牆上
又或者連續出現把你往外推的噴射點，要邊前進邊一個個用槍隻停止功能

簡單的說，看別人玩很帥、自己會玩的話也很爽
但是不會玩就得不停的重複直到熟悉並過關(目前卡關中)
有點Portal的感覺、只是更沒有時間喘息

Polecam i pozdrawiam 11/10

Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2014
Скорость, реакция (можно и в пространстве потеряться), бег, маневреность, точность при стрельбе (да да имеено она, а не польба т.к от чека до чека всего 30 патронов) и хорошое звуковое сопровождение вот основные критерии этой игры. Сюжета как такогого нет, но он здесь ни к чему. Уровни сложности ощутимы особенно когда проходишь впервые. Графон тоже на приличном уровне (Сrysis2 приблизительно по картинке будет таков). Оптимизация игры хорошо проработана, лагов и проседаний fps незамечено. Если вам по душе Portal and Portal 2 то несомненно игра вам понравиться.

Recommandé
11.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 avril 2019
I played the Story, took about 5hr 11min, which is pretty good for a $10 game in my opinion. While those 5 hours weren't necessarily all progression (I would be stuck on different parts for about 50-60 minutes of that time), it was still a really captivating experience that had very unique and innovative aspects.

1. Gameplay/Controls:
There are quite a few things to go over here, but lemme just start out by saying this is NOT an easy game, and it is NOT meant for a casual gamer. That's not to say you can't have fun with it if you are a casual player, but I think DeadCore is meant for very patient and skilled players who are looking for a very big challenge and like fast paced platformers. In fact, it's probably the hardest platformer I've ever played. Yeah, it takes some time to figure some jumps out, and ya may die a thousand times on one small part, but that's half the fun, honestly.
Movement in this game is pretty easy to learn. I had the jump height and range, amount of input lag (which feels like literally none btw), and movement speed down some time during the second level. Overall, the controls are VERY responsive and if you wanna stop in the middle of the air, you will stop nearly instantly. Momentum is really unique in this game, which you'll learn pretty quickly.
Difficulty never struck me as over the top, no matter how hard it got. Trust me, it gets VERY hard. The only reason I was able to get through the entire game was through lots and lots of patience, but it pays off when you finally get past that really hard part you were struggling with. The difficulty's pacing works well, too.

2. Artwork/Story:
So the game itself looks alright, nothing super groundbreaking or anything. Where the visuals definitely shine, though, are in the moments where you look up at the Tower in the early levels, and down in the later levels. Seeing all that content on your screen at once just puts a smile on my face. Also, can we talk about these Logs and their concept art?? Absolutely phenomenal and I want to meet the person who made those pictures. Really thought provoking.
The story is where the game kinnnda falls off, with some less than engaging text in the Logs. I would have liked a more in-depth take on the Tower and what this person's objective really is. Why is he climbing the Tower? Who is "Her" supposed to be?

3. Music/SFX
Last but not least is the aspect they did PERFECTLY. The attention to quality with the music and SFX in this game blows my mind. We got like 20 tracks to build a custom playlist with for the Speedrun mode, most of which are musically very interesting, a very good title theme, and even multiple samples for the select sounds in the menu. If I don't enjoy playing the game, I enjoy listening to it.

8/10 - Not perfect, but they nailed so much and I can't say a particularly bad thing about this game. Great work Namco.
 
Dave
205 produits enregistrés
0
64 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2015
DeadCore pulls absolutely no punches in being exactly what it wants to be.

A first person, speedrunning focused sci-fi platformer, it's unabashedly everything it proclaims itself to be and doesn't give a damn if you can keep up with the absurdly high performance requirements placed upon the player. So I guess it's fair to say it accomplished its goals, that it became the game it was designed to be, but for all it's gorgeous particle effects and impress sense of speed it's so obsessed with being this monumental hurdle to overcome that it neglects to ever give you a reason to want to.

There's no difficultly curve in DeadCore, just you and a brick wall of unintuitive level designs, agonizingly spaced out checkpoints, stiff controls, and everything that's ever been a problem with first-person platformers. Its perspective is likely it's largest oversight, as it makes it extremely hard to accurately jump onto minuscule platforms when you can't see where you're landing, and having to constantly look down to counteract this obscures the omnipresent series of instant death obstacles you have to simultaneously dodge.

I never felt in control playing DeadCore. Every jump was a gamble, a roll of the dice deciding whether I miraculously made it through or would be sent back usually not knowing why I died, or feeling like I was being punished for things I had no chance of avoiding. It's overwhelming and constantly punishing, to the point the idea that I would return to try and better my times was almost laughably ridiculous.

For as constantly as it reminds and urges you to make your own path, progression in DeadCore is unrelentingly strict. Any diverging paths usually boiled down to an occasional fork in the road or making an impossible jump that might have saved me a few seconds, but I was always trapped in this impenetrable obstacle course. Level designs are obtuse and at times forced me to do things that felt like I was breaking the game because there was no other discernible way through. The purity of its mechanics is then lost as I unsuccessfully tried to perform the tasks set before me as the game continued to tell me I was either doing it wrong, or not doing it well enough.

When I finally made it to the top of the tower I'd been ascending throughout the game, my sigh wasn't one of satisfaction that I'd finally managed to overcome the seemingly impossible obstacles that stood in my way, but one of relief that I'd never have to go through them again. I have no doubts that there are people DeadCore will simply click with, who would tell me I'm just bad at it and if I would only give it more of a chance I'd begin to enjoy it. Be that as it may, completing DeadCore just once was such an unbelievably stressful and frustrating experience that I can't imagine willingly taking on that task again, and would feel sick with myself if I recommended anyone else do so anyway.

You can read more of my reviews on Kritiqal[kritiqal.com].
 
KRITIQAL
2,110 produits enregistrés

3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2015
>Nach einem endlosen Fall durch starke magnetische Stürme … erwachst du.

>Ohne jegliche Erinnerungen, erkundest du die Welt um dich herum. Irgendjemand oder irgendetwas dringt dich höher >und höher.
>Plötzlich bemerkst du einen riesigen Turm aus dem Nebel ragen. Dir wird klar, dass deine Fragen beantwortet werden ... >und dass du auf die Spitze klettern musst.

>Ein Kinderspiel wird es jedoch nicht gerade. Der Turm wird von einem Hightech-Sicherheitssystem beschützt. Es >wimmelt nur so von aufwendiger Mechanik, tödlichen Lasern und Roboter, die jede einzelne deiner Bewegungen >mitverfolgen.

>Um zu überleben, wirst du alle deine Fähigkeiten (Springen, Doppelsprung, Sprinten, usw.) und deine SwitchGun gut >einsetzen müssen. Die SwitchGun erlaubt dir Fallen und Roboter zu aktivieren bzw. zu deaktivieren. Nur so kannst du an >die Spitze des Turmes gelangen und die Geheimnisse um ihre Herkunft enthüllen.

Damit wäre das Spiel eigentlich auch schon erklärt.Dieser Einleitungstext ist Programm.
Am ehesten wäre das Spiel mit der Climbing Mod in CS:S zu vergleichen.
Das Ganze ist stylish gewürzt in Tron/Portal Optik,welche ein sehr gute Figur macht.Der Sound und auch die Musik liegen im Bereich Space/Ambient/Electro und umso weiter man kommt,lassen sich weitere Musikstücke freispielen.

Mich persönlich hat das Spiel von Anfang an gepackt.Der Kern liegt darin,das man einfach diese in unendlich weiter Ferne liegende Turmspitze erreichen will.Man fällt...ja und fällt und fällt und fällt und man versucht es trotzdem wieder.Kann stellenweise sehr frustrierend sein,aber andererseits motivierts auch dementsprechend.Diesen Wettbewerbseffekt kennt man schon aus Darksouls.
Ich habe mir das Spiel im Holidaysale für 3,99€ geschnappt und bin durchaus zufrieden damit.Der Vollpreis liegt bei 9,99€ und der ist es meiner Meinung nach auch Wert.
 
TheDeadJack

Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2015
Очень интересный пазл-платфомрер. Куплен был на хамбле, за 1 бакс, эту стоимость он покрывает многократно. За полную цену наверно не стоит его брать, но на ближайшей распродаже - обязательно. Сразу скажу, это не клон портала, и пушка тут просто для активации/деактивации механизмов, делать это надо как правило находу/в полете. Игра очень динамична, этим она разительно отличается от портала. Здесь требуется чувство ритма, тайминги, точность и скорость.
PS: игра очень напоминает Cloudbuilt по механике.

52.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mai 2016
Je suis un amateur de jeux de plateformes et je peux dire que celui-ci ne m'a pas déçu ! Une fois le dash débloqué on retrouve des sensations de vitesse et de fluidité vraiment plaisante. A l'instar de SuperMeatBoy le jeu n'est jamais frustrant et on prend du plaisir à recommencer encore et encore les différents passage.
Chose importante à noter, la diversité des chemins possibles. Bien souvent deux itinéraires sont possibles mais on peut en trouver bien d'autres en utilisant intelligemment le décor. Le jeu met donc notre réactivité, notre inventivité et notre dextérité à rude épreuve si l'on veut réaliser de meilleurs temps.
Au niveau des graphismes, le jeu ne déçoit pas et propose des rendus magnifiques, surtout pour un jeu semi-indé. Mention spéciale aux éclairages tout à fait sublimes.
Les commandes sont paramétrables et un mode speedrun est disponible si jamais on veut tenter de se mesurer aux autres joueurs du monde entier sur un rank mondial.
Quelques petits bémols sont à noter cependant, bien que subjectifs peut-être : la répétitivité des ambiances, le peu de niveaux disponibles, une bande son un peu en retrait malgré le rythme soutenu du jeu.
C'est une très bonne pioche pour les amateurs de jeu de plateforme !
 
Broccio

Évaluation publiée le 14 mai 2017
Just finished it !! Definitvely in my top list this year : explanations down here :3

+Gorgeous GRAPHICS (even for an Unity engine game)
+the OST is a BLAST !! ( Synthwave, Liquid, Dubstep, Drum'n'Bass and much more)
+CONTROLS extremely responsive and sharp
+NOT NECESSARY to find all items to beat the story (never found the blast gun, and some logs)
+YOU ARE FREE to pass through some hard stages by many ways according to how you take a look at the environment and your character skills (may be not the more legit ways or how devs may have thought players should do :p )
+LIFESPAN is decent and replaybility (speedruns or items searching)
+STORY a bit blurred but keeps the mystery all along . Sysiphus rulez
Take your time and enjoy the landscape :3 
Une capture d'écran de DeadCore

With stars in his eyes and the ears, definitively recommend it! Many thanks to the devs'team for such an amazing ride!

Non recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 février 2018
This game is good, but I definitely wouldn't recommend it over something like SEUM. If you're going to play it for collectables and to speedrun it, you'll get a lot out of it, and I would highly recommend it. If not, you'll be playing a fairly short but pretty well designed platformer.

Pros:
- This game realize its potential as a mechanically sound first person platformer.
- The gravity-switching mechanic feels really fun in 3D levels.
- There are a bunch of speedrun levels that I still have not tried.
- The skybox looks quite stunning.
- The game has surprisingly interesting exploration options for what it is.
- There aren't too many game mechanics, but they are used near their full potential.

♥♥♥♥:
- The game bugged out, and I had to restart the level (though I was near the beginning of it) to continue. The same bug was posted on the forums two years ago, and I suppose nobody did anything about it.
- Even though the gun is a hitscan weapon, it looks like it launches this projectile beam and it gets really confusing. As a whole, it doesn't feel satisfying to use, either.
- Because you can't see your feet, some of the gravity-switched sections become more confusing than they should be. Your hitbox as a whole is really confusing because you have no reference point.
- In the fifth level, there's an enemy that is introduced that can practically one hit kill you almost instantly, and it feels random when you don't know how to deal with it.
- There are a few places that are just plain confusing and easy to get stuck at for a little too long.
- Story? What story?
- If you're not going to try speedrunning this game, it's really short, so a lot of your time will be spent dwelling on some annoying things.
 
memethievingmaniac
1
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 décembre 2018
Ну, я сидел и думал, писать обзор на DeadCore или нет и как вы видите, выбрал первое. Сразу поясню, что я считаю глупым, ставить отрицательную оценку игре за ее сложность, вы вообще нормальные? Кхм. Приступим.

Плюсы:
-Атмосфера. Не, ну она тут действительно классная, ничего не сказать.

-Музыка. Она просто божественна, под нее очень приятно играть.

-Геймплей. Нам заявляют сразу, что ваша цель добраться до верха, преодолевая препятствия и собирая примочки. И в этом игра действительно полностью справляется. Нам не обещали невероятно интересного геймплея с квестами, нпс, тянками и прочим, значит, все хорошо.

-Разнообразность. Я не думаю, что хоть кто-то впервые запустив игру сможет выполнить истинную концовку (если он заинтересован в ней), значит он будет проходить еще раз и вот тут игра показывает себя великолепно! Путей и разнообразия хватает вполне. Перепройти раза 3-4 идя по разным путям можно и тут снова игра нас не разочаровывает!

-Оптимизация. Думаю сейчас это мало кого волнует, но все же скажу. Оптимизация на высоте и играть даже на деревянном ящике вполне можно.

-Графика. Здесь она очень даже хороша. В глаза мыло не бросается.

-Сюжет. Этот пункт спорный, но все же, мне было интересно собирать отчеты и узнавать что-то.

-Понравилось то, что помимо сюжетной линии, нам предоставили уровни на время, конечно некоторые повторяли обычные из сюжета, но были абсолютно новые и это радует.
P.S. Хотите сразу потренироваться на уровнях на время и гнуть в сюжетке? Хрен вам! Сначала найди в сюжете эти уровни, а потом играй! Ха! :D

Минусы:
-Относительная легкость. (ЭТО ТОЛЬКО МОЕ МНЕНИЕ И НА ВАШИ СОПЛИ ПО ПОВОДУ ОЙ КАК СЛОЖНО МНЕ ГЛУБОКО НАСРАТЬ) Для меня довольно таки было легко, в первый раз конечно я узнавал все, но потом стало как-то очень просто, проходил всю карту буквально за час, обидненько.

-Маленькая сюжетная карта. Опытный игрок пройдет игру буквально за пару часов и этого явно мало, сделали бы на 3-4 уровня побольше, но, увы.

-Цена. Ну как бы сказать, 300 рублей за 10 часов игры это вообще не дело. Единственный вариант - это брать игру по скидке.

-Отсутствие какого либо онлайна. Да, там есть табличка результатов твоих друзей, но ало, этого явно мало, можно было бы сделать какой-нибудь двойной режим или что-нибудь на скорость, было бы очень даже неплохо, но как всегда, увы.


Подводя итоги, можно сказать, что игру брать однозначно стоит, она тяжеленькая (для большинства), интересная и красивая, скучно точно не будет. Но брать ТОЛЬКО по скидке, 300 рублей это ей не цена!
 
/Ice/Storm/
176 produits enregistrés
0
17 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2014
Impressions:
Qu'on aime ou non le genre Speedrun et l'émulation de stats entre amis, DeadCore propose invariablement une très bonne expérience. Un petit peu plus poli qu'un Shootmania et moins "brut" dans son approche. Forcément, la maniabilité est au top, fluide, précise, subtile même parfois. Un mode histoire, un mode speedrun pur, trouvez des logs sur l'histoire ou déverrouillez de nouvelles pistes et embarquer votre playlist. Chaque niveau offre pas mal de parcours/raccourcis à trouver et à expérimenter. À titre de repère, moi, naturellement pas doué et en prenant mon temps (et en ayant pas trouvé la « r » pour restart). J'ai mis 40min pour le premier niveau : prise en main + expérimentations et puis ensuite 10 minutes pour le 2e essai, les maps sont grandes et les checkpoints assez gentils au départ. DeadCore est bien foutu et très agréable. Pour l'instant il semble qu'il y ait des exploits et autres permettant à certains de boucler par exemple le lvl 1 en 30sec... j'attends les Devs au tournant car sur un titre comme celui-ci, c'est leur proximité avec la communauté et leur flexibilité dans le processus de travail qui doit payer. Établir très vite un suivi et des corrections ne sera pas une option pour ce jeu qui va avoir besoin d'une belle communauté pour prospérer.
Vidéo YouTube™: DeadCore Stage3 Gravity 
Vues : 56
3D酔い余裕でした。 Game: DeadCore Author: rinjugatla http://raptr.com/rinjugatla uploaded via http://raptr.com/

Même si c'est un paramètre qui varie un peu plus tard dans les niveaux, ce n'est pas la gravité le principal paramètre, elle est normale. Il pourrait être un plateformer comme un autre mais seulement une fois en haut d'un saut, vous allez y rester un rien plus longtemps qu'attendu. Vous donnant une belle fenêtre de temps pour bouger.
Les sensations sont excellentes, le jeu exigeant, le double saut est vicieux car sans option pour retomber vous risquez de perdre beaucoup de temps, surtout qu'il est finalement assez peu souvent obligatoire pour atteindre une plateforme. En cas de chute, le timer continue, héhé!, repartez à 0 ou perdez du temps sur votre checkpoint, idem pour les niveaux suivants qui s'ajoutent sur le chrono des étapes précédentes.

L'expérience générale est très convaincante même si j'ignore s'il apporte quelque chose de plus que shootmania. FoV, sensibilité souris, tout est configurable comme il se doit pour un PC/Mac.

4K (2880x1400). http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=332074741
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=332074587

Corrections de l'avis à venir très bientôt
 
Smithfield

Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2015
Also, das Spiel ist schön gemacht, sieht gut aus, netter Sound, nette Grafik, alles super - ABER: Es wird sehr schnell extrem schwer! Und wenn man um jeden Speicherpunkt eine halbe Stunde kämpfen muss, macht es irgendwann keinen Spaß mehr. Insbesondere die Bots, die einen jagen und herumschubsen, machen einem das Leben echt schwer. Man hat oft nicht einmal die Zeit, sich umzugucken, WAS mann denn überhaupt machen muss, bzw. WOHIN man muss, da wurde man bereits wieder von einem Bot in die ewigen Jagdgründe geschickt.

Vielleicht mag ein jugendlicher Dauerzocker diese Reflexe haben, die man für das Spiel benötigt, für mich ist es praktisch nur frustrierend bis unspielbar.

6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 octobre 2015
Jogo absolutamente incrível, além de relativamente difícil!

Estava procurando algo como Portal, porém esse aqui foi muito além nos quebra cabeças e formas de passar determinado level.

No Single Player você faz uma espécie de Campanha que é bem direta, você começa em um ponto e tem que chegar a outro, o grande porém é que o jogo abre muito espaço para criatividade, por vezes você tem o caminho natural e se pegará inventando formas de passar certos desafios.

Há também o modo SpeedRun que é um mapa aonde tudo é rapido! você tem que tentar ir o mais rápido possível para se colocar no ranking com outros players online, alguns desses mapas são alucinante pois você mal consegue parar para pensar, tem que ser bem atento e rápido pois são milésimos para resolver alguns puzzles nesse modo.

Vale muito apena para quem gosta de quebrar a cabeça pensando em como raios vou passar dessa parte! É ótimo tentar e tentar até conseguir desenvolver uma forma de continuar, muito bom!

Altamente recomendado para quem curte jogo rápido e de quebrar a cabeça, é realmente difícil em algumas partes, mas caso não conseguir passar uma parte, dê um tempo vá tomar um chá ou café e volte depois que você conseguirá passar tranquilamente.

Recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2017
This is not your typical parkour game. The whole game is basically one giant level, with lots of checkpoints of course. Even near the top of the tower you can still see the bottom where you started. It's also amazing how they threw some story in there, giving you something to look for. It's also funny how this game gets harder as you go along, but I've returned to early levels and they're still pretty hard. That's probably just me being a scrub though.

Graphics: 10/10
Like I said it's pretty cool how the while game is one level, and if your computer is powerful enough you'll see that the textures are very detailed.

Story: 7.5/10 (10/10 compared to other parlour games)
While the game isn't very story driven, it's a nice touch to an otherwise mysteriously unexplained game.

Difficulty: 9.5/10
This game might be easy for some, but I've had my good amount of frustration and joy of finally getting it right.

Overall: 9.75/10
DeadCore is an above average parkour game, and if you're new to parkour games, DeadCore is a good place to start.
 
mattkitt28

Recommandé
57.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 juillet 2016
This game caught me by surprise and, oh my, how I've enjoyed it. Let me tell You. I found this randomly shuffling through games on steam and as soon as I saw the trailer I knew I HAVE TO play it. And I wasn't wrong, not one bit. DeadCore gave me exactly what I needed.

DeadCore is a combination of First Person Shooter and Puzzle game, but it's based on Your reflexes instead being like Portal for example. In DeadCore there is often no time to make careful decisions, You have to act, and You have to do it fast. Controls are perfectly responsive which is a BIG deal for a game like this. You're going to make a split second decisions about where to shoot or where to jump. Some people are talking about badly programmed gravity but it's not true. You'll get used to it almost immediately. Be aware tho, this game requires from You at least some skills in precision shooting. If You fail (And trust me You often will) that wasn't because the stage is designed poorly, but it was Your reaction that was timed badly.

Story mode is not very long, it takes about 2-3 hours on Your first playthrough. You'll likely to spend much more time on Speedrun mode, or looking for upgrades, ammo for Your gun, and what's most important... for Sparks that uncover different parts of the map and Logs that reveal the story. Of course, I won't say anything more to avoid spoilers but, for me, story is very well written and I've enjoyed every bit of it.

The only downside to this are enemies. I know why they were implemented, and the idea itself is good, makes the game more challenging but, oh god they're frustrating as ♥♥♥♥♥♥. It goes like this: You spend like 15 minutes mastering a set of jumps (involving gravity flips, avoiding lasers and such) and boosts, there is no checkpoint in sight and when You finally get over it covered in sweat and general hate for everything... You are happily welcomed by the sentinel who without any care in the world, "gently" pushes You off the ledge with his forcefield because You didn't saw him. And You have to do everything from the beginning. Luckily it doesn't happen that often, but still, can be very annoying. Sometimes You'll just have to know where enemies are to prepare accordingly.

I never knew I've waited for a game like this one, until I've played it.
Amazing atmosphere. Cool sci-fi design, very good graphics and fitting soundtracks, one for the Story mode and one for Speedrun mode, both containing different tracks but maintained in the same Ambient / Drum & Bass genres. Speedrun has more DnB since it supposed to pump You up to be as fast as possible. I just love electronic music in games so, to me it's gold.

I'll give this game a score of 8/10, because I often return to it, just to run around like a pro freerunner from the future, listening to amazing soundtrack and climb the leaderboards. I highly recommend DeadCore if You like fast paced puzzle shooters. :)
 
Dread Mirror

I recommend this game a lot.

+ responsive controls

- the Sparks are too hidden, i think i would have to waste a lot time exploring the levels i already know just to find the new ones. i know its about exploring, but they should be at least visible to the player sometimes

Recommandé
11.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
I've played this game for around an hour so far, usually i'd play a hell of a lot more before i submitted a review but honestly i feel an hour is a sufficient amount of time.

First off, what is this game? DeadCore is an exploration, reflex, puzzle, first person platformer (good lord that's a mouthful) with a heavy emphasis on speed and timing. Visually it looks good, while it's not pushing the boundaries of graphics for the future, it still looks beautiful for what it is.

Gameplay wise it's a giant navigation puzzle and a fast one at that, your objective is to climb the tower, at first it's pretty basic until they introduce you to the switch gun, the switch gun allows you to turn switches on and off, it sounds pretty simple and it is at first but, usually consisting of "open this door" or "Turn on this jump pad" but it starts to get pretty complicated and reflex based pretty fast with turning off fans to prevent you from getting sucked off of the map while you're jumping to a platform that requires you to turn off one jump pad, turn on another and then turn off the turret shooting you..all while moving fast.

Thankfully the controls are hyper responsive, i have not had a single instance where i've needed to use the switch gun, jump and move and not being quick enough due to unresponsiveness, all controls react in an instant and in a game like this that's paramount.

In story mode you are able to take your time if you wish, though the switch gun has a timer built in to it so you can keep track of your time if you want to, the real heart of the game lies within it's speedrun mode, this is clearly a game built for speedrun fans and it shows.

It's a really fun game and for the price it's well worth the purchase, i'd even go as far to say that i would of happily paid a little more for it, If you're a puzzle fan, you'll love this game, if you're a platform fan, you'll love this game and of course if you're a speedrun fan, you'll feel right at home.

I highly recomend you check this game out.


EDIT: Now over 10 hours in and i'm still loving it, even more so than i did when i wrote this review.
 
Fawkzi
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2014
This first-person platformer is perfectly executed, smooth as hell and gorgeous to boot. The levels are colossal, even putting DarkSouls to shame, but within a short period you'll be dashing and bouncing your way around making short work of sections that at first proved challenging.

One of the best things about Deadcore is something it doesn't do... It doesn't restrict you. If you want to, and have the skills to jump around a puzzle or laser grid instead of through it, that's fine. If you fancy going off-piste and climbing up that decorative curved roof to reach the next area early: Be our guest!

I'd go into details about the abilities and upgrades and stuff, but suffice to say it's a nice simple system that gives good replay value without feeling cheap (it's even worked into the lore).

There's story here but it's Braid-esque, take it or leave it. It's not bad, just not really that important. Gameplay is what makes Deadcore shine.

Considering the dev team can be counted on one hand, this is a masterpiece.[8.7]
 
Arachin

Non recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 février 2023
Got this game in a bundle 7 years ago, decided to give it a try (I want to clean my backlog of games)

It may have been a good game in 2014 but I cannot reccomend it TODAY, if you can get it for 2.50 on a sale and you love the genre sure, have a go at it, but if you already played Neon White.. you'll be highly disappointed.

the game show it's age while still running perfectly fine and the graphic style is coherent, but I disliked the "esitation" you have while jumping, most of your jumps aren't clear you are either overshooting or going short and you have to correct yourself mid-air, this will slow the pace of the game if you want to run tru a level as fast as possible like in neon white.

I could probably get a better idea for the distance if I repeat a level many times over but honestly I don't feel a strong push to re-play levels, the map can be confusing and have you lost at time, there aren't many clear indication on where to go. I give up at the start of the "flip button" mechanic levels, where the map turn upside down or sideways and you have to figure out how to proceed. iit's too hard for me to navigate while enjoying the game.

I researched this 5Bits games and apparently this is their only game, a bit sad I was curious to see if they made a newer game that fixed the problems with this one.

Recommandé
17.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 novembre 2014
If you're a platforming fan, you owe it to yourself to play DeadCore.

It's a somewhat challenging FPS-platformer in the vein of Portal. Movement is very smooth and jumping has a fair bit of airhang to it to help you know your bearing, you always feel in control and the only jarring thing I can point to is some mild annoyances with narrowing down your hitbox at first.

The platforming challenges are imaginative and diverse and the level design is solid: levels have a very dynamic and animate feeling to them, where you in contrast feel like a manipulator, dissecting and disrupting the world around you. DeadCore is also quite branched, both in terms of official alternate routes as well as hidden shortcuts that can be found through exploiting dashes and rocketjumping.

One thing that bears mentioning though is that the levels lean heavily towards the GMOD near the end, where you activate gravity panels and flip in a variety of angles to get to otherwise unreachable locations, if motion sickness is an issue to you or you have a general apathy towards disorientation in platformers, then it's a valid concern and something that may put you off the game.

Otherwise, intriguing atmosphere, smooth controls and high quality level design, definitely recommended.
 
Achelon

18.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 novembre 2014
I'm guilty of searching for 'like Portal' games, but that's how I came to find Deadcore... an epic indie fps puzzle platformer. The visuals are what first got my attention. The game is beautiful and often you'll just stop and look around to take in the scene. However, after playing through the story, that's when I really saw how good this game is. It's challenging (as what most puzzle games should be), has really smooth gameplay, amazing level design, and overall just damn fun to play. You wouldn't think that Deadcore is an indie game which makes it well worth the purchase (which, considering, is very cheap).

12.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2022
Один из самых недооценённых платформеров. Влюбился в игру с первого взгляда, когда ещё только взглянул на трейлер. Игра прекрасная, но трудная. Предполагал, что можно будет насладиться спокойным времяпровождением с соблюдением быстрых таймингов и интересным повествованием, однако игра всячески вставляла палки в колёса. С SEUM, конечно, не сравнить, но и ожидания от игры иные.

Плюсы:
+ Прекрасный геймплей. Великолепный платформер, пожалуй, один из лучших в своём роде.
+ Шикарная графика. Но местами из-за обилия лазеров приходится снижать настройки до самых-самых минимальных.
+ Геймдизайн. Мало того, что игра выглядит очаровывающе, так ещё к этому прилагается и очень высокая вариативность прохождения: уровень можно проходить любым образом.

Нейтрально:
Музыка. Хорошая, но не идеальная. В общем, по дефолту.
Сюжет. Внедрять сюжет в мир таинственных башен было довольно спорным решением. Вроде сюжет и есть, а вроде и ни о чём.

Минусы:
- Кривые хитбоксы. Очень часто бывают такие ситуации, когда попадешь в объект, а ничего не происходит. Справедливости ради, иногда происходят и обратные ситуации - остановить ветряк можно и не попав в точности в мишень.
- Нервные клетки не восстанавливаются. В мире есть вещи, где можно более рационально потратить их.
 
shadowmaster545

And it's cheap too. F**k me.

"Player model is tied to physics, which runs at 50fps (your monitor works at still runs only ~60/120/144 FPS). This produces consistent micro-stutter, which makes the game feel like it s running at 20fps, even if it is running at 200+fps."

Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2016
One of the best exploration and speedrun games..you're in an futuristic universe and going in a dreamlike adventure to reach a huge tower born from the void and you put your capabilities to the test...while revealing the secrets that lie beneath this mysterious world.
Unique, smart and very challenging game that boasts a personality at the same time modern and retro. If you don't fear its challenge,just give it a try.
-
Some notes for the players who own the game already :
At first, I was playing 1 level everyday & it takes more than an hour. But then, I'm doing well to finish the whole game in 2 or 3 hours.
Later, I saw the achievement about finishing the game in less than 1 hour, I thought it's possible to do it.. & I did it. :D
I just hope for a new version or update to make it multiplayer, not just competing with score & time race..but some levels that need cooperating..just like Portal 2

Recommandé
13.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2017
I'll be honest, I really wish more game devs would make games in this style, vague, airy, and mystic sci-fi-like. The gameplay is challenging but rewarding. Is it hard, yes, quite, but you never feel overwhelmed. It's a game that has excellent difficulty scalling throughout it's levels and has a good incentive for replay if you want to collect all the extras scattered around all the levels, although one that can be said is that looking for said extras can be a bit of a drab, as if you go one checkpoint too far there's a good chance you'll have to restart the level in order to collect the item, as the game has a clever way of not letting backtrack past certain checkpoints. This game also catters to speedrunners, if you're into that. It has a dedicated speedrun mode for those who enjoying blitzing through levels, I personally don't care too much for speedrunning, but the game has a few speedrun-only levels for those wanting to practice thier movement and set good times. My only complaint with the game is that it's a bit too short, each level is around an hour or so, and there only about four or five levels, so make of that as you will.

All in all, Deadcore is an excellent game, if challenging, that you'll probably quite fun and challenging.
 
malaki_moose

Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2021
Deadcore ist ein sehr cooler 1st Person Puzzle Plattformer. Im Spiel seid ihr bewaffnet mit einem Gewehr, mit dem Ihr Schalter aktivieren könnt und Gegner für eine Weile deaktivieren könnt. So Doppelspringt und dasht ihr durch 5 Level, die mit Rätseln gespickt sind. Das Spiel ist sehr auf Speed running ausgelegt, es gibt sogar einen kompletten Modus dafür. Die Grafik ist wahrlich nichts besonderes, reicht aber aus.
Gestört hat mich ein Design Bug im 5ten Level, bei dem ich einen ganzen Abschnitt wiederholen musste, weil ich ein essentielles Update nicht aufgesammelt hatte, weil ich anscheinend den optionalen Weg genommen hatte.... das
problem ist schon lange bekannt und wird wohl nichtmehr gefixt. Ansonsten hatte ich viel Spaß.

Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2016
One of the most challenging, well made, and fun puzzle/parkor games I've ever played. On top of being surreal I was entertained for weeks, maybe even a few months (which is a lot for a single player based game) there are even moments that will get your adrenaline going as a competitive FPS would. if you're a gamer, and you love fast paced games that will put you on the edge of your seat then I highly recommend DeadCore to anyone, it does not disappoint.
 
Epikas Jones

Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 décembre 2014
This game is a platforming FPS game. It does share a similarity with Portal but the genre they're both in is as far as the similarities go. DeadCore is vastly different from Portal. Rather than use...well...portals to get around and solve puzzles, you jump around, run, dash, and shoot switches to progress.

This is a very difficult game. It requires a lot of precise movement to get through the various hazards placed throughout the 5 levels. There's also the added challenge of it being in first-person, which means you can't entirely see your surroundings, but that's not a huge issue. DeadCore is also a fairly fast paced platformer, you don't have much time to react to hazards and other obstacles which gives even more challenge.

There's also various collectables hidden throughout the game. Music, hidden pathways, upgrades, and even lore. The lore isn't really anything special, but hey, it's there so might as well look at it once.

The only real problem I have is, because it's in first person, you don't have a good idea of what your hitbox is. This is a problem because later parts of the game require you to go through very narrow pathways, and since you can't see what your hitbox is, expect a lot of deaths. You also can't see any incoming hazards easily, though it's less of an issue.

DeadCore is a good game. It's short, but because of how the game works, there's some nice replayability and some potential for some cool speedrunning tactics. I give it an 8/10
 
SteelBeetle
334 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Évaluation publiée le 11 juin 2017
A game of pleasure if you like envirorments and technical concepts like the scriptures at the top of the tower (at the end of the game). But it is also a competitive speedrunning game for those ones which want to climb the ranking.
For the achievements' fun, like me, this game is very feasible. I guess in the average a normal player can complete 100% the achievements game around the 40-45 hours of playing, if you become addicted, even before.
Have Fun!

Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2015
Buen título de puzzles y plataformas en primera persona.
Asciende hasta lo más alto de la torre utilizando toda tu habilidad, velocidad y puntería, mientras esquivas trampas, lasers y robots.
Varios caminos a elegir, cada uno ♥♥♥ sus ventajas e inconvenientes, muchos coleccionables para reunir, algunos potenciadores y sobretodo, muchos desafíos, que te exigirán máxima concentración.
Quizás, ésto último sea la peor parte del juego, ya que, a veces el éxito dependerá más de la suerte que de tu habilidad y acabarás por repetir un punto de control hasta la saciedad.
Para terminar, el diseño de los mapas es muy bueno y da mucho juego, además de presentar unas vistas preciosas.

Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2014
This game is an obstacle course and only 5 maps\lvls short.
There are no puzzles, only hazards and insta-kill obstacles.

Playing this game requires player to have:
heavenly patience
split-second reaction and sometimes pure luck
will to experience bazillion of fails\deaths with some portion of obstacles to get a little progress through map.
practice use of exploits to skip through portions of level and obstacles.

Game also punishes hard for exploration, requiring you to go through same obstacles again, and again, if you fail to go through them, and again, and again, and again...

No one is playing through maps as it meant to be, they practice to skip.

Basicaly this game is:
1lvl: Wow nice music, graphics and setting
2lvl: Cool! Getting a little harder. Ha, finished! That was nice!
3lvl: Ok this is getting rediculous, but I can do it. Got past that! Whew!
4lvl: Rage generator.
5lvl: Quit.

Do not expect this game to be like Portal or like Anti-Chamber.
 
less than three

!!! СРОЧНО БРАТЬ, пока скидка!!!

об игре:
Если убрать из PainKiller всех зомби, и сделать из локаций один сплошной лабиринт, получится очень похоже.

Однако мой мосг начал ломаться на уровнях с гравитацией, все что до них - тьфу. Нахрапом, за раз пройти не смог.

+ Куча секретов, начиная чуть ли не с самого начала
+ Сложная
+ Нет миниигр, дополнительных головоломок, итд. Есть только ты, пушка, и место, куда тебе надо попасть. Дальше думай сам

- Поначалу мрачновата, через полчаса привык
- Долбаная гравитация.

Превосходно для 75 рублей и крайне неплохо для полной цены в 250 рублей
9/10

691.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2017
Note - Please read my full review if you are going to read it.

I absolutely love this game, though I can see why some players may not like this. This game is my favorite game by far, and it will probably be like that for another year. This game is amazing, though you may want to think before purchasing it.

Pros -

-Stunning graphics (depending on what you choose, very nice for just medium).
-Stiff controls
The controls on this game are amazing, I would say that any move ment you do is going to be your fault, even though there are glitches the controls are very accurate.
-Addictive
This game is very addictive after you get all the sparks and beat the story mode, you have so much to do in speedrun mode since you can always improve your time to get a better time. There is always competition when trying to beat someone's time in the game.
-Glitches
HOW CAN THIS BE A PRO???? Well, not all glitches are the best, though they do keep a lot of glitches (purposely?) and these glitches make the game so much more enjoyable. One glitch is called the Mega Jump and it can bring you super high. These glitches also speed your time up.
-For those nerds out there
This game is definitely for those nerds like me.

Pros to me/♥♥♥♥ to others
-Fast paced game
This game is very demanding of you to multitask. You have to shoot things at the same time you are in mid air. Some parts you have to be really smart with or you will die too easily.
-Challenging
Many people are saying this game is challenging. I will have to agree. A speedrunner myself, this game brought out some frustration in points of the game, the game is demanding, like I said before, of you in multitasking. This game brings out the best of what I can do, as it is a truly challenging game.

♥♥♥♥ -
-Frustrations
This game is very frustrating when going through your first run. Your first one will be the hardest of your other runs. So, keep in mind, your first run will not be the greatest.
-Only for speedrunners/skilled players
Many speedrunners, like me, will fall in love with this game so easily. It is by far one of the best speedrunning games for us speedrunners. Skilled players probably also fit in this category as this game requires lots and LOTS of reflexes, multitasking and much more. This game is not for players who are here just to play a game and be done with it, or at least not most. If the game seems interesting to you and you are a casual gamer, I am not saying you can't buy the game, though the game targets speedrunners and skilled players. So you may find it overwhelming. After you beat the game once, then beating the game is much easier than before.
 
Nrrillinthas

Non recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mai 2020
This is one of those times where a "maybe" button would be nice.
The things I like about this game I feel are very cool. When all the movement and stuff works together and you do the thing cool, it's great. The visuals for a while are very striking and impressive, and the fact that for most of the game you can look up and see future levels, or look down and see how far you've come, is VERY cool.
However I just personally feel there's a lot of inconsistencies in this game that make it hard to have fun.
Dying is an instant, snappy reset, unless the death is via laser, which makes you wait to look at the particle effect to show how you died. Not a long wait, but a pointless one.
Respawning resets your place in the world, but not the world itself. This means enemy placements will be a certain way the first time, and are more likely to be janky subsequent run-throughs (I had a very large enemy follow me out of his arena to try and box me at my spawn). Some triggerable things stay triggered, others reset when you die, and yet more stay triggered until their timer resets, and there's no real way of knowing which one any particular thing is unless you want to waste time waiting or waste more time dying when whatever it turns off.
Resets also don't put the world back onto a specific cycle or anything, which isn't too huge a deal except for the fact that sometimes you can't possibly get the right cycle to happen unless you're either lucky or do a lot of waiting for (to me) no reason.
And lastly, at least in the later parts of the cycle certain elements in the environment just seemed to be giving the ♥♥♥♥ up. There's this one part where a pillar with a laser glides from point A to point B while spinning around trying to turn you into french fries, except sometimes the pillar either didn't spawn, spawned AT point B, or similarly but more irritating, only spawned at point B AFTER I'd already done the jump that would send me careening into the laser.
Also the fact that enemies respawn in place after a second or two is quite irritating. And at least the cube boys will still attack if you touch them while they're inactive, which just sucks when you're in a tight space.
 
Conktorias!
1,161 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
23.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2014
В этой игре экзистенциальная драма разворачивается без слов. Вы будете умирать. Раз за разом. На одном и том же месте, как вы обычно делаете это во всех платформерах. Но каждый раз вы будете двигаться дальше. И будете удивляться. Красоте. Динамичному дизайну уровней. Себе. Тому, как вы преодолели препятствие, которое ещё пару смертей назад казалось безумным.
И до самого конца, эта игра не перестанет вас удивлять. Она имеет очень плавно возрастающую сложность и равномерно сочетает в себе остроумные загадки и напряжённые задачки на ловкость. Чтобы покорить титаническую конструкцию, вам понадобится терпение, выдержка и идеально отточенные движения.
Напоминание о нашем квакерском прошлом и одновременно взгляд в будущее жанра платформеров. Захватывающая игра.

2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2014
Imagine a maso-core version of Portal, only with Tron-inspired visuals. As mentioned in other reviews, the game rewards speed-running (in fact, there's a timer right there on your gun). However, each level has its fair share of collectibles -- text logs to fill in the backstory, songs for the soundtrack, etc. -- to reward players willing to experiment and leave the obvious path.

DeadCore isn't very long, but I assure you that you'll get your $10 worth of entertainment out of it.

Évaluation publiée le 20 avril 2016
a tratti snervante. cattivo e senza pietà. concepito per mettere a dura prova la pazienza del giocatore. un videogioco vecchia maniera.

leggevo che qualcuno lo paragonava a portal.. in realtà non c'entra niente, eccezion fatta per il designe del "♥♥♥♥♥♥", simile ma manco troppo..
comunque questo è un gioco di ABILITA', non di logica.

gameplay adrenalinico, impetuoso e mai noioso (nonostante le centinia di respown ad ogni livello) e, come già detto, sempre molto impegnativo.

ottimo il level designe, spesso offre più strade per raggiungere l'obbiettivo, se a queste poi si aggiungono (rare)scorciatoie non previste, scoperte un pò a cvlo un pò per rassegnata disperazione che ci porta a cazzeggiare per il livello di turno, si avrà quindi che ne risulta un gioco meno lineare e molto rigiocabile.

la colonna sonora è decisamente varia e ben contestualizzata, ♥♥♥ la possibilità di sbloccare nuove tracce ad ogni livello.

ogni tanto si presenta qualche strano bug, solitamente passeggero(scompare dopo un pò da se), ma il più delle volte facilità semplicemnte il compito del giocatore e quindi lo si perdona volentieri :D

ps. il gioco lo si può finire anche senza trovare nessuno dei potenziamenti nascosti, ma di sicuro male non fanno:P

Non recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2019
DeadCore is a slick run and jump tower climber. Visually it's a nice sci-fi themed game that reminds me of TRON which I like. But good god is this difficult. From the moment you start the game you need to move with precise timing, control and plan your steps perfectly. The game play becomes more challenging- and frustrating rapidly. One false move or misstep and you are dead. Be ready to die a whole hell of a lot trying to reach the next checkpoint. Each time I made it to a checkpoint I was like thank the baby Jesus I'm here. That feeling of accomplishment quickly wore off as I started the next stage though. For myself this wasn't an enjoyable experience because DeadCore is far more aggravating than fun. If you want a seriously tough speed running video game DeadCore might be the thing you are looking for. Be prepared to throw your mouse and keyboard through the monitor.
 
antocularis

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2014
Mildly challenging and very fun to play.

On the art: the graphics seem impressive on the surface, but if you look closely (as others have said) there's a high amount of texture reuse. The clouds are also 2D projections which follow the player's gaze. But none of this actually affects gameplay, besides ruining immersion a bit. I think the sound design is awesome, though, and overall I think this game takes many inspirations from Portal 2's style. (edit: I feel as if later in the game, the developers stopped striving for a 'wow effect', which is okay, I guess. There's only so much 'newness' to go around. I noticed when I went back to the first level from the third.)

On the gameplay: I like it. Platformers have classically been the prerogative of 2D or 2.5D. It's very nice to see a 3D platformer, and intriguing to see how unconventional and innovative platformer mechanics have been shown in this game. Another thing I like is the freedom for the player to explore each "level" and choose their own path, seamlessly (through that level, not through different levels in the cycle), apart from areas where the player cannot go "back down".

这是一款单机的跑酷游戏，我超级喜欢，虽然只有一位好友玩过
无聊的时候就玩，如地铁跑酷，刀锋酷跑乃至小黄人之类的跑酷游戏
deadcore给我的感觉就是一旦你开始跑起来，就停不下来，即使你在一直死
卡关之后在b站搜索之后，才发现除了与csgo社区图相关以外
还有速通视频，原来我们玩的不是同一款游戏，那么多支路，那么多骚操作
居然还要搜集东西。。。我服，满分游戏，强推

Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2016
Actual play time is more like 15 hours (offline mode). At first the game seamed gimicky and shallow. But after completeing the game, a slow sensation of magnanimus gratitude overcame me.

This is a near perfect experience. After getting a handle of the controls steep lerning curve, flying through the levels on speed runs is just exhilarating; the game play is really somthing special.

The story mode is such a wonderful experience, with a superbe soundtrack and artistic direction that really brings you in to this slick and vivid atmosphere of a world.

Some track elements can seam a bit contrived, yet the game encourages you to explore and find nice collectables and upgrades. Hence the exploration, some track elemnts can be completly undermind letting you take control of the world; making for a very personal experience.

I was very luck to get the game on sale, and would have definatly got the game full price if I had know it would be so good!

8.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2016
Surprisingly fun and well developed indie FPS platformer/speedrunner. Very intense and challenging platform action with some pretty crazy puzzles thrown in as well. It's only 5 levels, but expect a grueling 1-2hrs each to complete levels 4 and 5. I have a great sense of pride knowing that I was able to complete this game that has defeated a slew of casual gamers, haha. The satisfaction at the end is definitely worth the frustration as you grind your way through from checkpoint to checkpoint. At times I noticed my elevated heart-rate from the intensity of playing this game. Pretty decent visuals, great music, and a heck of a fun challenge if you have it in you.

Recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
Wow, great game! While the early puzzles are fairly easy, the difficulty gradually ramps up and within a few levels a lot of the game elements begin to combine into puzzles that are genuinly difficult to consistently pass. 'Consistently' being the operative word, as you die a LOT (or at least I did) and so therefore have a lot of chances to perfect your technique. Happily though the respawn points are liberally placed and there's no limit to your number of tries, so no worries.

Graphics looks great on a high end-machine with 4K monitor and is very smooth. Love looking down at all of the levels that you've done and up at the one's you're still to do. Thought the music is pretty good, although some of the sound effects get a bit repetative after you've heard them for the hundredth time.

Really fun and inventive and, in my oppinion, by far the best puzzle game since the portal series and better in many ways. Great work.
 
Dreadnought
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2022
There's a lot here that I shouldn't like. Jumping puzzles in a first person shooter. Floaty physics. Combining black granite with neon lite for the only aesthetic in the entire game. A forgettable story. Catering to speedrunners.

So why do I like this? And without sarcasm or anything: I do like deadcore. Not that it's in my favorite games, but, say, a personal 7/10 is impressive considering what it has all what I mentioned earlier in spades.
The best explanation I can give myself is that it's like the negatives cancel each other out somehow. By being consistent in the theme and aesthetics and having a minimal story, it's enticing somehow ("what IS that huge-ass floating modern asteroid belt/tower thing?"). The floatiness sort of gives an excuse to take your time if you want to (you don't HAVE to care that the level time is literally written on your freaking gun).. Oh, and okay: there's a constant "whoa, this is HIGH! And I'm continuously climbing EVEN HIGHER!" feeling.

I do like how the menu's are slick, easy to navigate and fitting with the theme. But...I wish the level design was fantastic, but to be fair I found it serviceable. A long string of challenges to overcome. You get a few (at least one) upgrade along the way, but other than those being to good use, I'd say the challenges could have been roughly in any order.

But really: it does what it sets out to do, and that's enough. It will give you challenge. You can be sucked into it if you want to. And I can't complain about the price somehow. I may not be stellar enthusiast about it, but it deserves its thumbs up. :-)
 
Taleweaver

2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 septembre 2015
I really wanted to give this game a good review, and recommend it, but I can't. The gameplay really dragged on with the only change as you progressed being the frustration of the obstacles. For about two hours I had a lot of fun with the fast gameplay and the gorgeous graphics. However, that is really the only good thing I can say. Th difficulty curve was harsh and unforgiving. About and hour and a half in I hit a point where it became more frustrating then fun. The enemies don't make it harder or more interesting, just more annoying. the story is only told through logs, and I think if it was presented through a driven in-game story the game could have benefitted. The game also feels like it drags on. after two hours I would look up and feel like I was only a quarter of the way up the tower, which was really disheartening. Do I really want to keep doing this same thing for the next 5-7 hours? The answer was no. So I stopped playing.
 
Reeze The Vampire

Non recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2021
As others have mentioned, this game is quite similar to Portal in how it plays. The main difference between this game and Portal is that this one is way faster, which gets your adrenaline going quite a bit. If that sounds like your sort of game, then I would recommend buying it when it goes on a large discount (such as the current 75% discount) but not for full price. Why?

The game is quite short; it is divided into five large levels. For reference, I managed to complete two of them in half an hour. The level design itself is okay at best, but there isn't really anything too memorable. Lastly the game lacks polish in several areas:

- The physics are quite wonky.
- There is a strange 50 FPS cap on the camera which is extremely disorienting on a higher refresh rate monitor (the game itself is not capped at 60 fps).
- The artstyle, although very pretty in my opinion, takes shortcuts in many areas for the worse.

Overall, if you have already played Portal, A Story About My Uncle, AND other similar games, but are still craving more, then you should get this game on discount. Otherwise, I would suggest you play those games first and see if you still want more afterwards.
 
Mireska~
515 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
14.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2016
인류는 지구를 망치고 그 자신들이 망쳐놓은 지구를 버렸습니다.

하지만 다른 거주지를 찾지 못하자 잠시 우주에 머물며 지구를 개선하기로 합니다.

그래서 시작한것이 안티-라이프 프로젝트입니다.

그동안 쓸데없이 창조해낸 기계들과 인간이 살아간 흔적, 그 이외의 유기물 모두, 즉 지형빼고 전부 파멸시키는 계획을 세웁니다.

그 뒤 지구를 다시 채워넣는 계획을 한거죠.

거대한 기둥을 세우고 그를 기준으로 닿기만 해도 허용되지 않는 물질은 사라지는 장막을 펼칩니다.

지구의 밑 바닥부터 시작하는 플레이어는 이 프로젝트로 제거되는 하나의 안드로이드중 하나입니다.

하지만 이 안드로이드는 사랑하는 사람이있었나, 아무튼 감정이 있어서 반드시 살아남아 이 파멸을 멈추려고 합니다.

과연. 당신(안드로이드)은 그저 파멸을 막지못하고 죽을것인가요? 아니면 그래도 남아있는 지구의 생명체와 다른 안드로이드들의 삶을 이어줄것인가요?

그 결과는 당신이 가진 활성화 총에 달려있습니다!



P.s. 위 스토리는 픽션입니다.

 
Low Quality Player
194 produits enregistrés

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
3
Recommandé
24.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2019
I originally got this gifted but couldn't redeem it because of region restrictions. I found the game quite attracting though, so I ended up purchasing it.
Anyway, I did not regret it at all! It's a fun, interesting platformer with great mechanics that unfold as you progress through the game, the graphics and ambient music go well together and will immerse you in neat, different environments each time...
The only downsides I found are, firstly the lack of a proper game reset (to be able to replay the whole game without any skills or items once fully completed) and secondly, a storyline that's a little bland / confusing. On a gameplay perspective though, it's amazing and it will captivate you (and make you rage occasionally).
 
Tosic Nunja
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2015
SFチックなブロックとレーザーで構成されたステージをチェックポイント目指してジャンプするFPS。
ジャンプタイミングやAIM力といった技術よりも、同じ道を何度も通って何度も失敗しても折れない心を要求される。

ワープホールを開けられないポータルシリーズのようなゲームをイメージするとわかりやすいと思う。
ただ、最初にも書いたようにポータルのようなパズルというよりは、順路やギミックを覚えるゲームになっている。
その分ギミックをどう超えればよいのかという"詰み状態"になることはあまりない。しかし、各チェックポイントの配置されている空間は同じであるため、正規ルート以外を意図せずにせよ通ることが出来てしまう。
出来てしまうというのは、それを運が良かったととらえるか、進んだのか戻ったのかわからないといったマイナスにとらえるか、いろいろあるからである。

ところで、ほかの方のレビューに3D酔いするといったものがある。
メジャーどころからマイナーどころまで、リアル系からスポーツ系まで結構な数のFPSを遊んできたが、3D酔いしたのは初めてである。
重力能力を使うあたりから3D酔いする可能性が高いと思われる。

参考動画(微ネタバレ注意)
Vidéo YouTube™: DEADCORE - Pretty Portal-like Platforming

br00tal Ask me all the things in the world: http://ask.fm/DaavPuke TWITTER: http://twitter.com/DaavPuke TWITCH: http://www.twitch.tv/daavpuke STEAM ID: http://steamcommunity.com/id/DaavPuke
 
rin_jugatla
520 produits enregistrés
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2014
I'm at a bit of an edge about writing a review with whether I recommend this game or not. I'd rather say, I don't recommend this to any casual player. This game is technically similar to "They Bleed Pixels", except the game has checkpoints rather than "place your own savepoint" mechanic (thankfully), and it has more puzzle elements to it (gravity manipulation, switching stuff on and off)

So what does that mean? It means this game is a B**** to beat, it makes you RAGE at every opportunity. Now, you might say, yeah you're bad and you should feel bad, learn to play instead of whining.

But the problem is that the game doesn't give you breathing room many many times, EVERYTHING is timed, shooting the fans is PIXEL-PERFECT precision targetting and twitch reflex (especially the laser gates, those are really irritating and the only real way to dash past them is, well, trying again and again), jumps need to be near-pixel-perfect, and the moment you'd just stand by to look around you realize there's a Trooper in your face and WHOOPS YOU GOT KNOCKED OFF THE LEDGE DO IT AGAIN LOL

The game's story is told via "Logs". Now, Logs are a secret item. You need to "explore" in order to find them. However, considering pretty much everything in this game can kill you (and they will, because they are unkillable, you can just "delay" enemies) - Exploration is pretty much non-existent. If you stop to look around, you die by the monsters or the turrets or the time on the gravity modifier switch running out or pretty much anything.

Basically, you're damned if you do, damned if you don't. Exploration is difficult, even though the game itself says it encourages it, but in honesty, the game mechanics really don't. Also, you need extremely good timing with twitch reflex and the like, and to be honest, it's a bit beyond me, so it's more of a "trial-and-error did I get lucky or not" experience for me rather than something that's actually fun - unlike Super Meat Boy Light World which did it right.

I mean really, this is basically a 3D "Torture Platformer", as TotalBiscuit would say.

Get it ONLY if you are an EXTREME MASOCHIST who literally enjoys having to do the same thing 40 times so that you can do it pixel-perfectly before you can move on to the next obstacle which is progressively harder and harder. I'm pretty sure there were areas where I died and respawned 100 times. What is this sh**.

I'm going to beat this game once, then probably not play it again - even though if it didn't have enemies that fly around and just screw you over, and the lasers that you have to dash through at a pixel-perfect time while you're in midair, I'd probably enjoy it a lot more. But I don't...

And then there's that enemy at the end which you can shoot down and paralyze (as you cannot kill them) only with 10 ammo, you have 30 max, and if they shoot you then it's instant death, and I couldn't dodge them even though I was dashing. At least you don't have to hit it on one specific pixel like the fans, though. A moving pixel. I don't see how that's fun, that made me retry a particular area 10 times merely because I ran out of bullets trying to hit that thing.

Verdict: If what you enjoy about games is that they're extremely challenging and you have to try again and again and again and again to get it right, and the most important thing for you is to overcome challenges and feel good about your ability, and you are an extreme masochist who doesn't get pissed off by having to respawn and try again WAY TOO MUCH, then this might be the game for you. I mean, it does look cool, after all. The music is decent. It's just the game that's literally tedious. I'm a try-hard too, but this game is a bit too much even for me.

(yes, I did play VVVVVV. If I want to compare, this is like having to beat Veni Vidi Vici between each checkpoint, except you get random monster encounters in the middle, and it becomes longer and longer and longer and longer with more spikes and more pixel-perfect obstacles)

BUT IF YOU ACTUALLY WANT TO KNOW WHAT'S IN THIS GAME:
- Platforming (lots of it - double jumping, dashing, shooting at things, walking in walls)
- Switching stuff on and off with the gun (you have to switch em off or you die, or time turning things on or you die)
- Gravity manipulation (which of course is also timed, it happens in certain areas where the map provides it - it can be kinda fun but also extremely confusing, and finding which way to go is a pain sometimes - but if it isn't being an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ then it's actually kinda fun)
- Trying to find which way to go because once the gravity manipulation comes in and you have to fall down dodge 4 laser gates then dash out to the left and shoot at the gravity switch, it's kinda not intuitive.
- Frustration
- Cool visuals
- Decent music

MOST IMPORTANTLY:
If you like a game to be really difficult and challenging, then by all means do get it. Hell, you may even tell me that I just suck and this isn't as hard as I made it seem! Because my issues were mostly with how fine-tuned the game was to screw you over pretty much at all times. So for those who are hardcore players, I do indeed recommend this.
 
zhunGamerTTV (人^▽')～

An amazing first-person platformer. It's visually stunning and the music and atmosphere make the experience into some sureal Tron-like tower climb. Évaluation publiée le 30 octobre 2014
DeadCore, c'est le premier véritable jeu de cinq amis français, qui en ont apparemment chacun une dans le caleçon puisqu'ils ont créé un studio nommé 5 Bits Games. Mais DeadCore, c’est aussi et surtout un titre qui, après avoir connu moult péripéties - à savoir une naissance à l'occasion du 7DFPS 2012, un changement de nom et une campagne participative - avant de finalement trouver un éditeur en la présence de Namco Bandai, voit le jour sur PC et Mac. Du coup, l'heure est venue pour nous de le Dea(d)Core-tiquer...

Et pour voir comment, c'est par ici que ça se passe :

http://www.gamelove.com/test-jeux-video/test-deadcore-121002
 
Pilif

Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2016
DeadCore makes me feel like a speed run master.

8/10

Worth the price?:$10.99 is a decent price for the quality of game, but a sale wouldn't hurt.

PROS:
-Very nice visuals
-Plays smoother then silk
-Balanced difficulty curve
-Simple to get the hang of quickly
-Lots of routes and things to collect make levels very re-playable

♥♥♥:
-Menus are bland (Only ♥♥♥ I could think of)

Playing this game is so smooth and enjoyable, it makes me feel like a professional speed runner by how quickly the game makes you feel like you are doing difficult things usually with little effort. Levels have lots of route options and each of those can usually be done multiple ways, some of which can feel like exploits but its hard to say if they actually are, that's how much freedom in your movement this game gives you. The game is fast paced and doesn't time you unless you are going for high scores so there is no stress of trying to beat a clock, which makes such a fast game relaxing almost. I would recommend this game to hardcore and casual players as it caters to both perfectly. Nyooooming through this game has been a joy.
 
.Bippy.

Recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2015
Es un juego más de habilidad y velocidad que de pensar o resolver puzzles. No es un Portal pero no le hace falta. Hay zonas muy difíciles que tendrás que repetir una y otra vez, acordándote de la madre de los que hicieron el juego. Siempre hay varias rutas para llegar a tu camino, por lo que si te atascas en uno puedes intentarlo por otro lado.

No hay mucha historia detrás del juego, aparecemos en el mapa y debemos ir avanzando y subiendo niveles. Saltos, piruetas, cambios de gravedad, andar por las paredes, esquivar rayos laser y robots que nos intentarán tirar al abismo, jugar ♥♥♥ la supervelocidad, etc... lo dicho, un juego de habilidad. Si eres un poco muñones, dedicate a otra cosa.

Juego para jugarlo ♥♥♥ teclado y ratón. Y recuerda, mucha paciencia.

Nota: 8/10

Évaluation publiée le 17 avril 2018
Great game for speedrunning / time trials. Controls are good, there's a lot of room for freedom in the level design, and optimizing your best times just feels good.

As for ♥♥♥♥, the enemies can be a bit annoying sometimes. There's a seemingly frame perfect trick that can save you a ton of time, which makes getting perfect time trials feel almost impossible. And finally, the top times on the leaderboards are all cheated.


Those are honestly minor things to me though. Solid recommendation.

Évaluation publiée le 31 octobre 2014
Mesmerizing first-person platform game with the most soothing, minimalist presentation. Tough puzzles that require both precision and wit at the same time. Open and malleable progress that lets players "break" puzzle directions. It can, however, get disorienting at times and some technical troubles make the already intense challenge rating even crueler. Still, one of the better titles in the genre, ever since Portal.

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
9.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2016
"RUN,JUMP,CLIMB"
。単純に言えばそんな感じか。
あまりにもピュアにアクション性を追求したものであり、自分がゲームオンチかどうかはっきりとわかってしまうタイプのゲームである。
2Dのプラットフォーマ―ゲームをやりこんだ人なら時間を忘れて没頭してしまうだろう。

敵は兵士ではなくマップ中に仕掛けられたトラップだ。敵らしい敵といえば2面以降で登場する"どついたろかマシーン(仮称)"だろうか。
幾何学模様のような背景はとても美しくSSを撮るだけでもいい感じに画になるので楽しい。

このレビューを書いている時点で筆者は3面をクリアしたばかり。すでにrespawn数は200に迫り、そのうち100回以上は「触ったら死んじゃうレーザー(仮称)」で炙られている。最終面をクリアするまで先は長そうだ。

('16/02/10追記)
やっと全5面をクリアした。それまでのdeath / respawn数は677回に達し、見事「Digital BBQ」の実績を解除しましたとさ。めでたしめでたし。
ルールがシンプルでありながら、しかしそれゆえにトラップを切り抜けるためにわずかな狂いも許されない正確な動きやタイミング合わせなどシビアなゲーム観は往年のプラットフォーマ―そのものだった。あ、さっきも言ったなこれ。

銃撃戦に飽きて、広大な景色の中を飛んだり跳ねたり回ったり、ロボットにどつかれたりDigital BBQされちゃいたい人におすすめです('ω')ｖ
 
NadjaRyushkin
171 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 décembre 2014
To call this game beautiful would be selling it short. The environment is downright stunning. About half of my first playthrough was spent just staring at the scenery. Add into that a first-person platformer puzzle game, and you've got a great way to spend a day.

While speed is definitely very much a part of the game, it is more than worthwhile to explore a bit, as you might find alternate routes, helpful powerups, or even just a spectacular view. The different paths makes for great replayability, and a speedrun system pits you against yourself and others, so while it took me 4 hours to get through the story mode (the first time--3 hours the second) there is still a lot of game left in this.

If you enjoy a good-looking game, difficult puzzles, and fun platforming, then pick this up!
 
Onychoprion

An absolute gem and completely under the radar so don't miss on this, one of the first games I've played through to the end in a while as most games just don't keep me hooked.

More Core please!

Recommandé

1小时56分26秒通关
