毕竟谁都不想如此
9/10

2017.7.12
------------------------------------------------------------
2019年3月更新

差评更为好评

在游玩DOOM毁灭战士300h后，我成功在1h之内打完了故事模式，顺便把额外的星火跑道也全部解锁通关了。

登上的塔顶，
那一刻...
真的太美了！

工作室很小，好像只有5，6个人吧，很喜欢这款游戏，期待续作，虽然感觉也不可能有续作的可能。
另外剧情很有后现代的味道，真结局主角通升上天空宇宙里....他看到的究竟是什么？
我总是想起终末少女旅行这部番剧，到头主角们什么都没有得到看到，只有空无...

其实根本就没有什么乌托邦和弥赛亚，
到头来只有拉康所言的“主体的空无”....

不好意思...话多了就搞这种过度解释了，总之我真的喜欢这款游戏。
以上。
 
梅比乌斯教授
377 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
41.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2014
Deadcore is a well-crafted, really challenging and particularly immersive piece of gaming experience.
Concept is simple, and level design does really well at iterating on the various level ingredients, resutling in a consistent curve in difficulty. Signs and feedbacks are pretty clear, and the player has a strong sensation of control over its actions.

Puzzles can be sometimes hardcore, but patterns are always manageable to understand and control over practice. Death & Retry is the core gameplay loop, but it's never frustrating as we're dealing here with "fair" difficulty, where only the player can be in cause of failure (not the game itself).

Finally, the atmosphere is amazing, both graphics and sound do a pretty good job at putting the player in a true sensation of vertical immensity, and the falls are always scary, which brings a good tension into the mix.

Great job 5Bit Games ! I'm really enjoying this so far, hope it will keep up like this until the end (I think I'm halfway through the game right now).
 
Jambolard
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2015
A platformer for the twitch-shooters, DeadCore features perfect jump controls and levels that are just frustrating enough that you'll keep retrying one jump for 20 minutes. It also features a special gun that can activate and deactive platforms, boost pads and other stuff. You can also unlock other moves, such as Dash, but I haven't prgressed that far.
PROS
  • Simple concept done very well.
  • Looks great.
  • Awesome music.
  • Doesn't get repetitive.

♥♥♥♥
  • Can be frustrating sometimes (the tunnels when you first get Dash has me stuck for 20 minutes).
  • Sometimes you feel rushed, as though you aren't allowed to explore.
  • If you aren't a speedrunner, not much replay value.

THE VERDICT
Get it if you like plaformers, this is a great one!
 
GR1LLED`

Évaluation publiée le 24 mars 2021
FPS/Plateforme. Et j'insiste sur le côté FPS, parce qu'il va falloir shooter, vite et bien.

Je ne vais pas présenter ce jeu, j'imagine que quasi tout le monde le connait, il a beaucoup fait parler de lui à l'époque de sa sortie. Un double saut, un dash, un flingue mutiusage.

Malgré quelques passages très retors limite die&retry, j'ai bien aimé mes 3h19 passés à sauter partout en esquivant des pièges mortels et à tirer sur des ennemis. Le level design est vraiment excellent (les étendues sont gigantesques, il faut bien observer son environnement pour progresser), les sensations sont présentes, que demander de plus. Ah si, peut-être un bestiaire un peu moins basique, parce que déjà les robots c'est pas ouf dans un jeu vidéo, mais 3 types de robots différents on se lasse vite.

Recommandé
16.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 février 2018
One of the best platformers I've ever played. The movement is fluid, it feels really good. The OST is just amazing, the speedrun music is the sickest Jungle beat music I know. The difficulty curve is really nicely made, it's made in such a way that it maintains synchronized with your skill progress, so you always find the appropiate amount of challenge. The style is the definition of "simple but effective" somehow minimalistic sci-fi desing that does its work perfectly, not overcharged and not excesively minimalistic. The mechanics are solid, rewarding and really well coordinated with the maps so you feel really comfortable with all the levels. The lore is simply magic, really creative and mostly, really well scructured background story.

Nothing more to say, this game is a masterpiece in the 3D platformer world, you HAVE to buy this

Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2014
我这么说吧
这游戏
真尼玛
好玩！！！！！！
等打完再写详细点吧
————————————初步打通的分割线————————————————
游戏分为五大关，难度逐步增大（废话）
刚开始还好，正常的跑酷游戏，中间学个dash，仔细琢磨就可以过去。
然后到了获得G-mod(不是那个gaymod)后，整个游戏突然变得不好了。
一直改变重力的方向，走着走着你就不知道哪些是真正的重力哪些是G-mod作用区的重力，很容易让人产生眩晕感。
最后一关太难了……简直没法玩，往上爬果然难。
于是向全收集进发and打速度赛

Non recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2015
Hard one to review.

Ultimately I would only recommend this game to someone in love with the first person jump puzzle genre.

It's fiendishly hard, the sound effects are good, and it has some nice graphical aesthetics.

On my macbook pro I had to wind down the graphics options to minimal to get a steady framerate (required to not die) and even then I get occasional judder.

The big problem is what many other reviewers state... The controls are a bit stiff, and it doesn't ever feel like I'm getting better at it. Every time I go for one of the tiny platforms I feel like there's a really good chance I'll miss it and plumet to my instant death.

If you're really into first person trick jumping then maybe you'll like it, however the majority of gamers won't enjoy this game
 
theTrav
522 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2015
It's a Unity game, it looks like a Unity game with the choppy switch gun animations and the high resolution skybox that feels fresh out of a demonstration video, it feels like Unity in that hardware on the lower range will probably suffer. The backstory is a weak excuse to sprinkle collectibles around the levels (there's only twenty of them, they're text logs), and the plot is about as deep as the end sequence to Mass Effect 3. Speaking of three, that's about how many hours it takes to get the true ending from when you start the game for the first time.

This is the part where you imagine the stern face, the frown, and the shaking of head. This is then the part where you tell yourself, 'who cares! I'm going fast! Wheeee! There's times to beat, things to collect, one way to go, and that's up!'

As you should! Deadcore feels tight. The running, the jumping, the dashing, the rocket jumping, the platforming, racing along a knife's edge to some sick beats along the looming specter of some inexplicable tower, it's absolutely exhilarating. Once you get a feel for the game, once you learn how to get to the end of the level, well, that's where the racing starts. There's achievements, there's developer times to beat, your friends' times to beat, your own times- you will feel yourself getting better at the game and you might surprise yourself with how quickly you do.

A caveat, though- the game's kind of hard. It's very possible that Mr. Real Time Strategy On Weekends or Mr. Really Good At Last Hits isn't going to make it to the end. There's no losing condition, though, and with as 'short' as the game is, it makes it a very feasible goal. There's no grinding. There's no timewaster, no character progression. There's just you and your own skill.

Sure, maybe you can get the true ending in three hours, but there are completionist goals, and the brevity of the game keeps them refreshingly in reach. Again, it's not about putting the time in, it's about gaining skill, and pushing yourself like few games these days push you. And let me tell you, pushing yourself to make it to the top of the tower in under one hour... Mmmngh. Good feeling.

If you're a twitchy shootery kind of guy, or you dig fast paced platformers, and you think you'll enjoy finding the logs, music, and crushing time records, the game's definitely worth the ten bucks. If you're not, or not so sure of your skill, jump for it when it's on sale. It's popped up in a few game bundles already, so it shouldn't ever be too long between sales.
 
Naxza
511 produits enregistrés
1
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2015
This game is so much fun. Not only that, it's absolutely beautiful as well.

The best game I can think to compare this to, believe it or not is Super Meat Boy. Like SMB, Deadcore is a fast-paced trial-and-error platformer. Only this time, it's in first person.

The environment is breathtaking, and the audio only adds to an already fantastic atmosphere. Combine that with the story (here, in the form of collectable text logs) and you have a play space that truly needs no improvement.

Some might argue about that story I mentioned, pointing that it's not so much a story as it is a setting. And I'd say, they're right. BUT, in this case, that isn't a bad thing! The story ONLY exists to add to the atmosphere. This game's main focus is on the gameplay.

And hot damn is the gameplay fun. That said, it is CHALLENGING. It's not the hardest trial-and-error game I've played, but it's certainly no cakewalk. So don't go into this one expecting a casual romp through techno land.

There are, however, two big downsides for this title. The first isn't too important, but it's worth mentioning: the collectables emit a high-pitch screech that REALLY hurts my ears. I may just be sensitive to that sort of thing, and I'm sure it's just there to help you locate them. But really, it seems unnecisary.

Second, and more important, the length. This game is 5 levels long. Each level will take you around 30 minutes to beat on your first run through. Now, each level has a fork in the path, allowing you to choose one of two routes to take. This means that, including level replays to maximize content, you're going to be spending a total of 5 hours on this title. (unless you plan on dedicating time to perfecting your speedruns.)
I just can't help but feel like the game is SCREAMING for more content.

Even with it's flaws, I think this is a great game, and will fit perfectly in the library of anyone who likes fast-pased action platforming.


All in all, I give the game 8.5/10
 
twisted_hammer
675 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2020
This game is a pretty good hardcore platformer with a simple, but fun movement system. It's the type of game that could take you a solid 20+ deaths between checkpoints especially towards the end of the game as difficulty ramps up so if you don't like that sort of masochistic gameplay don't buy this. I'd say I'm mildly competent at these sorts of games and my playthrough was about 5 hours which is easily worth 9.99 considering this game has mild replayability as you'll be given different paths to the end in some levels. 8/10 solid game.

Non recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 janvier 2017
Jeu qui pourrait faire penser à Portal au premier abord, il en est finalement très différent. Ici, point de portail, mais des passages à ouvrir, des ponts à abaisser, des murs à éviter, tout ça avec votre pistolet. Sur le papier ça sonne bien, d'autant que la campagne de financement participatif a été fructueuse.
Cependant, une fois que l'on démarre le jeu, on se rend compte du problème, absolument énorme et inacceptable pour un jeu de plateforme : des problèmes de hitbox partout ! Si vous êtes un pixel trop court, hop vous loupez la plateforme et vous mourrez, aucun droit à l'erreur ! Des murs de laser plus larges qu'ils n'y paraissent, sans parler des blocs d'inversion de gravité, qui vont faire hurler, au sens propre.
Bref, jeu énervant non par sa difficulté mais par sa désolante imprécision.
 
Foucal

9.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2020
At least 25% of the time when you try to double jump it just will fail and cause you to die. Another huge problem is the gravity field mechanic is extremely wonky. On the edges of these fields, the game physics tweak out and are extremely disorienting because your camera is constantly flipping around. Finally, a large percentage of the routes are much harder if you do them the intended way instead of abusing the already broken platforming and physics to circumvent them, which is extremely disappointing.

Recommandé
24.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2016
Brilliant platformer, I loved every second *cough* *cough* (mosquitoes anyone?)

The game offers so many possibilities to reach the top of the tower, it's awesome. Some routes are harder therefore faster, some require perfect handling/timing therefore shorter and others can be tricky. Sounds like all routes are hard? Kinda, especially if you are not used to such a fast-paced action. You will have hard times at the beginning but that's not a reason to give up. Controls are intuitive and your first lessons will be done quickly. As longer you play as more fun does it, as easier becomes the game.

I bought the game because it seemed to be a puzzler like Portal 2. The priority of the game is clearly the fast-paced action. Real puzzles are missing also when it gets tricky to figure a path sometimes or when you have to master the handling of your weaponry.

Every game has also its downsides... leaderboards are filled with times which has been achieved while using bugs/exploits. Therefore fight for the best times exclusively between your friends. Also worth mentioning, the game offers way too less content, at least it feels so because you want to play way more levels when you reached the top once.

Overall, definitely worth the bucks, can't wait for a sequel. :lol: Hope is the last thing to die.
 
pew pew pew
1
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
34.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 avril 2016
Pour avoir joué à pas mal de jeu de plate-forme depuis la NES, je peux vous dire que Deadcore est un très bon jeu en vue à la première personne et original qui plus est, il cumul les bons points malgré deux défauts.


Les qualités:
- Le jeu est beau, le style graphique est simple et original.
- La bande-son est excellente et colle très bien au jeu.
- Les commandes fonctionnent parfaitement et correspondent parfaitement au gameplay et aux parcours.


Les défauts:
- Pas d'indication sur le niveau de difficulté de certaines parties des niveaux qui son très costaudes voire particulièrement dures (vive le glichte).
- Ça manque de niveaux à mon goût, je m'attendais à un plus grand nombre.


L'histoire est assez secondaire et sommaire, bien qu'originale, mais l'univers de ce jeu aurait mérité plus de profondeur et il y a une carte à jouer la-dessus.


J'ai réussis à découvrir toutes les étincelles, tous les logs et toutes les musiques, il ne me manque plus qu'à trouver deux compétences pour le SwitchGun et c'est bon. Vu mon handicap et les conséquences engendrées, je trouve ça pas mal.


Globalement, je recommande ce jeu.
 
AMX-13

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2015
It's a great game. I'm not a huge fan of platformers, but this one really took me for a few reasons:

1. The level design is some of the best I've ever seen. The early stages in particular are fantastic and the developers really use verticality to their advantage. This becomes less true towards the end (this might also be due to my lack of skill), but at the same time a form of backtracking is introduced that feels great, new, and allows a sence of freedom and accomplishment rather than the tedious slog that backtracking typically is.

2. The game teaches you how to play better. As someone who sucks ass, this is a big deal for me. The game can be frustrating as it ratchets up the difficulty, but it also helps me improve and get better, quickly replacing any frustration with a feeling of accomplisment. This is huge.

3. General atmosphere/aesthetic. So at first I wasn't huge on the visuals. But the way everything fits together, from the logs to the crunchy sound effects to the art style to the music to the third dimension and first person rather than 2d is beautiful.

4. You can go fast. Yay.

Really recommend this game. Glad I picked it up.
 
White Grey
416 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2015
This is one of those "I really want to like this game, BUT..."-reviews

This game is basically a really funny fps-jump and run, but it lacks the most important thing: good controls.

The point is you have to be very precise in your jumps but you can't, because the controls itself are as precise as using one of those old Atari Sticks with even older boxing gloves.

At first I thought I'm just not good enough, but after a hundred "misjumps" I'm pretty sure it's on the devs... Try it for yourself: Walk to the edge of platform and watch yourself slipping over, it's just badly done!

And then on the second level there are new enemies introduced, which push you off the edge plus the platforms become really small... AND there are lasers (everyone loves lasers :) but they only kill you, enemies don't care about... Nah I'm done with this game.

If you like frustrating experiences (and I'm not talking about hard games like "Super Meatboy" which HAS precise controls and is therefore challenging...) go have a look!
It's really a cool game besides the controls, but you know... ;)

Un jeu avec une ambiance hors du commun, un petit quelque chose qui le classe parmis ceux qu'on aime ou qu'on déteste mais qui ne vous laissera clairement pas indifférent. Pour ma part je suis déjà en train de refaire le mode histoire car si on le fini rapidement, la courbe d'apprentissage est telle qu'on ne refait jamais 2 fois totalement le même parcours (ou parkour devrais-je dire tellement on s'en inspire).
Le classement mondial vous donnera un objectif à battre, libre à vous de tenter ou non de vous classer.
Attention, le niveau est rude !

Now how can I review this game. It's a really good game that lets you practice speedrunning or even just enjoy. As you play through the levels you will notice that you can find upgrades to your "gun" (don't know what to call it). Many levels (if not all levels) you can just play and have fun. I have seen that many people compare this game to portal and that is not really correct. It gives you a portal feeling, so if you liked portal you will definitely love this game. In my opinion this game is seriously underated and deserves a lot more plays.

I'm giving this game a 9/10.

Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2015
3D fast paced platformer designed for speed running. If you loved inMomentum or Cloudbuilt, you'll love this one too. It gives more options for exporation, but slows the game down a bit compared to the other two. The difficulty isn't quite as high as cloudbuilt's later stages, but its certainly not easy. The players special abilities are innovative (especially the form of gravity manipulation used). I highly recommend.

Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2015
Deadcore is the best FPS platformer speedrun game ever made. Yes, really.

This game will teach you HOW TO GAME.

It's the most challenging, most elegant, most compelling game I've ever seen. I am addicted. I am obsessed. I cannot stop playing it. Yes, I got all the achievements. Yes, it took me forever. Yes, I'm going to reset it and do it all over again. Yes, I would pay for it again. Yes, for full price.

BUY IT. Buy it, and get an extra copy to give to that friend of yours who loves to brag about speedrunning. WATCH YOUR FRIEND CRY AND TEAR OUT ALL THEIR HAIR. Then, laugh smugly knowing that you have shared something magical. Your friend will forgive you when the game is finished.

It's worth a thousand times its price. Enjoy the sweet torture.


_________________________________________________________
EN FRANCAIS

Deadcore est le meilleur jeu jamais fait. Oui, vraiment.

Ce jeu va vous apprendre gaming.

Ce est le plus élégant, jeu le plus convaincant je ai jamais vu. Je suis accro. Je suis obsédé. Je ne peux pas arrêter de jouer. Oui, je ai les toute réalisations. Oui, il m'a fallu une éternité. Oui, je vais le remettre à zéro et de le faire encore une fois.

Achetez-le. Achetez-le, et obtenir une copie supplémentaire de donner à celle de vos amis qui aime à se vanter speedrunning. Regardez votre ami pleurer et arracher hors tous leurs cheveux. Puis, rire d'un air sachant que vous avez partagé quelque chose de magique. Votre ami vous pardonner quand le jeu est terminé.

Deadcore est valeur une mille fois ce que vous payez. Supplice gentil.

Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2015
Do not be afraid of heights !

A really hardcore platformer-FPS, I've done 4 or 5 levels so far and some segments are really hard for my heart (he took me almost one hour to finish the last level I played last night...), I might have an heart attack before finishing the game. Some timing and placements are closed to frame/pixel perfect but if you're not affraid to die and retry go for it.

It seems to have a decent lifetime with multiple forks on each level and some segments are unlockable with mechanics acquired in next levels.

Plus everything is already in place to speedrun for the bravest. :-)

Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Le nouveau Plateformer/Puzzle à la première personne de référence, conçu pour le speedrun et donc rejouable à l'infini. Le jeu propose un level design époustouflant qui évite les redondances. Malgrès l'aspect linéaire, il y a un vrai côté exploration pour aller chercher les différents bonus cachés un peu partout dans l'environnement.

J'ai fini le jeu en trois heures, avec une bonne heure "hardue" de die & retry qui m'a donné un peu de motion sickness. Si vous êtes fan de bunny hopping et rocket boost foncez sur ce jeu ! Pour 9.99 cela vaut totalement le coût!

Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2014
I'm not much into "speedrunning" I just like to get to the finish. It's a pretty well put together game. It's fluid, and has just the right amount of difficulty to make it fun. It get's harder and harder but throw's it at you over time. You hardly notice it's getting harder until you take a step back and realize what you just went through compared to when you first started.

You can't beat the price and I would recommend this to anyone who just wants a game to play to keep your gaming reflexes sharp or just to have a nice puzzle platformer to scratch an itch every now and then. I die a lot, but through attrition I eventually work my way up the tower and get satisfaction doing it.

I hope they release some DLC to keep the tower going higher and higher!

Recommandé
5.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Мне понравилось.
Нет ничего навязчивого. Есть загадка. Есть что-то интересное. До сих пор гадаю, что было бы если бы я пошёл не тем путём, каким пошёл. Можно не хило срезать пути, мождно не идти самым очевидным путём. Нет нужной обцчалки, как в других играх. Смахивает на портал, но портал начинался более нудно и этот голос там иногда доставал.
А здесь есть подсказки, едва заметные, или бросающияся в глаза - как посмотреть. По крайней мере на них можно не обращать внимания и не занимают пол экрана. Абсолютно эргономично. Сразу видно, что человек играл до этого в игры, а не просто проснулся с идей, что будет делать игры. Головоломки не тривиальные, над некоторыми нужно подумать. Несколько раз сам заходил в тцпик, пока не понимал, что это совсем не тупик.
Игра для тех, кто любит головоломки, пазлы, интересные поворты, исследовать каждый закоулок, залезть в каждую дыру. Хотя и для тех, кто любить просто пробедаться, постреляв там, где нужно - тоже не плохое убийство времени.

Красиво. Интересно. Рекомендую.

757 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
15.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2014
Sci-fi first-person puzzle-platformer. Very ethereal, gorgeous, metallic setting, with cool music to back up the pacing. Controls fairly tightly, but can be very frustrating if your reflexes are not up to par. Frequent respawns, and a decent amount of trial-and-error. If you were looking for another Portal, this isn't it. If you were looking for another Antichamber, this isn't that either.

There's a moderately interesting story hidden in the collectible logs (among the other collectibles), but you likely will miss big pieces if you don't collect all the logs.

It's pretty dang short and does have some replay value for those interested in collectibles and speedrunning... I got it on sale for $4 and felt that it was well worth it.

I would give it a 7/10, but it's an 8/10 in my book because I think I got a lot more satisfaction out of it than I expected for my purchase. If you're not a fan of first-person platforming, you should probably steer clear to save yourself frustration... It can get ragequit-inducing at times.
 
Futil1ty
1,144 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
28.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 avril 2020
First person platforming is very hard to do well - this is as good as it gets.
Timing (boosted) jumps, shooting switches, avoiding lasers, changing gravity - many elements here are combined again and again in many different facets. The Levels can be tackled a number of different ways; there is no real out of bounds there, they are open for players to try to circumvent parts of them by getting boosts from moving blocks.
The only problem I had was the broken resolution: I had to start the game windowed and then set it to fullscreen or else everything was stretched...

Nonetheless a very good game.

Look for speedruns of this game - they are highly entertaining too!

Non recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2017
Je suis partagé... le jeu est visuellement très réussi, mais la courbe de difficulté est abominable: dès le niveau 3, le jeu se transforme en die and retry, pusique des pièges invisibles depuis certains endroits se révèlent quand vous tombez dedans. Du coup, Deadcore se transforme en un jeu ou l'éxécution des combos au timing parfait devient votre seule priorité, et on perd rapidement l'intérêt porté à l'histoire ou au level design pourtant bien pensé. Je reste donc avec un arrière gout dans la bouche, celui du jeu qui avait du potentiel mais qui m'a rapidement dégouté.

Bon et puis ca ressemble quand meme beaucoup à Portal hein : mécaniques similaires (sauf celles des portails parcequ'il fallait pas que ce soit trop visible), ennemis semblables aux cubes d'aperture,...

Pas terrible, vraiment, en promo à la rigueur.

Par contre le mode speedrun est appréciable. Si vous voulez runner le jeu, tentez votre chance, mais il y a plus intéressant je trouve.

Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2019
вначале вроде норм, но когда начали идти уровни из разряда попробуй 20 раз подряд приземлиться на эти маленькие тоненькие платформы, расположенные в 150 метрах от изначальной точки, попутно отбрыкиваясь от различных лазеров, охраников и прочих становится не очень интересно (а если не получается, то начинаешь комбинацию в 20 прыжков заного)
по сути игра превращается в бесконечное сражение с управлением и параллельным поиском а куда же дальше прыгать

напомнило старые аркады на нинтендо (например марио), когда нужно было безупречно перепрыгать врагов, чтобы пройти уровень и всякие старые шутеры на ПК, где ради какого нибудь секрета необходимо было буквально по тоненьким едва заметным колонам/парапетам пропрыгать до какой нибудь заначки. лично я такое никогда не любил.

Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2014
the formula for a good game.
1.Make an original game concept
2.Give the player a new experience that they can't do in real life
3.enjoyable for all ages and player types
and while I play this game I look at that formula
and think " never seen it before, have never seen a huge-ass tower in real life,
and the major reason, if this games current level of difficulty was what easy
is, I think I would be outside right now."
that's all I have to say just the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ difficulty is a rancid mess with black
grimy paste all over covering the beautiful gem that is the game concept.
But don't get me wrong I still love the game, its a good looking game with an
epic and fresh idea, its just it when a player starts to get good at it, the game
practically kicks over you sense of accomplishment and smothers you under the
chloroform pillow that is its flaws.
but its a good challenge for casual players who just need something to pass the
time and not pass for a safe blood pressure.

An FPS-platforming game with interesting mechanics. You have a double jump, a dash, and a gun that you use to disable enemies, flip switches, and rocket jump. The levels are made so you have multiple paths to the exit so it makes you want to play the level multiple times. I accidentally finished a level with 0 seconds on my way to getting all the achievements. Overall very fun game and would recommend to platforming fans.

2,382 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
33.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2018
A brilliant speedrunning FPS/platformer with impeccable level design that can be brutally difficult but is always fair. Once you conquer the learning curve, you will feel godlike as you shoot, blast jump, and dash through non-linear levels that reward lightning reflexes, clever thinking, powers of observation, and a willingness to stray from the beaten path.

Deadcore is pleasing to both the eyes and ears, featuring vast, abstract architecture, gorgeous backdrops, and an ambient but energetic soundtrack perfect to accompany you hunting secrets or shaving seconds off of your time.

The game is short, featuring five "story" levels and an additional thirteen speedrun maps. While this may not seem like much, the "story" maps feature a plethora of routes and secrets that had me returning to them for more. For what it provides, it's well worth the price tag.

Deadcore is not for everybody. Seekers of a complex story may come away disappointed as the game's lore, while interesting, is vague at best and presented through a series of well-hidden log entires. The environment of metal and neon may feel repetitive to some, but the clever level design and speedrun-focus of the game more than make up for it. Finally, you will die. A lot. Especially when you are only starting to scale the learning curve.

For those up to the challenge, however, the tight controls, speed, and varied movement options will provide a rush that will keep you coming back for more.
 
Marquis
164 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
31.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mars 2015
DEADCORE REVIEW- COVERING THE GAME AS A WHOLE! (Tried to make this as complete as I could- sorry it's long).
After watching the trailers, I thought this looked like a pretty fun game... and boy did it deliver! When I dived into it, I was more than just in awe! Deadcore is definately on my list of top games in 2014! I highly recommend Deadcore to anyone who wants a challenge, or likes speed runs, fps puzzle, or platformers in general.

The gameplay is fast paced, extremely satisfying and the mechanics are brilliant. The general idea of the switch gun is simply genius, and adds a unique element to the game. The other abilities are also great- dash, g-mod and blast are unlocked further in and add more challenges and allow you to go back and explore previously unaccessible areas. Please note that the BLAST EXPLOIT HAS BEEN FIXED- so you can't use blast to climp up easily. You will have to play the legit way like I did! :p

The world itself is dangerous, mysterious and intriguing. It is quite an adventure through this game and it keeps you interested and curious. There are lots of different secrets to unlock- new pathways, and hidden collectibles- logs, music tracks, sparks, and more powerups- like ammo or dash boosts. The logs you find develop a small, story like explination that really adds to the feel of the game. Sparks unlock areas that are a faster route, but also more challenging. Exploring the world is unexpectedly fun- by that I mean that a first glance at the game would not suggest there is the exploration element. The soundtrack is perfect for the game- with a mix of fast paced, awesome tracks. The design is kinda Tron like, and suites the game perfectly.

It has a very good learning curve and a very high skill cap. You gain more abilities, experience and knowledge the further you get. Sometimes, you will get stuck on a particular part and it will be EXTREMELY RAGE INDUCING. My advice is to NOT RUSH and to analyse the challenge so you know where you're going wrong. Timing can be a very key factor to success. The enemies are cool but can be very frustrating, especially as I found the hit boxes on them are very small- one issue I had was that sometimes you hit the cubes and they don't deactivate- the shot needs to be too central for my liking. Wasps can be infuriating, and turrets are considerably rapid fire. The "bosses" are pretty awesome. Another issue I had was that you don't get a good feel of your size- meaning lazers can often hit you when you think you're clear. Some of the lazers I thought were a little too punishing- particularly ones that rotate. Also, I hate the laser tunnels you have to dash through. Sometimes the game offers little to no room for error- and the slightest wrong move can kill you.
This adds to the overall challenge though, and when you do get past that one bit you were stuck on, it is SO REWARDING! Each level gives new challenges that increase your skill. I myself am not very accurate and my reflexes aren't too sharp, but I feel they have improved because of this game- so what I'm saying is even the less skilled players can pick this game up and improve.
Lvl 1 is simple and pleasant- a good eye opener that leaves you jaw dropped in awe as you look up at the massive tower ahead. Lvl 2 is still quite easy, with some more tricky challenges. You are getting tested a bit more. Lvl 3, the difficulty starts to pick up a lot! Lvl 4, for me, was my least favourite lvl. It is the most demanding in terms of your pc- as you're in a storm of effects. The difficulty is extremely high and quite frustrating- mostly on the 1st time. Lvl 5 as a whole is shorter and a bit more rewarding than lvl 4. As a whole is it less difficult, but it has the hardest specific challenges. The end to lvl 5 is extremely rewarding- with a really epic challenge at the end. I won't spoil what you find at the end.

Conclusion: Deadcore is a genius game that I definately recommend. It is extremely challenging but equally rewarding. A FEW minor issues, but nothing you can't overcome eventually. AWESOME AND UNIQUE GAME- Want to thank the people behind this awesome game- Deadcore needs more recognition! I am a little sad that I have finished it! XD I would definately be up for a sequel! (That would need lots of thought though). DEADCORE IS AWESOME- BUY IT! 9/10
 
Red Panda!™
0

22.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2015
Feels like CS surfing/bhopping with enviromental manipulation.

I surf a lot, mainly in csgo. To be a better surfer, a base level understanding of map layout and player movement is essential to finishing with decent times. This same challenge applies to deadcore.

I see a lot of comparisons to portal here in the reviews.
Specific sounds are played at different times (like when you launch off of an air lift) similar to Portal 2, but use of a portal gun (thinking with portals) has no comparison in deadcore, to me.
Deadcore is about movement, memorization and effectiveness. not
puzzle solving, exploration, and story.

Deadcore allows for the player to decide their path based on their implementation of the dash, jump, and rocket jump. The gun is used to open doors, stun enemies, and rocket jump (for advanced players). I've been rewarded by this game's challenge, and I have enjoyed the upgradability and stortytelling from finding collectables.
 
river
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 octobre 2016
This is a FPS puzzle platformer, and it is actually very well made in terms of mechanics, graphics, audio, and the like. The game also does a great job at integrating the tutorial into early levels. The first few levels are linear and give you a good feel for how the game plays. However, after teaching you the essentials of how to play, the game opens up into a maze of pathways, making it difficult to figure out where you are even supposed to go and what you need to do to get there. I would normally consider this a good thing for most games in this genre, but for Deadcore, it just makes the game more frustrating the fun.

Checkpoints are too far apart, forcing you to repeat difficult sections over and over again until you can perfectly execute a series of precisely timed movements. I eventually reached one such section that I simply could not finish. If you enjoy repeatedly failing one small section of a level where you can see exactly what needs to be done but just can't make it happen, then this game is for you. I don't understand why people enjoy games that are so frustratingly difficult, but that is precisely what this game has to offer.
 
wizcreations

0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2015
tl;dr -> You cannot call yourself a speedrunner until you've played this game. It has a game mode called "speed runs." 11/10 made me feel incompetent as a gamer; DO NOT watch speedrun videos on YouTube for this game.

Pros:

-very challenging levels with multiple solutions; completing top-time speedruns requires unorthodox and creative routes
-different routes increases replayability greatly
-good music and sounds, keeping you pumped appropriately
-beautiful aesthetics and smooth playing experience; time for your run is displayed on your gun, keeping the background clean of noise
-competitive community for speedrunning leaderboards; many top players post their runs on YouTube so you can watch and learn
-helpful tutorials to get you quickly familiarized with the gameplay
-extremely fair checkpoints
-gamepad controller compatible
-good price value

♥♥♥♥:

-puzzles are heavily timing-based, so any player not accustommed to that mechanic will have difficulty progressing
-pool of special abilities is limited; takes some time and progression to unlock them for replaying levels (and speedruns)
-no multiplayer (strictly score/time-based online leaderboards)

Highly recommend!

Cheers,
DJSF @DJSF's Rogue Reviews

My Website[theroguereviews.com]
 
DJSF

Évaluation publiée le 18 mai 2017
This is not a game, it's a lifestyle choice.

I've never failed so badly and so often whilst feeling so invigorated.

After 2 hours of play I still haven't completed level 2, but my time for Level 1 has dropped from 20 minutes to 7 after 4 tries.

Usually you can see what you need to do, but doing it is another thing. OTOH, sometimes you really need to think about what you are doing. You can take it slow for some of the game, so don't feel time pressure, OTOH some puzzles require you to move quickly.

And when you finally figure it out, go back and get a better time.

Fantastic.

Évaluation publiée le 1 février 2015
NOT RECOMMENDED to spend your precious money on this game.
不推荐这款游戏。

When I first read the introduction of this game, it impressed me. Platformer FPS, puzzle-solving, etc. A mixture of these elements may seems good and impressing, but it is actually a TOTAL FAILURE. Trying one puzzle again and again, and pressing the space key again and again really takes great patience and skill. Having spent two hours struggling with this game ( have not passed the second chapter), I finally run out of patience, delete it from my computer, and write this review. It should never involve puzzle-solving in the introduction. All I can see is the need for fast fingers. It is easy to design a impressing-looking game with the hardest level, but it is difficult for game like this let me to say a good word fot it.
当我第一次阅读游戏介绍时，这款游戏吸引了我。平台跳跃，解谜游戏等等。一个融合了以上元素的游戏好像很吸引人，但是这款游戏却是彻底的失败。一次又一次的尝试同一个关卡，一次又一次的重复按空格键，这需要很大的耐心和技巧。在跟这个游戏较劲2小时后（第二关还没通关），我失去了耐心，删掉了这款游戏，写下了这条评论。这款游戏就不应该在它的介绍中提及“解谜”。从游戏中，我只体会到了你需要很高的手速，很好的操作。设计一个看起来吸引人的游戏很简单，但是这种游戏很难让我说出什么好的评价来。

If you have a strong will-power, a fast hand, this game is OK for you. OTHERWISE, KEEP AWAY FROM THIS DAMN GAME.
如果你的意志力足够坚强，手足够快，这款游戏还差不多适合。否则，珍爱生命，请远离这款游戏。

13.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 février 2018
Deadcore est un jeu développé par une équipe de malades mentaux, qui ont visiblement confondu "challenge" avec "les 9 cercles de l'Enfer". Je joue à Deadcore APRES avoir fait les deux Hotline Miami et avoir joué à Super Meat Boy. Mais alors pourquoi s'acharner sur Deadcore ? Hum :
- Scénario qui se veut réfléchi mais complètement torché (des logs par-ci par-là, une fin ridicule)
- Difficulté mal dosée : certains chapitres sont à s'arracher les cheveux (coucou le niveau avec la gravité), alors que d'autres passages sont juste... mous.
- Les checkpoints : il est possible d'en croiser deux à la suite, ou bien de ne jamais en voir alors que le niveau devant vous est très, très, TRES long.
- Encore la difficulté : attendez. Dans Hotline ou SMB, le tout réside dans un calcul, le fait de finir apr connaître les mécanismes du niveau pour en arriver à bout ? N'ayez crainte, dans Deadcore, tout repose sur la chance ! J'ai fait un screen vidéo pour être sûr de ne pas me tromper, je les ai superposés (logiciel GLMixer) et... Le même parcours, avec un échec pour l'un, une réussite pour l'autre.

J'ai eu ce jeu en soldes, et je regrette quand même. Allez, je suis sympa, je rajouter des points pour la "bande-son" qui est passable, et l'univers dont le côté SF rend pas mal. Pour ceux qui veulent du vrai challenge et pas juste un test de karma, n'acetez pas ce titre médiocre.
 
Loopkin

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
38.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 décembre 2015
DeadCore has what's probably my ideal scenario for a game: You fall through the sky and land near the bottom of an impossibly high, architecturally abstract tower, built out of moving and floating pieces, patrolled by mechanical sentries. You have powerful movement options and find tools to make them even more powerful. As you progress, you see flashes of words associated with your immediate task, seemingly the thoughts and warnings of people who have been here before you. Climb to the top.

This is platforming in its purest form - dash, double jump, avoid death fields, boost high up, create your own shortcuts, shoot down enemy sentries, and keep climbing. The movement mechanics are so robust they have a visual artistry to them. The music is a combination of ambient soundscape and thumping electronica.

What little context exists is abstract and light. You find logs with flavor text but they're all pretty interchangeable. DeadCore is just about climbing the tower and (optionally) collecting the sparks that activate something at the top. It's incredibly fun.

Note on speedrun mode: The game has been patched a few times to remove major climbing/clipping exploits, but several still remain. There are obscure ways to boost yourself from the bottom of a level to the top. Unless it gets patched again (which seems unlikely), don't sweat the leaderboards too much and just play it the way you want to.
 
BaronHaynes

Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2017
Отличная игра! Трухардкорный спидран! Напомнила мне времена, когда я задра чивал в мод к Q3 - defrag. (хотя deadcore и не такая ураганная с первого взгляда)
Очень стильная. Есть что-то общее с трэкманией - такой же безумный дизайн уровней, когда ты не понимаешь, а где здесь выход-то? :D
Для любителей игр на скорость - defrag, trackmania - рекомендую!

Recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2016
Se volete passare un paio d'ore della vostra vita dando fondo a tutto il vocabolario di parolacce nelle lingue conosciute e sconosciute giocate a Deadcore.

Contrariamente ad altri commenti, non lo definirei in nessun modo simile a Portal, nè un gioco a rompicapo. Non è la riflessione ma la velocità, la precisione e l'istinto a guidarvi nella sfida. E soprattutto sette quintali e mezzo di pazienza.

Il gioco ha meccaniche platform esasperate al massimo, basate sul trial-and-error, ovvero prova, muori, riprova, rimuori, riprova, finchè non ci riesci.
Non fosse che riuscirci dà una certa soddisfazione mi sentirei di sconsigliarlo a priori, ma visto il bel look visivo e il tasso di sfida posso consigliarlo, ma solo a quei giocatori che hanno un'infinita pazienza e sono appassionati di platform.

Scordatevi gli enigmi, non ce ne sono, si tratta di pura e semplice coordinazione e movimento nello spazio.
Il level design a volte causa qualche morte di troppo per mancanza di chiarezza della direzione da intraprendere (snervante se si è appena usciti da una sezione particolarmente impegnativa). Un paio di rifiniture in più l'avrebbero reso un gran titolo.

Non mi esprimo sulla "trama" e sull'esplorazione, visto che il gioco non invita minimamente all'esplorazione ma solo alla conquista del prossimo checkpoint.

Salta, spara, scatta, evita i laser, suda, cadi, muori, ritenta: questo è Deadcore, e va preso così com'è.

Non si può scegliere la difficoltà, e il livello di sfida è elevato.

Siete avvisati.
 
bobrobertson

Non recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2016
Starts off fun enough! Great sense of speed, the platforming feels solid and like you can always tell where you're going. Figuring out where to go is a little more challenging, but that's great! Exploration! Yeah!

And then you get to level 3 and there's those laser tunnels you have to dash through. And those take a few tries. Or a lot of them. And as much as fun as the game is, it's starting to get kind of frustrating. But you persevere, because you want to complete the game.

And then you get to level 4 and you get the ability to change gravity and all of a sudden the game becomes so damn disorienting that you have no idea where to go or what the heck is even going on. At least in a 2D platformer, all the information is laid out for you on screen. You are able to make the split-second decisions and reactions because you can clearly see where you are at and where you need to be. In first person 3D? Hah, Good luck with that. Yet, you somehow make it through, and there's moments where the mechanic actually works and is more fun than disorienting. Still, at the end you feel more exhausted than proud.

And then level 5 gives you that blast ability and you're supposed to pull off rocket jumps and maybe the game just doesn't explain the mechanic well enough or maybe you're too dumb for it because even after looking at YouTube videos you can't seem to figure it out and so you just give up because you're done investing time in this game that just doesn't seem to like you at all.

At least that's me. Plenty of people seem to love it. Good job, plenty of other people. Good job being really good at video games. For everyone else that's maybe even pretty decent at video games and has a high amount of patience for them (hey, I beat La-Mulana) but just isn't perfect at video games and does have a limit to their patience (heck no I'm not gonna attempt to beat Hell in La-Mulana), feel free to pick up this game. It's a fun and challenging few hours, but you probably will walk away from it before you've beaten it, and that, to me, makes it something not worth recommending.
 
sillythings
2,336 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Don't let the term Platformer-FPS scare you off, this game is somewhat similar to and just as fun as Portal 2. DeadCore's combination of tight controls and fast pace elevate it far above most other Platformer-FPS games. There may be a frustrating moment once in awhile, but once you conquer them you feel like a frikkin' ninja. The game is rarely cheap, so if you die, odds are you just didn't time something right or you messed up. Frequent checkpoints means that attempting a difficult section again is quick and painless. The art style never changes, but creative level design helps keep things interesting. New mechanics are introduced at a satisfying rate, and every tutorial consists of a few floating words and a simple puzzle to get you started. Difficulty scales nicely as you play further as well. Highly recommended! Hopefully this game will catch more attention soon.
 
oneclipleft

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Évaluation publiée le 30 mars 2015
DeadCore is simultaneously one of the most irritating and enjoyable games I have played in the last decade. This isn’t for the faint of heart, but anyone looking for a great challenge in a fast-past first person perspective, this might be for you!

For my full review, check out: http://shoddypixels.com/deadcore-review/

Évaluation publiée le 7 février 2018
好像游戏没有明确的指示，玩到哪里算哪里的感觉。玩了9分钟也完全不知道自己在干嘛。大概是一个闯关游戏？跳跳跳和距离控制对于我来说有点糟糕，可能我太习惯于传送门一类的动作感，这一款游戏的相应感觉和其他游戏有一定差异，但是画面很好看啊，到处是科幻经典设计和经典配色，很赏心悦目的。还有催吐的附加功能哦，值得入手。再再附加的功能是，帮助你很好地砸掉手柄和键盘，前者时灵时不灵，后者灵不灵不影响我摔回起点，然后再摔回起点，然后再摔回起点……

Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2018
Deadcore is great game.
First it has great gameplay with a couple of abilities obsicales and difficulty increases steadily.
It has a ok story, that could be improved on and had potential for some fantastic lore.
All the parts of the game can be speed runned and is very fun.
One bug was on the final level if you go the right path you miss the blast ability entirely and it says you have it but you don't.

Good game for 10 $ wishing there is a second.

Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2017
Starts off very strong. Difficult, yes, but with a certain flow that makes everything feel natural.
Then it throws in gravity switching.
This would be fine, except it seems all manner of flow just got tossed out the window, as things become confusing, and scattered. You're confused, unable to orient yourself, and that lovely feeling of "Let's just go with it and see what happens" is shattered. I believe that was intentional design wise, due to the are you're in also changing to a dark and stormy sky. It jsut feels clustered, the entire game has WAY to much going on in it, and just overstimulates me.

TL;DR
Starts great, goes bad
 
C7RL_ALt
619 produits enregistrés
1
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2018
First person platforming. I won't say it's at its finest, but it's one of those "met my expectations exactly" games. It's good, it's worth the money, I'd say it's nothing special except that there are very few decent games in this niche, which is "first-person platformer." Don't confuse that with freerunning games like Mirror's Edge - this controls like an FPS that's been built for platforming. Because that's basically what it is.

It's a weird game. It's worth the money but it won't be life-changing.
 
snowboundCabin

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 octobre 2016
A must for platform games is to make it feel fair.

If you introduce unintuitive hitboxes and parts which feel mostly trial and error, the end result is an unenjoyable experience. Unfortunately, deadcore has both unintuitive hitboxes and parts that feel mostly trial and error. I ended up solving most jumps via muscle memory rather than accurately gauging the height like any good platformer.

Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2015
個人評分：7/10

畫面：遊戲畫面呈現科幻感。第一人稱的視角，各種高科技的機關，環視四周發現自己處於一個死氣沉沉的星球上。遊戲玩到中期，你會發現你所處的地方已經遠遠地離開地面。

操作：因為這款遊戲需要克服重重機關才能到達彼岸。遊戲越到後面就越難，當然考驗的時候也就到了。那是後你會發現自己慢慢地成為手殘一族。但是，相信我，你不是手殘，你需要的是冷靜思考還有永不言棄。（至今我還沒有到達。）總的來說，操作不難。難的是不願放棄的決心。

連線：雖然有連線競賽，但是缺少夥伴。

有空就玩玩吧。低價買的遊戲，值得買。

3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier 2017
Fun platformer game, but it has some annoying parts and the gravity-changing mechanic isn't well polished. You can also skip many puzzles by jumping through them in non-intended ways, and you can beat many jumping puzzles without really understanding what you're doing very well. I wouldn't recommend this game for its full price, but it's worth $5 or less.
 
CLO
242 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2015
F*ck yes, finally, phew....
This is exactly the reaction you have once you finish a difficult sector. This is the only game I would recommend playing drunk. Speed, reflexes and concentration are the main skills you will need in this game, also green tea and maybe a spare mouse.
The graphics though simplistic/minimalistic are good, the music complements the gameplay, which is quite an attraction in this game.
You will not have to think hard on solving a level, it is not Portal, this is a speed run, thrilling and unforgiving to slightest "knee-jerk" actions, clumsiness and waste of ammo (yes there are few enemies, but you mainly need ammo to shoot buttons/controls). It is worth noting however that the levels may have more than one solution
All in all the game is fun and challenging, and once you finish it there are speedrun challenges.

P.S.
Join my Group for more reviews and curator recommendations at
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ogrreview/
 
Provoker [One Grumpy Russian]
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2014
Очень захватывающая игра! Во время прохождения постоянно невольно вырывается "охр....ть, нихе....себе, вау". Очень динамично, очень красиво, очень стильно и оригинально. Не согласен с теми, кто говорит, что игра на 1 раз - уже сейчас при первом прохождении замечаю кучу мест, которые можно будет перепройти по другому с новыми способностями.

Дизайнерам уровней хотел бы сказать отдельное спасибо - выстроить такие впечатляющие декорации, так идеально подогнать друг к другу пропасти, реактивные трамплины и области с изменяющейся гравитацией - браво! В игре присутствует должная доля челленджа и здесь он вознаграждается - как только пройдете какой-либо трудный кусок и поймете насколько круто это было, вы меня поймете =)
 
Vilgeforze
659 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2019
다 제쳐두고, 이 게임은 사운드가 좋기로 유명한 게임인데, Win 10에서 사운드가 나오지 않는 버그가 있다.
Win 10 이용자는 게임의 재미를 반만 느낄 수 있다.
아무리 2014년작이라지만, 출시 직후 Win 10이 대중화된 걸 생각해 보라.
개발자가 업데이트에 있어 대단히 게으르다는 걸 알 수 있다.
이에 더해 심지어 엔딩 컷씬에서 프리즈 현상까지 있다.

본 게임은 3D FPS 플랫포머 게임으로, 출시 당시엔 신선한 매커니즘으로 호평 받은 게임이다.
그렇다, '당시엔' 신선했다.
당시의 감각으로 본 게임을 리뷰하는 것은 나로서는 불가능한 일이기에, 현재의 관점에서 리뷰를 작성하고자 한다.

상당한 난도의 3D FPS 파쿠르 게임으로, 속도감과 쾌감을 느끼기엔 좋은 게임이다.
또한 맵 디자인이 매우 허술하여 다수의 구간을 스킵할 수 있는 점이 특징이다.
스킵을 통해 엄청난 시간 단축이 가능할 것으로 생각되며, 게임 모드 중에 스피드런 모드가 있는 것도 이해가 간다.
그러나 맵 디자인이 허술한 점이 단순히 장점은 아니다.
맵 디자인이 과도하게 허술한 탓에 중간중간 끼는 버그가 있다.
또한 플랫포머 게임에서 가장 중요하다 말할 수 있는 판정이 애매하다.
속도감을 중요시하다 보니 게임을 날림으로 만든 감이 없잖아 있다.

그래픽 디자인은 소위 '있어 보이는 디자인'이다.
은근한 분위기로 승부하는 디자인이란 소리다.
자세히 볼수록 조잡한 것을 알 수 있는데, 특히 구름이나 번개 같은 배경 디자인은 정말 눈 뜨고 볼 수 없을 수준이다.
그래픽은 최하점을 주고 싶다.

또한 마지막 레벨의 레벨링은 혹평을 하지 않을 수가 없다.
직전 레벨과의 난이도 차이가 너무 심하다.
플랫포머 게임을 어렵게 만드는 방법은 여러 가지가 있다.
본 게임에서는 그 중에서도 최악의 방법으로 난도를 조정했다.
바로 세이브 포인트의 수를 줄이는 것.
맵 자체의 난도를 올리거나 빌드를 짜기 어렵게 만드는 방식으로 레벨링을 하는 편이 나았을 것이다.
세이브 포인트의 수가 너무 적어 한 트라이 한 트라이가 너무 오래 걸린다.
도전의식은 사라지며, 지치기만 한다.
게임을 계속 하고 싶은 마음이 점점 줄어드는 레벨 디자인이었다.

전체적으로 큰 스케일의 속도감 있는 3D 플랫포머라고 말할 수 있다.
하지만 그래픽이나 버그, 레벨 디자인을 살펴보면 화가 날 정도다.
비추천한다.
 
AHNS
447 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mai 2021
Completato in 4 ore e 26 minuti (prima volta).

Il gioco è molto interessante perché è tutto a intuito, colpo d'occhio, abilità. È un vero platform poiché bisogna saltare su piattaforme di ogni tipo, fare salti, raggiungere checkpoint. Secondo me non è così complesso come molti dicono, né ti fa imprecare poiché ha le vite infinite; nel senso che una volta arrivati al checkpoint si potrà prendere fiato e si ripartirà da lì. O perché si cade o perché si preme R per ripartire. Ci sono delle parti da fare tutte di prima, ma la curva di apprendimento è buona. Il casino inizia quando si raggiungono le piattaforme "viola" (non dico altro per non spoilerare).

L'ho trovato invece molto rilassante nella sua complessità e immediatezza. In alcuni punti non c'è proprio il tempo di pensare. Bisogna agire, percepire l'ambiente circostante, valutare distanze. Ci sono alcuni potenziamenti che possono semplificare la vita, ma vanno cercati un po' qua e un po' là. Il gioco si può finire ugualmente senza trovarli tutti e probabilmente esiste anche un secondo finale (penso). Chiaramente senza i potenziamenti sarà più difficile, poiché alcuni danno più munizioni. Ecco, ho parlato di munizioni, ma non pensate che si debba sparare come un fps. Il ♥♥♥♥♥♥ serve più che altro per attivare piattaforme e ascensori, oppure stordire dei droni r.o.m.p.i.b.a.l.l.e (anche questa è una parola incredibilmente volgare... ma vaiaffann...) che cercheranno di buttarvi giù dalla torre.

Bisogna salire, salire, salire. È una torre e lo scopo (scopo è strano che non la censurino) è arrivare in cima.

Bello mi è piaciuto, diverso dal solito. Non c'entra nulla ♥♥♥ Portal il cui "core game" sono i portali e non le piattaforme su cui saltare. A questo punto allora visto che ci sono le piattaforme bisogna dire che assomiglia a Super Mario Bros? ...

In sconto lo prenderei senza pensarci su troppo, sempre che vi piacciano le sfide. È incredibile quello che si trovi a sorpresa nella propria libreria. Roba che si compra e si dimentica.

p.s. non fate caso alle parole ♥♥♥ i puntini perché ho dovuto scriverle così a causa dell'assurdo sistema che non sa distinguere parolacce da normalissime parole tipo f.u.c.i.l.e). Tra un po' non si potrà più scrivere nulla perché sarà ritenuto lesivo dagli idioti senza chegghiaune (questa non la conosce sicuramente il filtro famiglia di sti crrnnnnnttt!)
 
Ciola.Fatata
9
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
7.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 septembre 2015
DeadCore zapowiadał się bardzo przyjemnie, pachniał Portalem nastawionym trochę bardziej na platformowe skakanie.
Niestety po kilku planszach przyjemność zastąpiła irytacja i przekonanie, że gry z widokiem z pierwszej osoby nie nadają się na zrecznościowe platformówki. W Portalu mieliśmy większość elementów podanych na tacy, a naszym zadaniem było poukładać je tak aby przejść dalej, tutaj niestety często po sekwencji skoków i uników jesteśmy rzucani w miejsce którego nie było widać i mamy sekundę lub dwie na zorientowanie się co mamy zrobić, spóźnimy się to musimy powtarzać cały fragment. Bardzo szybko logiczne odnajdywanie drogi zostało zastąpione bezmyślnymi, niekończącymi się próbami pokonania drogi między zabójczymi polami siłowymi, bez widoku ciała jest to robione zupełnie na wyczucie bo kilka milimetrów w złą stronę oznacza powtarzanie tego fragmentu. System zapisywania też nie pomaga, czasami punkty zapisu mamy po kilku prostych platformach, a gdy dochodzi do naprawdę trudnych sekwencji, na które składają się skoki, uruchamianie przycisków w locie, przelatywanie między polami siłowymi, nie mamy żadnego punktu zapisu.
Gra tylko dla ludzi którzy zjedli zęby na Dark Soulsie i popili Super Meat Boyem.
 
darkwind
1,294 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2016
Before you decide to play this game you must ask yourself ... "Do I get angry/frustrated very easily?" If you answered YES to this question then stop right here and turn away slowly. If you answered NO to this question then get ready to die, then respawn, and then die again and respawn.

This is one of the hardest games i have played in a long time. You have to watch your movements very carefully and watch your back at all times.. one wrong step and your repeating. If you have ever played portal, then picture if you will, one of the higher level puzzles, you have to jump and while your falling open a portal and then when you enter you have to open another to get higher just to reach your platform.. this is sorta like that but x10 lol .. This difficulty almost rivals Dark Souls in such a way that you almost want to go play Dark Souls cause it might be easier at times.

If you think you can handle jumping puzzles and shooting while jumping without being able to stop for more than a second then go for it i dare you.. No i challenge you to play this game and see how far you can climb the spires of DeadCore.

Recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2015
To all Portal fans.

Yes, DeadCore looks like Portal,
it feels like Portal,
smells like Portal,
but it is NOT Portal.

However, it is not a flaw! Game has different mechanics and is more about your dexterity, than capability of solving puzzles (but there are quite alot of them). It has complex story (tho you need to read the logs to understand it) and is a bit harder than Portal.
Still, it gives you few hours of great fun and I would highly recommend it to all the aforementioned Portal fans! :)
 
Nevi007
1
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2017
The game is a little over 2 hours(the first time through) and it's difficulty isn't set in stone, there is always something you can do to make an obstacle easier, for example you can try to make short dashes through a tunnel in rapid succesion, with every dash needing to be perfect or take about 5 times as long and use a long dash that requires little precision and is very safe. Of course, you won't really care the first time thru, but the real point of the game is to go back, gather collectibles, learn about the Tower and keep beating your last time record.
 
Turahk
936 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2018
DeadCore is a fast-paced FPS platformer.
The objective is to climb the tower as fast a possible, by dashing, double-jumping, and using your switchgun to disable/enable enemies, traps, or boosters. It consists of five levels, increasing in difficulty and length. I found the difficulty ramp to be perfect, I never felt completely at a loss, or bored.
The sci-fi graphics look excellent, and the electronic soundtrack is interactive with how you progress.

I should also mjention that the game is designed to be a speedrun game, so expect a lot of replay value. My first playthrough took me over 4 hours, but I can now do a run in less than 60 minutes.

A very fun and difficult game overall. Definitely pick it up even at normal price.
 
CAT | Bush
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 septembre 2016
Its an fps platformer with some very simple puzzles. When you do well in this game and get the pacing and rhythm just right, oh man does it feel good. But the game quickly ramps up the difficulty and then pacing and fun breaks down; either because I am worse than average at FPS (I have always thought of myself as better than average but it is a possibility), this game is desinged only for hardcore fps players, or the game is simply too particular about players getting timing and movements exactly the way it wants.

As a result, I cannot think of a single person that I actually know that I could see enjoying this game as more than a quick playtest.

Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2022
Non sai chi sei, non sai dove ti trovi e non hai idea di cosa sia l'aggeggio che tieni in mano. Ma un cosa è certa: devi raggiungere la cima della torre

Sviluppato dallo studio indipendente 5 Bits Games e pubblicato da Bandai Namco, Deadcore è un gioco in prima persona che a tratti ricorda Portal. Tutto è basato su puzzle ambientali e velocità. Se siete degli amanti delle speedrun questo è il gioco perfetto per voi, difatti contiene a parte una modalità speedrun ♥♥♥ anche livelli esclusivi e classifiche dei tempi migliori. Gli scenari sono misteriosi e ricchi di viste mozzafiato, trappole mortali al laser e nuvole. Questo gioco è una piccola chicca sicuramente da provare.

Un ciclo senza fine

208 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 septembre 2021
Frenetico e preciso nei movimenti, ♥♥♥ un level design talvolta cattivo, ma sempre stimolante, specialmente per quanta libertà lascia al giocatore nel creare i propri percorsi. È breve, ma la rigiocabilità è molto alta. Ottima ost d'atmosfera, e bello anche esteticamente, per quanto un po' monotono. Anche la lore del gioco, per quanto non sia assolutamente il focus, è intrigante, e spinge un po' la ricerca dei collezionabili, che fortunamente sono pochi, nascosti in maniera sensata, e utili. Ci sono certe sezioni un po' più confusionarie, ma nulla di tragico. L'elemento peggiore a mio parere è l'hit detection dell'arma da fuoco, che talvolta sembra davvero impreciso. Nel complesso comunque lo consiglio caldamente a chi apprezza i giochi di questo tipo.
 
Lollanza_Man
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

FPSパズルアクションゲーム。「Portal」を想起させられるが、空中ダッシュ・二段ジャンプによる爽快なアクション制、高速移動しつつ移動するスイッチを撃ってON/OFFさせるなどのある程度のaimを要求される場面があり、パズルよりはアクション要素がやや強め。リトライがRキーを押すだけで一瞬なのと、ほとんどの箇所でチェックポイントの間隔が短めなので、トライアンドエラーにとにかくストレスを感じないのが良い。ただ、空中ダッシュがキーを押している時間で距離が変わるとか、途中で増えるロケットジャンプ？のやり方とか、とにかくその場では何も説明してくれないので、何箇所かは若干イライラしてしまったが……。
後半に追加されるギミック( 紫の重力装置みたいな奴 )が完全に脳トレ要素で、当たり前のように他のギミックやアクション要素と重なるせいで頭がおかしくなるかと思った。ただ、ベースがFPSなので、横スクロールや他の3Dアクションに感じる操作性の悪さをほぼ感じないのはとても良かった。
収集物を全回収するTrue Endingまではやりこもうと思わなかったが、特にネタバレも見ずに1周5時間程度で楽しめたので、アクションゲームが苦手な人でもFPS経験があるならおすすめ出来ると思う。
 
Nanastaxia

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout

这是第三次游玩兼补票，当年游戏发布就凭这画风就把我吸引了。104分钟一次性通关，难度值得一试。重力控制这个要素实战太亮眼，从来没有玩过这么棒的跑酷游戏，酷炫的科技感一流的音乐绝对适合在朋友面前推荐一番，前提是不晕3D

Although, only get this when it's on sale.
Game isn't really worth it due to weird issues with needing to be point-perfect with some elements of the game (ex. to disable spinning helixes) and sometimes even that fails cus hitboxes feel really small and sometimes nonexistent even.
Still, if it's on sale, this game is really worth a try and will be a nice addition to your already big collection of games.

Ankh
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2020
パルクールを期待すると気が狂いそうになるゲーム性
3時間ほどでストーリーを一周しました。

パルクール系を期待して購入しましたが、個人的にこれはパズルアクションFPSだと思いました。
さらに言うとイ〇イラ棒系のシビアなアクションを求められるゲームでしょうか。

即死する赤いライトが配置されている立体パズルダンジョン内で敵を避けながらゴールを目指していくのが本作の全て。
あと壁走りアクションはないです。

1.赤いライト
購入ページのスクリーンショットを見てください。
何枚かの画像に赤いビニールテープみたいなものが映っていると思います。
これに触れると即死します（ステージによってはこれがプロペラみたいに回転しながら突っ込んでくる）。
最後までこれを避ける避けられないといった試行錯誤を繰り返すアクションで、正直うんち面白いとは言い切れない要素でした。

タイミングを合わせればパルクールアクションみたいに気持ちよく動けるのかもしれません。
個人的には大縄跳びのタイミングを見図るような操作を何度も要求されることに想像以上に気疲れしました。

2.有限の弾薬
プレイヤーが持っている銃の仕様についても少し疑問が残ります。
スクリーンショットにも映っていると思いますが、通常30発しか撃てません。
中継地点を通ることで弾薬は補充されますが、わざわざ弾切れになる仕様にする意味がよく分かりませんでした。

たとえば、本作に登場する敵は銃で撃つと3秒ほど停止しますがその後再び動き出す仕様になっていて、絶対に倒せません（多分）。
また、敵の位置はプレイヤーがリスポーンしてもリセットされない為、同じ場所を通るにしても無力化する必要のある敵の数が異なる為、銃を何発撃つかは場合によって違います。
そういった仕様もあってランダム要素のあるゲーム性と銃の弾薬の仕様は噛み合ってないような気がしました。

3.重力変化時のカメラ
ステージを進めていくと重力が変化するギミックが出てきます。
重力が異なるエリアを出入りすると、それ以前のカメラの向き（地面に対して上を向いていたり下を向いていたりといったカメラの向き）を新しい重力のエリアに対して適用します。

何を言っているのか分からないかもしれませんが、これが起こると視界がぐちゃぐちゃになるし上下感覚が狂います。
例えば、天井に重力が変化するエリアがあったとします。
1.天井の方向（上）を向いて、ジャンプして重力が変化しているエリアに入ります。
2.重力が変化して天井が地面（下）になります。
3.プレイヤーの視線は重力が変化した後も上を向こうとします。
　つまり、天井にジャンプする前に立っていた地面を見るようにカメラの向きが変わります。

これを壁に対して行うとさっきまで立っていた地面がどこにあるか分からなくなり、重力の変化が無くなったときに落下する方向が分からなくなります。
気が狂います。
重力の違うエリアに入るたびに視点がぐわんぐわん動くから銃が狙えなくなるのもうんちキツイです。
3D酔いしやすい方はかなりヤバイと思います。

悪い要素が目につきますが、ゲームとしてはそれなりに出来ていました。
短時間で終えられる程よいボリュームだったこともあって、私は満足しました。
3D酔いしない人、イライラ棒的なパズルとFPSアクションが得意な方にはオススメします。
パルクールができると期待している方にはあまりオススメできないです。
 
tora36volt
0

0

Évaluation publiée le 8 février 2020
Un jeu qu'il est difficile d'évaluer tant de plaisir à résoudre les obstacles comme de frustration à l'encontre de bugs comme la disparition d'élément important sur le parcours.
Des ennemis placé inutilement juste pour faire ♥♥♥♥♥ avec un gun qui ne tire pas droit des projectiles dont la visée sniper ne sert à rien d'autre que de rien voir, une magnification n'aurait pas été de trop, ou le fait que les projectiles vont dans la ligne de mire et pas à 3km de celle-ci.
J'ai décidé de ne plus investir de temps dans ce jeu et de me dire que ça valait la peine de passer à autre chose sans le finir car en fait je n'en tirais plus de plaisir mais que de la frustration.
Dès lors, inutile de continuer quelque chose qui ne donne pas satisfaction.

L'idée est sympa, la nausée et les flashs lumineux aussi.
Le jeu est pas mal, il aurait pu être mieux. Mais c'est à contre-coeur que je met un pouce rouge pour le dernier bug qui m'a fait faire un jolie alt-F4 puis désinstallation (disparition de plate-forme, faire des dash à gueudin pour essayer de rejoindre la prochaine plate-forme avec ces ♥♥♥♥♥♥ de moustiques de ♥♥♥♥♥ qui sont la JUSTE pour faire ♥♥♥♥♥) et peut-être voir avec steam si je le supprime complètement de ma bibliothèque ou pas car je doute que le jeu ne soit corriger dans un futur proche et qu'il reste à l'état actuel.
je met un pouce ici pour l'idée du jeu et le désir de produire quelque chose de sympa.
Mais j'ai le droit de dire ce que je pense surtout quand tu payes ton steak.
 
Sushi4000
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
66.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 septembre 2019
C'est un jeu que je conseillerais à tout ceux qui s'intéresse au speedrun. On a jeu, qui est loin d'être moche et qui est simple à comprendre. Faut aller de plateforme en plate forme jusqu'au bout de niveau. Il y a des petites énigmes, rien de bien méchant, des chemins alternatifs. Et au fûr et à mesure que vous progresserez vous aurez l'occasion de ramasser des power up vous rendant la vie un peu plus simple et des capacités qui vous seront nécessaires dans la progression (notamment le dash)

Le jeu devient intéressant quand vous l'avez fini une première fois et que vous voulez le faire en mode speedrun car le level design est sympa, car ouais vous avez donc un chemin principal, vous avez des chemins détournés que vous trouverez en observant un peu plus (ou pas) et vous pouvez vous lancer dans le "hors piste" avec des tricks divers et variés, si vous voyez ce que je veux dire. Ce qui est bien c'est que vous n'avez pas besoin d'être un programmeur ou avoir un ultra instinct pour détecter un timing parfait pour commencer à vous amuser dans ce domaine là, contrairement à d'autre jeux.

Le point négatif, c'est que si vous jouez au jeu d'une manière totalement lambda et casual, les deux derniers niveaux sont infernaux et je n'exagère pas. Assez étrangement le jeu devient plus facile si on emprunte des voies détournées. Certains diront que le jeu est court, mais si on se base sur l'optique que le jeu est orienté vers le speedrun... bah ça va en fait, vous pouvez "travailler" un niveau sans que ça s'éternise, moi j'apprécie

Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2018
Sieht sehr schön aus, hat aber in meinen Augen ein viel zu hoher Frust-Faktor. Viel zu oft hängen die Spünge bzw. deren Gelingen vom Zufall und von try & error ab. Da die Level auch ziemlich tricky sind, kommt leider auch kein echtes Speed-Feeling auf. Schade. Dass das besser geht, zeigen Plattformer wie Refunct. Selbst dort kommt mehr Speed-Gefühl auf als hier. Da hilft dann auch die dolle Grafik nicht...
 
H3lloK1tty

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
30.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2017
This is a great game, but it will only appeal to a niche audience
Do you like very difficult (but not unplayable) games?
Do you gain immense satisfaction every time you finish a level just a little bit faster?
Do you like games in which you are continually moving (because standing still means losing time, i.e. WORSE THAN DEATH)?
Then this game might be for you

However, do NOT buy this game expecting a rich story, breathtaking art, complex gameplay, or a casual way to pass the time
If you think you'd get bored of constantly dying over and over in a sometimes-seemingly-impossible platformer with not much reward except a few achievements and a better spot on the rankings, avoid this game
 
TheMasterDruid

hugo
238 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
8.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2017
Скажу сразу игра офигенна
Во-первых о да паркур это тема. В этой игре научился распрыжкам для других игр. А так же это топовая разминка для паркур игр и режимов.
Во-вторых есть секретки- разная дополнителяная музыка которую можно найти на локациях и секреты расказывающие об истории этого места(к сожалению я не нашёл всё)
В-третьих по несколько вариантов прохождения одного участка. А тоесть если вы понимаете что не можете проёти его так пойдите по другому пути или же примените смекалку и пройдите этот же путь по другому.
В-чётвертых ещё про пушечку можно сказать, ведь в этой игре вы научитесь точно стрелять находу, налету, а так же в особо динамичных ситуациях. А здесь таких моментов когда тебе нужно выстрелить в последнюю минуту,чтобы не снизить своё скорость будет много.
Но конечно есть и минусы
1) Иногда либо боты, либо движущиеся предметы могут толкнуть вас внутрь текстур.
2) В пылу бомбёжки из-за сложного момента хочется разбить свой монитор.
Вобщем игра супер. ВСем удачи в прохождении.
 
Diverenen
159 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2017
-Argumento: se detalla mediante registros ("logs") que iremos consiguiendo mientras jugamos. Si bien no está del todo profundizado, en lo personal me atrajo bastante y logró que mi curiosidad se mantenga hasta el final del juego.
-Jugabilidad: para mi gusto lo mejor del juego. El movimiento es muy preciso. No poseemos armas, pero sí un dispositivo que nos permite alterar el espacio para abrir caminos, a la vez que podemos utilizarlo para inhabilitar a los robots de seguridad.
-Gráficos y Sonido: ambos son geniales. Visualmente es muy bello; ambiente futurista, al estilo ciencia ficción, y sobre todo para nada estático, lo cual da una sensación de inmersión grata. En cuanto al sonido, efectos sonoros que van bien, y la banda sonora acompaña, y en ciertos puntos logra motivarte a completar los desafíos que el juego presenta.
-Dificultad: DeadCore es bastante Hardcore (ja, ja), puedes llegar a estar una hora intentando pasar un nivel por lo difícil que puede llegar a ponerse. Para mí es un punto a favor, puesto que los juegos de hoy en día son demasiado fáciles.

Por otro lado, puedo decir que el modo campaña puede llegar a hacerse corto si logras tomarle la mano al juego rápidamente. Además, como dije antes, el argumento no está bien profundizado, dejándonos ♥♥♥ ganas de entender bien qué está ocurriendo, y por qué.

¡Saludos!
 
Knght ♥

Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2016
This is one of the greatest first person plateformer I have ever played. This game is responsive, it's sharp, it has an amazing soundtrack, beautiful graphiques, awesome level design and is worth every second of your time that you'll put in it.

This game was made to be played by speedrunners. There are multiple pathways, there is a ton of movement freedom and you can quick reset in a blink of an eye. My PB for a Glitchless NG+ is 19:27.12 and I am now aiming to try and do it in 15 minutes.

This game is gets my "Whoooaaaaaaa, dude!" nomination award and it's well deserved.

Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2016
Deadcore is the bastard child of the Defrag mod for Quake 3 Arena, a basejumping simulator, Mirror's Edge and...eeer...Quake 3 gameplay. What you need to understand is that the only thing between the start of a map and a world record is you and how bad you want it.
This is where you need to go fast, think fast, and die to do a better try.

An FPS platformer that does everything right. The controls are tight and the feeling of speeding through a level is excellent. It's almost as if it's a 3D Super Meat Boy (with less levels, sadly).
