Schmole
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juin 2015
Fast paced platforming game makes you feel like god when you succeed after failing a lot.

It reminds me a lot of some of the fast-paced segments of portal 2 except that is what the enitre game is like. Fast dying, respawns and reasonable check points help keep it un-frustrating. The music is nice and keeps the gameplay feeling smooth and exciting.

The levels are well designed and really push the game's wierd futuristic aesthetic. There are often multiple paths to choose from and some are a bit hidden. Indeed, the game rewards you with various collectables for finding some of these areas. As you progress you will enounter new mechanics, often in the form of upgrades. These mechanics usually have to be exectued while platforming somewhat precisly and quickly in order to complete the levels.

Enemies are usually moving laser walls (instant death), turrets(fires a shot that pushes you back), giant fans, etc. This is not a game that focuses on combat and shooting these enemies will either do nothing or just disable them for long enough to run past them. In short, enemies are more like obstacles than enemies of a traditional FPS.

There is no real storyline to speak of but there is hidden lore in the form of logs hidden about. The logs are short but entertaining enough to read.

This game seems like the sort of thing that could be very competitive and there are high score boards if you are into that thing.

Not sure how long the game is but I picked it up for under 4 USD and 2.6 hours throughly enjoyed so far, I already feel like I got my money's worth.
 
rypo
387 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2014
Deadcore is an impressive feat by Studio 5 Bits where you will essentially have to think, jump and aim in a very fast and fluid way. It is constant entertainment with no downtime and although some parts can take you longer to solve or execute properly, the feeling of accomplishment after that is something I've not experienced in ages!

The controls feel good provided you have a decent computer: it's a Unity game with lots of objects... playing this on my recent laptop (GTX 850M) didn't feel as nice as playing it on a real gaming desktop (GTX 670). There is a bit of randomness (especially in the robots AI) and a few glitches here and there but nothing really getting in the way of the experience. Oh and the aesthetics (visuals, sound design and music) are just dreamlike! Such a strong atsmophere for a game with almost no storytelling (actually there is a lore but it's entirely yours to find out!)

My first run took me about 4.5 hours. Might not seem that long but any additional level would probably be repetitive, boring or frustrating (also let's not forget this is a small development scale, not an AAA studio); I felt like it was the right "size" and I've thouroughly enjoyed these 4 hours. The replayability is assured thanks to the speedrunning factor: you might not think you are the speedrunner type but try it, because flowing through complex levels with mastery will feel reaaally good!

So buy the game because it's really worth the bucks! And help out these new devs so they make more games like this in the future!

Legalize Ranch
150 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2015
A hidden gem.

Easy to learn, hard to master. It's all about getting used to the mechanics and maps - once you master these two that's when you discover the full potential of Deadcore. The game gives an unprecedented amount of freedom, at least for a platformer which consists of going from Point A to Point B. Initially you might feel limited but in later playthroughs things become about figuring out the fastest and best route; times will drastically decrease and there's a satisfaction to it.

Deadcore has its rough edges though. Robots can be insanely annoying considering you have limited ammo which only reloads after touching a checkpoint and they can easily screw a run if you don't have the aim. My biggest issue with the game is the framerate - sometimes it lags like crazy, making it borderline unplayable albeit I must confess they've nailed the atmosphere. Even in 2020, it's still worthy of few screenshots and for an 'indie' game that's actually impressive.

In my opinion this is one of the best first-person platformer games out there.
 
Goat
1,070 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Oui, oui et re-oui.

DeadCore est la rencontre logique entre un Portal et Quake Live, ce qui donne un FPS Platformer nerveux, agréable à jouer, difficile par moment, mais bon sang que c'est agréable.

Doté d'une DA simple et claire (Bleu = bon, orange = à activer, rouge = mort), son gamedesign est tellement bon qu'on est rarement perdu et qu'on sait globalement toujours (ou presque) où aller, même avec un sens de l'orientation de chiotte comme le mien.

5 heures peuvent sembler un peu court pour le finir (en étant très mauvais), mais les différents chemins, les secrets et l'envie généralement d'aller vite, souligné par un mode speedrun très bien intégré, en font un jeu avec une grosse replay values.

Foncez sans hésiter.

Ce jeu donne tout simplement l'impression de voler, de plateforme en plateforme.
Un jeu de puzzle d'agilité avec un peu de réflexion, avec plusieur choix de passage different, de quoi s'amuser pendant une pair d'heures. (assez court, cela dit)
Slalomez entre les lasers, desactivez les tourelles ennemi, sautez dans le vide, dasher dans les airs, et visez juste pour faire votre chemin jusqu'au sommet de cette étrange tour cybernetique.

Recommandé
8.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
*** Pour les adeptes de speedrun et du mod DeFrag sur Quake ! ***

Ce petit jeu est vraiment très sympa, rafraichissant et fun.
Graphiquement très agréable dans un univers futuriste "Tron-esque". En vu du moteur 3D utilisé (unity) les déveleppeurs ont fais un super boulot.
Niveau game play c'est très nerveu et on prend beaucoup de plaisir à rééssayer d'améliorer son temps sur un parcours.
On tombe plein de fois, mais on recommence encore et encore, mais c'est ce qui est bon.
La difficulté n'est pas très grande de peu qu'on prenne le temps de regarder autour de soit et de comprendre le niveau.
Avec une bonne prise en main on prend un réel plaisir à prendre certain raccourcis afin d'améliorer son score. ';,,;'
Le mode campagne n'est autre que la découverte de l'univers mais reste quand même très agréable et indispensable pour bien maîtriser les mecaniques du jeu.
Je le recommande car pour ce prix là il en vaut vraiment le coup, et puis il faut soutenir nos développeurs indé !! ;)

Мои нервы закончились быстрее чем сама игра (которую, кстати, так и не осилил)
Нужно поистине быть сверхразумом чтобы расставлять точки сохранения в км друг от друга.
Проходишь нереально сложный, практически невыполнимый маршрут и БАЦ - начинайте снова.
Каждое движение и момент приходится буквально досконально изучать, но иногда удаётся всё же проскочить на удаче.
Не могу рекомендовать игру, но и палец вниз не поставлю. Определённо фанаты найдутся, а мне не очень как-то.
P.S. не вздумайте плотно покушать перед игрой.
10 головных болей из 10
 
luckycr1me
1,215 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
46.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2017
DeadCore...What a game! It's about using a gun to activate switches and deactivate enemies to progress as you platform up a huge tower. The story is told through collectibles and it's quite satisfying to jump between platforms. It has a pretty nice speedrun mode too.

The only downside is that the Steam overlay doesn’t seem to work for me, but as no else has any guides on how to fix it, it might just be a problem on my end.

Be warned though, as it (can) be an extremely hard game. The checkpoints...work, but you basically need to learn how to speedrun each section of each level to do it right, and the timing required is often quite awful.

However, if you like irritatingly precise platforming and mouse aiming, restarting 1000 times and very pretty ambience and graphics, it's a very wise purchase. Be prepared to rage quit. A lot.
 
Imaproshaman
104 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2015
I admit it, I'm too clumsy for this game. But I'm an addicted gamer, and I want to finish what I play.
Such an exciting game, it really is.
But also one of the most utterly frustrating gaming experiences of my past 20 years of gaming, and I can't tell you how filled with pure hatred I am for the developers. They're all talented guys, probably with the reflexes of a Ninja.
I want to finish this game so badly. But there's no slightly easier mode, no "you've died a million times at the same spot, here's a little help" sort of thing. This is more frustrating that talking to my stubborn fascist parents.
I can't in good consciousness recommend this game, yet I had a fantastic time with it. But it's too hard, it will fill you with hate and it will take 10 years off of your life expectancy, if you're an old slow fart like I *apparently* am. Thank you, 5 Bits Games, for making the first game in 20 years that makes me feel I should probably take a look at Backgammon, fine Whisky and arthritis pills.
Don't play this game, please. But if you do, you might just love it, as I did.

Heavily consider it if it's full price.

Recommandé
28.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2021
Genuinely fun speedrun platforming fps !
When you begin and have unlocked nothing it's not very exciting, but coming back to old levels with every upgrade is an absolute blast !
The speedrun times are a bit easy but it's still a fun challenge
I didn't follow the story at all but I liked finding the collectibles though.
I really like the freedom of movement you have and how you can break levels to earn a faster time !
Disregard my total playtime btw, I had a lot of idle. Probably 10-15h of actual gameplay

I wish there were some more challenging achievements, like 100% accuracy on every level, or not dying or smth of this kind

Still I do recommend the game, it's quite cheap too !
7.5/10 for people who like numbers

541 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 décembre 2016
Если вы считаете, что вы мастер шутеров, то лучше не покупайте данную игру! Я вас предупредил!
Давольно интересный шутерок с необычным геймплеем, цель добратся до конца уровня. Так просто? - спросите вы. Не дождётесь! По пути вы будете встречать лазеры и других противников. (Это что-за летающий куб? ВАТ?! Какого...?) И вы уже летите на мощности своего пукана! Выдержали? Прекрасно, продолжим! Подъём с препядствиями? Легко! Вы не раз будете встречать похожие задачи... Что такое? Уже 5/10/20/50 раз погибаете на одном и том же задании? Смирись и пробуй снова и снова. Получилось? Рано радуешся!!! Это только начало! Вы будете готовы выкинуть клаву, сломать комп или что-то в этом духе... Но знаете, всё-таки игра действительно может затянуть! Игра стоит того, чтобы поиграть. 9/10 за необычный геймплей и приятную картинку на моём старичке! (NVidia GTS 250 + Intel Core 2 Duo) Рекомендую!!!
 
T0ckERR - N0obERR

Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2017
Игра хороша. Бегаешь, прыгаешь, стреляешь, прокладывашь себе путь, решая "головоломки", короче поднимаешься вверх по странного вида башне. Музыка отличная, но редка, только в ключевых моментах. Наличие альтернативных путей делает игру интереснее и реиграбельней. Сюда же можно отнести и наличие плюшек, которые надо собирать (или не надо)), открывающих карты, пути, музыку и ведающих историю! Да история и сюжет преподносится текстом в записях. Местами сложна и необходимо запастись терпением, но результат того стоит. Рекомендую, хотябы со скидкой, но преобрести эту игру. 9 расшатанных пробелов из 10.
 
moonbass
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2016
I'm torn in this game. It's pretty well made and the puzzles/challenges stay fresh throughout the game but there are a few major issues that could be easily cleared up.

1. It's super easy to play through the whole game without realizing that you need to collect the "Sparks" in order to truly beat the game. It would seem that about 95% of people don't realize this and don't get the true ending. That said, getting the true ending doesn't unlock and extra level or anything, just a longer outro.

2. Really this is the biggest issue for me, this game is damn hard. There are time where no amount of skill can help you with the obsticle ahead of you and things are simply left to chance. In one instance I had to run past some rotating lazer things and jump onto another platform with other rotating lazer things that would spawn at complete random right in front of me. No amount of skill could counter that, I just had to play through it repeatedly until I got lucky enough to get through without one spawning on me. There are also not enough checkpoints at time. You'll go through the game feeling like they are all over for a while and then you get to a place where you have to do 10 complex things quickly, in order, and you cant predict any of them, so you have to play it at least 10 times to familiarize yourself with all ten things.

What this game needs: More Checkpoints. Remove few instances of pure luck based challenges. Make it super clear from the beginning that we need the sparks.

I reccommend this if you can find it on sale but be warned, this game is seriously difficult.
 
🌴KirBy🌴

I picked this game up on sale, expecting to spend maybe an hour jumping around on platforms killing some time..
4hours 10minutes later i ended up completing the game, in one sitting. (Very rare thing for me.)

It just completely blew me away. And i came back the next day, to start doing speedruns and finding the last sparks i was missing from the initital run.. I am now considering buying 3D glasses for my 3D monitor, to play my first ever 3D game.

Absolutely recommend !!!

Portal meets Mirror's Edge in a Tron environment. This is a very unique platformer that feels great every time you find that shortcut in the path. I've played about an hour and found that around every corner is something different. I had fun and probably won't play any more in the near future simply because I don't feel like taking the time to test my skills (because this game certainly would). If there were a Portal-like narrative, perhaps I would progress for the story's sake. But if you have the time and inclination, by all means, buy this game.

Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2015
Deadcore is a graphically impressive 1st person...well, Speedrun-Puzzle-Shooter-Hybrid. You run around a weird maze, trying to figure out what is going on.

The game is a paradise for speedrunners but even if you are not interested in that, just playing through the story is amazing. The game has some mindbending puzzles and is generally fast and fluid in it's gameplay, making it a joy to play and breeze through the levels as well as stopping to think what you have to do.

Definitely recommended!

It's an addictive first person Platformer with a high replayability.

Smooth gameplay coupled with neat level design which rewards you for thinking outside the box. If you ever played the KreedZ (kz_) mod in Counter Strike or other FPS Platformer gamemodes/mods you will most likely love this game.

There is no real storyline tho and your only goal is to climb the giant ass tower up into the sky.

HugoStiglitz_88
226 produits enregistrés
3
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 décembre 2016
这款游戏我是圣诞节打折12块买的，玩了一下午，晚上又玩，简直没日没夜。

①首当其冲的评价：难度比传送门系列难多了，这游戏也太考验操作了！

7小时玩到最后一章，估计快到结尾了吧，因为第一次玩光是解谜就已经让我累手酸，只想着快速通关，所以我没去在意收集物品，那些东西我看见的基本是在变态的地方……

越到后期，两个重生点之间的距离越发加大，你得一气呵成地去完成一大段jump、dash配合的动作，并且还要注意jump是不是还有留下第二段，dash能量值是否回复到马上可以施放。

外加到了最后一章，出现了很变态的同一条路往返模式，先从下方很变态的路走过去开启机关，再从和下路差不多难度的上路返回，而且NPC机器人的设置地点简直太绝了，要通关还是需要一定心情的，不然真可能搁置掉不去碰了。

②说一下游戏的其他部分：

1、我基本没感觉到有什么剧情，偶尔见到的log也没去读，从头到尾的感觉就是一直往上爬，都接近末尾了一句语音，一句解说都没碰到过，比较枯燥；只有在地图中出现的闪烁文字提示你这一段你该怎么过。

2、按键设置无法识别鼠标左侧按键，而blast这个功能我现在也没明白除了让boss机器人闭嘴外具体要怎么用，倒是跌跌撞撞一路爬上来了。另外有时候会碰到bug，比如dash冲进墙，结果好不容易通过的部分报废，只能回到重生点再来。

3、环境来说，我印象中一共经历了：风暴层上方的晴朗区域、塔基的建筑内部区域、黑色风暴区域，最终现在站立的地方也和第一章的天气差不多，已经可以看到塔尖了，印象最深的还是我重来了非常多次的黑色风暴层，大得没边的虚空环境对心理很有压抑感，配合一直失败的打击会让人抓狂。

4、略微不适合恐高症患者；这个场景是极其巨大的，上下全看不见边际，这比普通的高处还更可怕，若是踩空坠落，下方就是风暴一样的无底洞。我其实自身是有一点恐惧心理的，而且到了第五章你甚至还能依稀看见你第一章进来的那个地方，要知道你可是爬了几个小时还没登顶的状态。

③最后提一句，我在游戏一半剧情的黑色风暴层那边就解锁了一个成就：Get disintegrated by a laser 500 times.【被激光网分解500次】，而我还有更多更多的马上重来，我可等不及坠落半天再被分解……

几个小时下来手已经酸了，回头有心情我再来玩这游戏吧…虽然我被虐得惨但其实回味起来不坏…
 
Sunwy

Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2016
BEATEN (All 5 Levels) - 5 hours

Deadcore is a platforming-based speedrunning game not entirely unsimilar to Cloudbuilt. You pick up some powers as you progress including:
- A gun that can turn some stuff on/off in levels.
- Double jump
- A super fast dash
- A few others

You dont need to speedrun it. In fact, you will likely feel accomplished just making it through most of the areas.

Not a bad game at all. Pretty good fun in fact.

♥♥♥♥:
- Can be quite difficult (and thus frustrating)

Very simplistic but ultimately challenging platformer/FPS, like a mix between Portal and that abstract level in Mirror's Edge. It starts off easy with few mechanics involved, but as you gain more powers and techniques the platforming becomes a lot more precision-based. Great level design and fitting music, you should definitely pick this up if you enjoy platformers :)

It's a shame. This seems like a great game otherwise. First 2 levels had some great design and the physics felt fine... FWIW. If you're used to playing on 30 FPS or something, it might be playable.

0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
89.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2015
This game has a lot going for it. However, the "twitch" factor is very high. To make a pun that current owners of the game will get … it’s “Sky High.” It is my sincere hope that enough reviewers will echo my sentiments & that the developers will eventually enable a control panel & permit a “God Mode” so that talentless old folks like myself can at least observe the level design & artwork, which is quite good.

I've unlocked a gravity ability, & I have given up on level 4. I've seen You-Tube posts of nerds with superhuman gaming powers (& obviously way too much time on their hands) hurtling through the levels like a hot knife through butter, yet I apparently do not have the patience to die as much as I have...anymore.

Don't get me wrong: it's a gorgeous game. The movement is good. The levels are well designed (despite their difficulty & oftentimes confusing mechanics.) The colors are nice & the textures are good enough. The game loads quickly & respawning is mercifully instantaneous. It simply is too “twitchy” & it lacks a compelling story line to keep me intrigued. The level I gave up on is particularly dark & chaotic. Keeping track of which way is up became ridiculously impossible.

I would recommend this to someone young with very good hand eye coordination & a LOT of spare time on their hands. I would NOT recommend this to anyone who has ever experienced a seizure. Even some folks with no history of seizures might experience one while playing “DeadCore.” I feel very fortunate to have purchased “DeadCore” for only $3.99 during a holiday sale; I can honestly say that the levels I DID get through were worth exactly that but not one penny more.

One last thing: folks who compare this game to “Portal” or “Portal 2” are vastly overstating this game. There’s a gun. It’s an FPS. There’s apparently some sort of AI that’s taken over things & made a mess of the world. Beyond that, there is no comparison.
 
Calamity Clambake

☣VőĺċǻñőQũǻķë☣
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 octobre 2016
Deadcore is a 3D FPS platformer game that relies on quick reactions to navigate obstacle courses populated by moving lasers, ever shifting platforms, fans that blow you of course and other dangers.

It's pretty challenging, so you'll have to try again and again to get past the various sections of the game. The big jumps and sense of height and scale is very cool, so this is probably as close as I'm going to get to how Mustang Wanted and his kin feel when they undertake their deathdefying urbex adventures.

I also like the graphical style and the level design for the most part. This game was built to test your patience. I also really like the quick respawns which encourage that one more try feeling, a la Super Meatboy.

On the downside, and I can't quite put my finger on why, but I didn't enjoy it as much as I thought: the ingredients are all there, but it doesn't want to make me want to sing from the rooftops about it. Perhaps I found it too frustrating? I don't know. I didn't have that problem with Super Meatboy and that frustrated the hell out of me!

If 3D platforming is something you enjoy, this is definitely worth giving a spin. The ingredients are all there, but for me personally, it didn't quite get me as excited as I hoped.

7/10
 
Seng Tsan
661 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2016
This is a superb platformer speedrun game that successfully ties in puzzle and FPS aspects alongside a tremendous atmosphere. The only problem I noticed is occasional lack of direction, but to observant players, this won't provide any trouble. I strongly recommend this game to anyone who likes fast-paced and/or platforming games, especially if you enjoyed A Story About my Uncle as the two games' gameplay are similar. For any sale price, especially the current one, this game is absolutely worth it (and $10 is alright if you buy primarily for the speedrunning aspect). I hope to see even more added to this game in the future. 9.5/10

A platforming game with some interesting puzzles and gameplay. The platforming aspect is very fluid and responsive, but some of the parts are really hard to get right because the tolerance for errors is so small. So that means doing sections over and over again, which can become a chore after a while. Luckily there are frequent savepoints so the sections you retry are usually not that long.
 
Earl of Lemongrab
724 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2015
I'm gonna get this out of the way first 'cause this game has HUGE problems that make it, actually, a pretty bad speedrunning game. I do like it, though.

1. For whatever reason, you cannot shoot anything at point-blank range. This includes switches as well as enemies that are about to knock you off the edge of a platform. This kind of gets in the way of things. A lot.
2. The boost pads are horridly inconsistent. Often not propelling me with enough height or distance to get to the next platform, resulting in either a death or at best a bit of wasted time.

Neither of these can be intentional at all and they really destroy any consistency in running levels, two glitches that really need fixing. That being said I did 100% this game, so.

A few other problems I had:
Overuse of enemies, especially cases of enemies awkwardly crammed into otherwise fine level segments. Some of them feel like cheap shots.
The sparks vary in quality a lot more than the rest of the game. Three of them had really strict time limits compared to everything else in the game and a good number of them didn't bring much if anything new to the table, it feels like the devs ran out of ideas making them. I do like having them, though, adds a lot of length to the game and it's not like they're awful levels in general.
I feel like instead of giving these massive goliath levels, the main levels could have been split up a bit more. Levels 4 and 5 are both big enough to be two, even three levels. Though they're really not that terribly long when you know them well enough (and have the spark paths down).
Checkpointing could use some work, sometimes it's fine and other times there's a bit too much between checkpoints.
This is a minor gripe, but for a game with branching level paths and an emphasis on speedrunning, it's really strange that there are definitive "best paths" in the form of sparks; there's literally no arguing with any of them, they are always faster and most of the time actually easier too, due to being shorter.
I have no clue what any of the story is. I read the logs and saw the true ending and I don't get it.

Now onto the good:
The controls. They're stellar. Really. The jump feels great, the dash feels great, rocket jumping is intuitive enough, the basic move speed is really good for this kind of game. The dash meter is a bit short at first but it gets better with upgrades, so, EHH.
The level design. There's a lot of creative ideas in the main level and the game never really repeats itself (aside from a few instances of VERTICAL LASER TUNNEL and DASH THROUGH LASER TUNNEL moments, the former of which generally comprise most of the worst sections of the game, the latter always being fun enough to not get on my nerves). Each level introduces a new mechanic (well, save for the second level, though you could argue that the branching paths count as a new mechanic, the first level is pretty linear aside from the shortcut paths).
The difficulty curve is pretty smooth too. It starts out pretty simple and ramps up fast but not dauntingly so, each new section gets a bit harder than the previous section and you suddenly realize that "super hard" section two levels ago is a piece of cake compared to the "super hard" section you're facing now, which will probably be a piece of cake by the time you hit the next level's "super hard" sections. But really, it's all manageable. As long as you actually learn from mistakes, at least.
The game's also gorgeous to look at, though admittedly it gets kind of samey after playing for 20 hours or so, but the scale of the levels is still pretty breathtaking, admittedly.
I like this game. I don't love this game. But I think it's worth playing. It's leagues better than Cloudbuilt, at the very least, though the parkour mechanics would've been great to have here too but eehh it doesn't really need them when the rest of the mechanics are good enough.

So yeah, that's me rambling for a while about a thing.
 
rory

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 mai 2017
DeadCore is a first person platformer with focus on extreme speeds. You jump, dash and shoot your way through futuristic levels.

Visuals
The game has very solid art direction and the visuals look quite nice on the technical level too. There's some slight LOD popping, but overall this is not too distracting. The game could have used some more visual variety, however. As it is, all the levels look quite similar.

Audio
The sound effects and the music get the job done, but neither is particularly memorable.

Gameplay
The high speed precision platforming is clearly the main focus here and it is certainly well implemented. You can double jump and dash through the levels at insane speeds and when you pull this off the game can be incredibly satisfying.

As you progress through the levels the game adds a few new powers and obstacles to the mix but these don't really change the core gameplay much. There are also some basic shooter elements but personally I felt that this aspect was rather poorly done. The few enemies you encounter aren't particularly interesting and frankly I would have preferred the game without them.

Level design is weirdly inconsistent. Some levels are well done with multiple paths through them. Unfortunately there are also sections that rely heavily on trial and error, especially in the last two levels. This problem is exacerbated by the poor placement of some checkpoints.

Difficulty
DeadCore is a fairly challenging game and there are no difficulty settings.

Controls
The controls are pretty tight and responsive with mouse + keyboard.

Story and Writing
The story is purely optional (hidden away in data logs) and not particularly interesting or well-written.

Bugs and Glitches
Overall the game was quite polished and bug free. I did get stuck on scenery a few times and one of the map hazards stopped working completely after a while.

Final Verdict
I had fairly mixed feelings about DeadCore. The game has a strong visual style and it's quite satisfying when you finally complete a difficult section. On the other hand the level design has some issues and the storyline is rather weak. I'd still recommend the game, just be prepared for a fairly frustrating experience if you are not very good with precise first person platforming.

I played through the story mode and this took me around 6 hours.
 
Masa
2,908 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 novembre 2015
I just finished Deadcore for the first time last night and I've already started a second playthrough to see if I can find all of the collectibles, get the second ending and earn some more achievements. I'll probably mess with the speedrun mode for a bit as well. So, my verdict? Deadcore is a blast. The game is a sci-fi styled puzzle/platformer/shooter where you're stuck in a sort of computer glitch/alternate dimension where you must scale a huge tower using quick reflexes and every ability in your arsenal. If you mix Mirror's Edge, Portal, the movie Cube, Megaman and some other similarly themed games and movies, you will have Deadcore. This is not a game for those looking to relax or have an easy go of things. Your patience will be tested but there was certainly a sense of accomplishment whenever you'd complete a very difficult section and finally reach that elusive next checkpoint.

The meat of the gameplay sees you jumping from block to block/platform to platform while dodging moving laser fields, robotic foes hellbent on knocking you into the abyss and every other oddity you can imagine. There are disorienting anti-gravity sections that will turn you on your head, jump pads, gravity tunnels that send you hurtling towards danger that you must avoid and much, much, much more. You get a few abilities like a dash to help you out as well as the Switch Gun that does everything from activating objects in the enviroment that you need to use in order to progress to stopping your robo-foes dead in their tracks. There is a story and it's told passably enough through numerous data logs that you can collect as you climb this digital Tower of Babel. Speaking of collectibles, there's plenty to find. In addition to the logs there are also music tracks, Switch Gun upgrades and Sparks (that open up new pathways of travel) to find.

Deadcore takes place in a pretty unusual setting that is brought to life thanks to some excellent graphics. You'll truly feel the awe and scope of the situation you're in as you look up and see how far you literally have to climb to get to the next area. Particle effects dazzle, threats are well-animated, dizzying gravity changes look awesome as the scenery flips every which way and the overall atmosphere is a slice of sci-fi goodness that looks simultaneously grand and opaque, all in the same breath. It's not THE most beautiful game ever created as some of the enviroments can get a bit samey, but 90% of the time Deadcore is a pleasure to the eye. The sound is pretty strong as well, if not quite as crystalline as the graphics are. Robotic foes make c3po noises, your Switch Gun shots pack a fair punch and everything is perfunctory in terms of special audio FX. Where the sound really shines is with the techno/industrial soundtrack that pumps adrenaline in the background; complimented by numerous dips into trip-hop ambience.

Even if Deadcore packed a simply average presentation it wouldn't matter much because in a game as challenging as this one, the controls are the most important aspect. MOSTLY, they are competently well done and accurate enough for you to do the job but let's face it...you're going to DIE and die you will as you struggle with all of your might to pass the 5 main levels in story mode. Jumping, dashing, shooting the Switch Gun and avoiding threats works most of the time and pulling off a series of daring saves and escapes is satisfying and breathtaking to chain together. The real big BUT here is that sometimes things just don't work as they should. Movement is a bit floaty and even if your leaps and dives are dead on the money, you are bound to go sliding off your perch. The game has its own physics to master. Sometimes the game requires lining up perfectly between several moving lasers and these segments are rarely passable on the first attempt. In addition to the "float" controls, there are instances where your button presses won't register AT ALL. My keyboard is new, clean as a whistle and generally in top-notch condition, but that didn't stop the f*cking Space Bar from not accepting my double jumps many, many times even if I waited a moment on a platform to make sure that the double jump ability reset itself. Checkpoints are oftentimes pretty fairly located but there are several portions of the game where you'll need to cover a darn good chunk of distance to reach one and in these cases the ill-response of the controls will have you repeating these portions over and over and over again. What makes it fun is the fact there is a Steam Achievement that can only be unlocked by dying a hilarious # of times. I laughed to myself seeing this, saying, "Ha, even if this game is tough as nails, I'll never die THAT much." I'm not sure what's scarier...the fact that I scoffed at the idea of dying so frequently or the fact that I reached the achievement before I totally completed level 3. Good God...I died fast and hard! But I kept trying and playing...

In terms of replay value, masochists like myself will find more than enough of it in Deadcore. I'm already starting a second playthrough to see if I can grab all of the collectables at the very least and there is also a speed-run mode available where you can stack yourself up against the competition all over the world and try to best the developer's times. This is one of those games that I'll probably lose interest before getting every single achievement (I won't be good enough to get a few either I'm sure), but it's going to keep me playing long after a single completion. In fact, I hope to get some more out of it in after writing this review. There's not much else to say here. This game was pretty darn great and worth the money I spent on it. Though I hit on the controls fairly hard, I do want to enforce the notion that you will get better and come to get a grip on the movement in this game the more that you play. I kind of disagree with the folks that say you can't get better at it. I did. It has its quirks, but I see them as masterable quirks.

Let me break down as always into what I liked and what I didn't in a more quick reference style!

Pros:

-Excellent graphics and visual effects
-Great lighting and particle explosions
-A small but useful selection of abilities and Switch Gun modes
-Fun level design with alot of different challenges packed into each one
-Decent sound design with exceptional music
-Lots to see and do (collectibles, alternate modes, different paths, etc.)
-Controls are a pain but somehow become adaptable if you stick with the game
-Interesting story premise

♥♥♥♥:

-Controls are NOT for the casual gamer (I'm pretty hardcore...not the best, not the worst, so I had fun learning to get better at them)
-While the graphical sights are impressive, they do get samey as the game goes on
-Though the music was excellent, sound was rather humdrum
-Story itself becomes passe as the game progresses (perhaps ending #2 will shed more light)
-Enemies feel like an annoying afterthought. They aren't particularly challenging as the platforming is the real challenge and they feel more like an annoyance than necessary to the gameplay.
-For a game focused on speed, there are certain segments where you must sit and assess the situation even if you already know the level.
-Sometimes the controls flat out don't respond

Overall, I had a blast with Deadcore. I got more enjoyment out of it than Portal...just my humble opinion. It's going to tick you off sometimes but every time I wanted to put the game down I found out that I simply couldn't for long. It was fun more often than it was annoying. The sci-fi setting was cool and when the controls were hitting their stride, there was plenty of satisfaction in pulling off several quick movements in succession. Hopefully, a few of the games issues will be addressed and upgraded, or fixed in a sequel.

Rating: 8/10
 
TheBeak
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2015
Seeing how many people compare this game to portal let me explain why that isnt really possible and then I talk about my opinion on deadcore itself.

Deadcore is a game about reflexes/physical challenges in general. You know what you have to do, but good luck pulling it off. Sometimes you can improve your performance by figuring out an even faster way to nmove on and sometimes finding collectibles requires some thinking but you can play through without ever just standing there for half an hour wondering what to do next. Portal on the other hand is figuring out the solution to a puzzle. Actually performing that solution in most cases isnt that hard.

Secondly there is nigh 0 story in Deadcore. That is not a bad thing, it isnt neccesary. There are hidden collectibles that give access to texts that will give you an idea of what the story is, but you have to find those first, so there is a good chance you go through the game without any story, also there is no voiceacting. This of course also means that there is no humor, but again that is not what this game is about or needs. Meanwhile Portal has its great and funny voiceactors that carry you through the game and you always know why you are where you are etc.

third the gun. yeah you use a physics doing gun in each game. In deadcore it is used to disable enemies and activate or deactive different mechanics, you dont always need it, there is a good chance you can get through a section without using your gun once. In Portal it basically is your main mechanic

So yeah that should explain why its an apple-pears comparison.

Now deadcore itself in my opinion was great fun. Some say it is to difficult and I can agree that it can get punishingly tough, but the last checkpoint usually wasnt far away and you get right back in the action. Id say a downside is falling off stuff since you are basically waiting to slam into death or going to the menu and clicking restart from checkpoint, neither of which are as fast as dying from anything else.

The abilitys all work and except for a rocket-jump like function all work very well, though sometimes precise landing can be a problem when for example your dash shoots you farther than you wanted. The rocket-jumpish ability btw almost never comes into use (in my playstyle, which means just trying to finish the level) so it isnt a problem.
Now the mechanics of the game world itself are mostly pretty good, but the gravitation changing combined with your camera moving and often the gravitation sections being the hardest to see where to go and what to do next can be a real pain.
Also the enemies could have been done better. I kind of feel like they are more of a nuisance than anything else. THere is a swarm of tiny enemies for example that slows you down and makes you less mobile and is therefor generally your death. This of course also means that once it has you escaping gets even harder. What is even worse is that these are most commonly found in the already hard enough gravitation segments. The other 2 enemy types are less annoying but all together I think this game could have done without them.
Oh and devs you will never read this but: PLEASE DEACTIVATE PAST CHECKPOINTS THAT NO SENSIBLE PERSON WOULD USE ANYMORE IN SOME PATCH! You can easyly lose everything in some sections of the game because instead of falling to your death you fall on top of a checkpoint hat is basically where you started half an hour ago and there is no way you can undo it and that is just rage inducing and a game killer.
Thankfully it isnt possible for this to happen often and probably you just have to have my luck for it to happen at all.

Now about speedrunning: yes, this game is used for speedrunners showing off with leaderboards etc. Is it hard to speedrun through? Is it good and fun to speedrun through? No idea, if there was an opposite of a speedrunner that'd be me. Though the game often offers paths that are faster but as a price more difficult. Now if you, like me, are not a speedrunner that isnt even an issue. How fast you complete the game means nothing if you dont want to shine on some leaderboard. Oh but dont excepect the game to be slow, until you reach a platform where nothing tries to kill you you have to be fast and precise or die.

All together great fun but not very long, by on sale if you like challenges
 
The Krozzus
1,616 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2016
The game is locked internally at 50 fps. This means that even though your fps counter may show 60 (or whatever your maximum refreshrate allows), the game still actually renders only 50fps. The whole engine is locked at 50. If you play on a 60Hz screen, 10 frames will be repeated, creating a tremendously uncomfortable headache experience. The game is supposed to be fast paced. At the moment, you either play the game with the screen set to 50hz (or 100....if you are lucky) so that you can match the game framerate (you will have to deal with input lag at 50Hz).....or you don't.

I chose the latter. It is supposed to be a fast paced game, it would be impossible (or just uncomfortable, at least for me) to play it at anything below 60fps. Despite many requests from the users, the developers never tried to do anything since release.
 
rogermorse
800 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

This game can be a little frustrating at times when you get stuck in an area, but when you get through it, it feels all the more satisfying. I recommend this game.

Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2015
Very nicely made platformer with challenging levels that require skill and patience but are never unfair. Checkpoints are balanced out nicely right after each puzzle segment, so there is very little frustration and no backtracking involved. The challenges themselves are always a different obstacle to overcome so it never feels old and I'm amazed at the creativity that went into the design of them. The sound design and art are really awesome as well. All in all, a surprisingly good action platformer that I can only recommend! Probably the best since Portal, perhaps even better than that (depending on taste in the pacing and style I guess)
 
Shay
1,130 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
DeadCore is a really satisfying platforming FPS with a healthy dose of on-the-fly thinking and breathtaking graphics. The best part is that the game actually does look and play as great as the trailers imply.

What's even more impressive that this was made by a team of 5 people rather than being a high-budget AAA title with a massive team working on it. As you can see from the screenshots, the graphics are stunning, and the sound and music both accompany the game's atmosphere and theme exceptionally well. Not only is there a story mode where you venture to the peak of the massive tower, but there are several hidden items to find that unlock things like bits of the backstory and more music to listen to. There's even a speedrun mode for the highscore chasers.

I was surprised by the game's price, too; for $11, it's a pretty great purchase.
 
Illhark

Évaluation publiée le 15 septembre 2017

Évaluation publiée le 11 février 2015
Proof that first person precision platforming can work and be a ton of fun (even if it almost never is). Long enough to be satisfying, short enough to not overstay its welcome, controls very tightly and has a solid set of core mechanics as well as a lot of replay value. Can't recommend enough.

4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 octobre 2014
Vidéo YouTube™: Review - DeadCore 
Vues : 17


Zalety DeadCore
- Szybka, dynamiczna, wymagająca ogromnej zręczności zabawa
- Idea połączenia zręcznościówki i odrobinki strzelanki, za pomocą futurystycznego karabinu aktywujemy lub wyłączamy różne mechanizmy
- Trudna! Niekiedy przechodzimy grę muskając się dosłownie o przeszkody, które powodują FAIL i konieczność wczytania punktu odrodzenia
- Ładna i ciekawa oprawa graficzna, przechodząc poziomy wieży widzimy co robiliśmy oraz co czeka nas wyżej

Wady Deadcore
- Spaprane punkty respawnu, które są za daleko od zagadek na których polegliśmy i musimy spróbować ponownie, za dużo bezsensownego powracania do zagadki po każdej nieudanej próbie
- Czasami zbyt dużo szumów otoczenia, dźwięku działających maszyn (?) oraz otoczenia, a za mało muzyki i dźwięków postaci
 
Brodaty

Recommandé
19.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 avril 2016
Pro:
-Nicht zu schwer und auch nicht zu leicht (Es gibt natürlich Stellen wo man länger braucht).
-Für Jump and Run Fans ein sehr gutes Erlebnis.
-Man kommt schnell rein.
-Es fühlt sich gut an wenn man so weit springen kann.
-Sieht gut aus.
-Wenn man stirbt muss man nicht lange warten bis man respawnt
-Checkpoints sind fair gesetzt
-Es gibt immer paar versteckte Sachen zu entdecken.

♥♥♥:
-Für mich sind es zu wenige Level.
-Kaum Updates.
-Kann man leider gut glitchen

Für läppische 10€ ist das Spiel sehr gut. Und es sollte bekannter werden.

9/10

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2023
i review games on steam after i 100% complete them! check out my reviews to see all the games i have completed!

deadcore is a fast-paced FPS/puzzle/parkour-platformer from bandai namco for PC and PS4 in october 2014. it's basically a platformer where you jump around and speed run giant individual levels with really good graphics and sound/music. my favorite thing about this game is there isn't some tutorial that holds your hand and makes the entire game way too easy. this game definitely has a giant difficulty spike out of nowhere that could be off-putting to some players, but i loved how you needed to be precise directly off the bat.

it's core premise is bery engaging and straight up fun. i've seen others say it's 'for pc and PS4"boring" mostly because all the levels look similar with little to no variation. in my eyes, however, i think it's not focal point of the game. i think the focal point is the tight, responsive controls and interesting challenges in each level.

i've seen people compare it to the portal series. while i can see the comparison., it definitely is a little lacking compared to portal, just based off personal preference stuff like me loving the writing and humor from valve, etc. but the controls and stuff here are top-notch nonetheless.

while $10 full price isn't bad, i'd wait as you can routinely find this for 75% off and grab it for $2.50, which is a pretty good value for a game that has a ton of replay-ability if you strive to lower your personal best times on levels, etc. but even striving for 100% achievements or even just beating the story is worth the price on sale.
 
Trent Booty

Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 octobre 2016
The negative reviews are what made me buy this game, that and it being on sale for $2.50. Shifting through the negitives I normally find real dirt on the failures of whatever developer constructed the monstrosity I am pondering of purchasing. Once I noticed this game had 2 repeating issues from the thumbs down crowd.

One is this game is not Portal, nor Portal 2. Well, no s$$$, it's called DeadCore. I am under the impression that the connection some find is the puzzles and minor Parkour. Maybe it's the fun one finds when after you faceplant into a loop of epic failures and the that one time you get it right and move past? Who knows, as it's someones personal connection.

The second "complaint" about this game is the QQ. I mean the real QQ, raw and uncut, 100% pure, Kleneex Tissue by the box QQ. >THIS GAME IS TO HARD<. For the amount of thumbs down due to this game being potentially to hard for some people to play, I pour each Dev a shot and raise mine in salute to producing a game for the non-casual gamer. Not every game needs to be easy and hold your hand. If you find the laser walls move to fast, you need to move faster. If those turrets are hitting you first, you need to shoot first.

If you cry over this game being to hard, get better at gaming. Go back to square one.
Practice, Apply, Fail, and Repeat until victory.
No one said this is going to be easy

It runs very smooth. Controls are tight, with micro adjustments midair and mouse sensitivity spot on at default. Graphically this game isn't lush forests and blown apart bunkers or cities floating in the sky or space. It is a complex puzzler with Tron stlye graphics, but your not here to enjoy the sunset. Graphics are perfect for their application. Music soundtrack is nicely applied, and not overbearing. Puzzles will make you stop for a bit and look around, but your not searching for the lever behind the mummy on the 2nd floor storeroom for 30 minutes. You will have your goal within 10 seconds.

I don't understand why someone could give a good game a thumbs down for difficulty, instead of a thumbs up and a warning.
 
Benesato
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
74.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2016
Deadcore is a game which is set in a metallic world with many hazards and surrounded by fog, and the music goes well with this atmosphere.

The gameplay is hard, you will fail many times but this is not bad because it feels rewarding to finally pass a level, and with more powerups you can go back to a level and get more items like logs, tracks.

So don't be put off by people saying it is too hard, they are challenges to overcome using speed, skill and patience.

So this is definitely worth a try, although it is not a casual play game much so if that is what you like then this may not be for you, if you like the speed, skill side of it, then do it.

Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2015
Très bon jeu, dommage qu'il n'y ait pas une véritable histoire à la place de l'enchainement linéaire des niveaux.
Chaque niveau dispose de plusieurs embranchements, ce qui fait qu'on peut constamment découvrir de nouvelles portions du jeu. Bande son calme, on finit même par l'oublier.

Point notable, c'est la première fois que je vois un jeu également pensé pour le speedrun (présence de cette option dans le menu principal). Ca fait plaisir.

Le jeu égale pas Portal ou Talos Principle mais reste quand même très très bon, bien que court globalement (et encore heureux pour les speedrunners).

18.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mars 2015
The game is so big. SO. BIG. Some parts you can cheese through, some parts you have to buckle down and fight through, some parts you have to pray for luck to get through. The semi-open world puzzle is exhilerating. Your options are numerous. The graphics are the greatest.

If you are looking for a first person puzzle very similar in playstyle to portal, this is your game. Physics go crazy.

This game seems to be under rated. It should be as well known as Portal 2.

I don't know how much this game costs right now, but I would spend a solid $30 for it. And I'm not even past the fourth level.

307 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 septembre 2017
Saw this one when browsing around steam one day and threw it on my wishlist. It just so happened to go on sale last week for 75% off so for $2.50. It reminded me of a platforming portal-esque game (and I love portal) so for $2.50 it was a no brainer. Pretty challenging but not in a rage inducing way but I was having fun with it for about 2 hours until they threw in gravity switching. For me this game mechanic just ruined the entire experience. In my opinion I think it was an unecessary addition to an already challenging game. Throwing the gravity switching in to the mix left me disoriented and unsure of what to do next. This would be almost bearable but, of course, the gravity is on a timer which makes things even worse. I know a lot of people didn't mind this gameplay element but it ruined the game for me. That said I can't not recommend it, especially if you can get it on sale. Just be aware that this mechanic may throw you off.
 
tHEmOSTpALONE
100 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2015
Incredible. The gameplay behond Deadcore is essentially a first person platform game which just so happens to have a gun to activate things. The game challanges you to climb a large mechanical tower made of levitating blocks higher and higher with checkpoints along the way. Sometimes it seems incredible how high one level can go.
The way you get around in Deadcore is by jumping platform to platform, using jump pads, stragetically whilst activating markings on some of the surrounding blocks, whilst dodging red lazers, autoturrets and floating security droids shaped as blocks or orbs which try to knock you off or into lazers in various ways. timing is important.

Throughout the early levels you get introduced to different abilities to climb this monstrous tower of jumping puzzles, turrets and lazers. A double jump at first, a boost which you can use twice before recharging, or hold down for a powerful boost forward and finally a kind of boost orb which when used properly can help propel you in the air after a double jump. However the gun you carry around is more like a tool and you can only fire 30 times, until you get a checkpoint where the gun refils with shots. This can be specially annoying when defending yourself from drones as you try to figure something out, only to reach where you wanted to go and find a marking to activate, with no point but to kill yourself and try again and learn through trial and error.
Just as you get used to the rhythm of shooting markings to activate jump pads at the exact moment, barely fit through lazers like the Japanese game show concept 'Hole in the Wall', then the game literally turns itself upside down with transparent markings on to of blocks which temporaliy affect your gravity in that purple highlighted area and that's where it gets a bit like Portal, getting completely misco-ordinated whilst climbing a tower upwards, suddenly realising what direction you are facing in mid air and quickly making a landing whilst some floating drones are trying to send a pulse wave so you can get incinerated by a nearby patch of red lazer.

Utterly brilliant and taxing, like my earlier reviewed 'A Story About My Uncle' but instead relies on perfectly timed jumps and a repetition and rhythm as you jump pad to pad and activate marking by marking. It's more like a physical training course and the reward of getting to a checkpoint where you can auto save your progress (and go back to the real world) is so satisfying, but it's so easy to fall into a trance doing each action at the right time and each move at the right measurement and you will swear a lot.

Minimal, mysterious, thrilling and very rewarding.
 
Freker
1,692 produits enregistrés
0

Non violent games are my favourite but there are so few good ones, and not enough mac games ported on steam.
Non violent, challanging, steep difficulty curve, and fun.
When a game makes you need a break beacuse its so frustrating and your stuck, thats a good game.

Sher
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 juin 2015
When first browsing for games in the "Less than $5" section, I game across DeadCore. After waiting for the right time (which happened to be the Summer of 2015), I finally bought the game. I'll be honest, it was definitely worth it. Now, shall we begin?

+Promising environment and textures - the techy-mystery type!
+Fitting sound effects - works perfectly with every movement.
+Great gameplay - involves a lot of speedy runs and jumps, as well as activation of numerous entities! Parkour!
+Perfect soundtrack - though not the best, it coordinates well with situations, speed, and mood of the game.
+Tone - not sure how to describe it, but the game gives off a very well-produced feeling of accomplishment!

+/-Pace of the gameplay - depending on how you like it, the game's speed will give you either a feeling of frustration or adventure.
+/-Challenging - once again, depending on the player, challenges can either be accepted or rejected in frustration

-Difficulty - this is indeed one of the toughest games I've played.
-Limited demographic - this game is truly for those who like games that are fast-paced, involve parkour, or like challenges. It is also only for those who don't mind dying repeatedly!

Though rather short (if you're good at the game), I've come to really enjoy "running and jumping and falling off things" while playing this game. I've seen people compare the game to Portal, but with all honesty, it's not really. The "gun" that you are given has completely different properties, and the gameplay may be different, but it's original. Most of the time, you "gotta go fest". Moving at "sanic" speed is one aspect of this game that makes it fun (for me at least).

As for my rating: 80%
"Dexterity..."

Now, let's go swat some Mosquitos and run past the Troopers!

 
Sominius
92 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 septembre 2017
Is unbelievable how good this game is. The challenge is present at all times, but it never gets annoying and always demands the player to know how to use all the abilities learned (different from a lot of platformers that give a ability that you use once or twice and even forget it exists).

I really like how every new power-up is incorporated through the levels, and I particularly loved the gravity one.

If you like a good challenge and platforming, you can't go wrong with this one.

6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 octobre 2016
I'll keep this short.

Pros - basically everything. Graphics are good, level design is nothing like i've ever seen, etc etc.

The ♥♥♥.

This game is not for the casual crowd.
You will Die.
You will Die again.
You will Die a lot. Over and Over again. I feel like this game sacrifices fun for difficulty, because about halfway through the split second actions start to increase and the checkpoints eem like they get few and far in between.

Is this a bad thing? Not very, but if you are short in patience and if you don't pay attention to every detail of the puzzel, you wil fail over and over again. Sometimes it feels like a clusterf---, when you have to juggle ammo preservation, enemy movement, lasers, timed platforms, etc. While playing this game I let out a huge sigh of relief every time I saw that green checkpoint circle

I do not recommend this game unless you want to be challenged. I do not recommend this game to the casual crowd.

Will I be happy when I finish the game? Yes, to an extent.

Am I happy that I just restarted what was possibly the final level in the game, when I was halfway done with it?

No.

No I am not.
 
WiildFiire

Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2015
听说和传送门比较相似 我就去试了试
然而 结果
sad
顺便一提这是第一款把我玩晕的游戏
这款游戏根本不是解密类游戏 而是找路的游戏
通关时间用了4小时20分钟（未集齐星火）
过程中也没有任何东西陪你聊天 趣味性和传送门比起来也差了许多
全程几乎没有任何解密类元素 无限Retry也只是为了能碰碰最好的运气罢了
传送门你需要真正的思考你该如何到达下个地方 这个游戏呢 90%的地方你知道路 但你还是只能无限的rrrrr 只是因为障碍物会不断的攻击你 你需要获得最好的运气才能到达下个检查点 所以这个过程真的很想很想很想让你砸键盘 甚至放弃这个游戏
因为实在太单调了
而解（zhao）密（lu）的过程中你甚至不知道任何剧情 没有任何的互动 只能通过日记零星的片段来判断发生了什么（虽然到最后我也不知道发生了什么
而游戏最有趣的地方大概也只是通关后找星火日记和跑道的时候了 大概是因为在相同的关卡你能走不寻常的路吧
不过也不得不说 设计人员脑洞也是够大的2333
集齐了星火的我最后从章节选择里又玩了一次最后一关 结果过关后只有restart level没有next level 怒删

getheavy
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2015
Rating: 9/10
Overview: First Person Platforming

The Good:

+ The story campaign features 5 levels split between checkpoints. Each level introduces a new mechanic adding a new layer to platforming. The levels feel like large obstacle courses that slowly ramp up in difficulty. Every level also features multiple pathways encouraging multiple playthroughs.

+ Speedrun mode allows you replay the story campaign missions in addition to bonus levels that are unlocked by playing the story campaign to compete for the fastest times. You play these levels thinking how good you are only to watch videos online and realize how little skill you actually have.

+ Great controls lead to great platforming. The platforming is less about precision and more about timing. When to dodge lasers, when to jump, when to avoid enemies etc. Every new section is like a puzzle, figuring how to reach the end, how to get the timing down just right etc, leads to a lot of satisfaction. You will die A LOT but that isn't a bad thing because every death means you learn something new. Once you die you instantaneously respawn at the checkpoint so you never have to wait. This may not seem important but when you die very frequently it becomes important to get back into the game as fast as possible.

+ Enemies are introduces in the later levels to add variety. You can temporarily stun them with you weapon or you can try to avoid them.

+ Techno soundtrack fits perfectly with the overall theme of the game


The Bad

-The game has a bug that doesn't seem to remember your settings every time you start the game. You have to go back into settings for the game to recognize it. Some levels had a few random bugs making it almost impossible to complete.
Restarting the level fixed these issues.

Conclusion

If you are the type of person to rage quit, this game may not be the best for you as it requires patience, timing, skill and a bit of luck. An enemy in the wrong place can make a good run turn ugly very quickly. If you are willing to put up with that however, you may find yourself playing one of the best platformers on steam.
 
JLP101
2,097 produits enregistrés
0

Non recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2019
This game is very pretty, and is actually pretty fun to play, if you like FPS / Puzzle games. However, if you are like me, and have notifications going from Discord or Telegram or whatnot, if you tab out of the game without pulling up the menu, you've just crashed your game. Oh, and if you try to pull the game back up, you've crashed your computer.

I have tried to reinstall drivers and the game itself to see if I had a corrupted driver or game file, but nope. Whenever the game becomes minimized, the software doesn't know how to work in the background and crashes. Only way to fix it is to kill it in Task Manager. If you do accidentally click back into the game, you better know where the power button is on your computer, cause you're never going to be able to access your computer after doing that mistake.

If you do not have notifications going off, and are just going to play the game and exit it, this is a good game for you. The music's good, the visuals are amazing, the mechanics are easy to learn. The only problem that I can find is the crashing issue.
 
Bryden J

Évaluation publiée le 8 novembre 2015
FPS移動ゲーム
壁を走ったりはしないのでパルクールとは少し違うがゲームの内容はそれに近い

射撃によってギミックを作動させたり敵を一時無力化しながらダッシュ＆ジャンプで障害物を避けながら進むステージクリア型
一般的なFPSと違って攻撃的なAIをもった敵はほとんどいない
メインはあくまでも仕掛けを利用して障害物を回避するというもので、シューターよりもプラットフォーマーとかパルクールと言った方がしっくりくる
落下死の他、一撃死の障害物が多いので死にゲー、覚えゲーでもある
FPSだと思わず、高難度アクションゲームだと思っておかないと一撃死のトライ＆エラーに耐えられない

ストーリーは5ステージまでしかないが各ステージが十分に長いので問題ない


酔いやすいというレビューを見たので注意したほうがいいかも
ワシは三半規管が鈍感な様で酔うことはなかったよ
頻繁に重力を操作する仕掛けが登場するので上下の感覚がおかしくなるという感覚はある
 
Holly＿Utty

Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2015
Top negative reviews for this game talk only about its supposedly too harsh difficulty, so I will only write about this part of the game here, as everyone agrees on that DeadCore is a great game, just too hard for some people.
Some say that this game is only for FPS speedrunners, others say that it's so difficult that it stops being challenging and becomes just irritating. I found both these claims not true. I never speedran an FPS and never played similar game to DeadCore (first-person platformer with emphasis on precision and synchronisation of jumps and precise shots). And despite that I finished DeadCore in less than 5 hours and had a great time. It was challenging and satisfying experience.

So I really encourage you to give DeadCore a chance. Given the game's low price and (if you don't like it) Steam's refund system you are not risking much. But there is a chance that you'll have a great time with this game, just as I did.

Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2014
Do you like platformers? Do you like insane twitch mechanisms, quake style mad acrobatics and shooting?
With no real "enemy" apart from falling to your death and the laser walls, the game seems minimalistic, but holy hell this game has a lot in store. It's a real brain buster at the same time as being fast paced and difficult to beat, so prepare to stop and think for a while sometimes. The best approach in my opinion is to go at it and experiment!

There are always multiple ways to do things, and often turning off a giant fan will not help you, it will slow you down. You can simply use the momentum of the fan to propel yourself further...through the spinning blades..carefully xD The trick is NOT to die to spinny doom blades of death.

9/10.

The only thing that I'd say is...where is the music? XD
 
Femboy Hooters Regular

Leider ist das Spiel nur für Hardcorefans des Geschicklichkeitsspiels zu empfehlen.

Die Sprungelemente sind ab einem gewissen Punkt viel zu schwer.

Leider gibts bei Steam keinen "geht so Daumen" oder einen "so so thumb" als Kriterium.
Denn ich kann durch die Schwierigkeit des Games keinen uneingeschränkt Daumen hoch vergeben.
Ein richtiger Daumen runter ist es aber auch nicht wirklich.
Da es aber leider nichts dazwischen gibt muss ich mich leider eher für folgendes entscheiden:

Daumen runter.

PaddyPimp
1,099 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2015
I grew up and actively participated in the skill jump scene seen throughout various quake/halflife/unreal based games. I enjoyed the skill based challenge of these, they were rudimentary but there was something about the use of the game mechanics in such a unique way that captivated me. It never felt unfair, it was my own lack of skill. It didn't hurt there was an active community as well to be part of.

So along comes a game designed to capitalise on this as so few games have got FPS platforming right. Great looking and with some relatively tight mechanics.

However, where I rarely felt cheated before, past the half way mark deadcore constantly has sections of rote memorisation. There are long and un-checkpointed parts that force you to replay countless times to learn them. Even a half-decent FPS player would find it hard to impossible to judge many of the jumps on reaction. This is especially evident in the gravity sections, with no easy indication of orientation, its very easy to get lost before being summarily thrown into the abyss.

There are enemies whose only purpose seems to be to frustrate and foil jumping runs, you can only delay and cannot kill them. Your gun has limited ammo between checkpoints, that are again put further and further apart. This gun is required to activate switches yet can be depleted to stop aforementioned enemies, I cannot see how this was a sensible design choice.

Overall, an interesting concept with fantastic graphics, but layering on artificial difficulty with too many frustrating and confusing gameplay elements to remain as fun as it starts.
 
Ed

yeni bir oyunla herkese merhaba. karşınızda Deadcore
hopla, zıpla, yarış, yetiş...
portal oynayanlar bu oyuna bayılacaklar, yeri gelecek klavyeyi parçalamak isteyecekler. ama her bölüm sonunda ellerindeki kramplara ve terlere rağmen içlerinde kelebekler uçuşurcasına mutlu olacaklar.
portal benzeri oyunumuzda elimizde çevreyle etkileşimli bir silah kullanıyoruz. zorlu parkurları bu silah sayesinde geçiyoruz. her bölümün birden fazla çözümü var.
eğer oyunda biryerde takıldıysanız ve geçemiyorsanız mutlaka etrafınıza iyi bakın. başka bir yol bulabilirsiniz. oyunun tam çözüm videolarını myoyuns youtube kanalımızdan takip edebilirsiniz.
bulmaca ve platform oyunlarını seviyorsanız kaçırmayın. mutlaka alınması gereken bir oyun olduğunu düşünüyorum.zaten çok cüzi miktarara satılıyor.
herkese iyi oyunlar

0
Recommandé
32.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mars 2015
You have one task: Get to the top of the tower.

It wont be easy.

DeadCore is a consistent delight. Some paths are exceedingly challenging the first time through.

The music and visuals are absolutely breathtaking and I often found myself ignoring the puzzle ahead of me and just looking around, which is actually rewarded! There's a few hidden things scattered all over the place in every level and they can be just as difficult to reach as the top of the tower.

DeadCore is a gauntlet dock[puu.sh] in the best way possible.

Рекомендую только любителям хардкора. Когда проходишь, проходишь, проходишь и сдох вместе с тем, что проходил. И ЗАНАВО! Терпеть не могу контрольные точки.

Recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juin 2015
Fun little FPS puzzler platformer, you solve puzzles by running, dashing, jumping, and shooting things, as fast and precise as you can. So it's a refreshing twist on the genre. It also has a pretty cool Tron-esque look and feel, but unique and modern in its own way. It looks gorgeous.

Get ready to respawn a lot though, it's not an easy game. But it adds new movement mechanics as you go along, which makes it increasingly fun (and increasingly challenging).
 
CesarDaSalad
495 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2018
This game is what it is. If you like speedrunning and grinding away at the same level until you have it in your reflexes and don't even think about what you're doing anymore, then this is the game for you. But if you want to explore and find out about some kind of story, then this is not a game for you. The game literally has no story, which is funny because you have to play "story" mode to play any other mode.

3D-platforming refined into a niche game that only the most masochistic players will enjoy.

I'll say this for it: it has no performance problems and looks great. Controls are fine. Graphics are shiny but lacks interesting features. This game may as well have been made 20 years ago just as well. But that doesn't mean much, really, except that is feels outdated.

228 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2015
I have over 500 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game.

One Hour Reviews #42 - DeadCore

I used to play Quake III back in the day, and I remember this one level in particular, Q3DM17 : The Longest Yard, which my friends loved to play. It was different from most of the other levels in that the level took place out in space. It had these floating platforms, and on the platforms you'd find these bouncypads that would bounce you from one platform to another. Well, in theory anyway, unless something went wrong, which in my case it always did. Like I'd get shot in the middle of the air and it would alter my trajectory and I'd miss the landing and fall into the void. Everytime I'd die like this I'd lose a point (the game considered it suicide), and often I'd end the match with a negative score.

Today I discovered there's a whole game that plays just like this Quake 3 level. It turns out I'm not very good at playing this either.

Each level is laid out with a series of checkpoints. When you miss a jump and fall to your death, you'll zot back to the last checkpoint you went through (or you can just press R). Since there aren't other people to kill, instead the game scores you by keeping tabs on how long you take to get to the end of the level. In fact, the big part of what reminds me of Quake III so much is the sense of speed as you move and jump through the level, as the game encourages you to speedrun.

The first level is setup to introduce you to the controls and objects you'll find in the environment. It starts with the basics of moving and jumping around, then introduces you to objects that launch you around, and then things that start shooting at you. You do end up with a gun, but rather than using it to shoot people, you shoot objects to either activate them (like doors) or deactivate them temporarily (like turrets).

It sounds pretty basic, but the game gets challenging pretty quick. Soon you are having to do things like shoot at turrets in the air so they don't knock you off course as you are jumping. Or you'll end up on giant spinning wheels trying to get your aim right so you can jump to a nearby platform. Then the game throws this weird looking windmill thing at you that you have to shoot to get the blades to stop spinning so you can move past.

If you aren't a fan of platformers or are a very casual player, you may be turned off by the difficulty in landing jumps and timing things right. Personally I found the game to be challenging, but also rewarding as I practiced and got better at navigating the level. It took me 25 minutes to get through the first level. The best time is under 48 seconds. That leaves a lot of room for improvement.
 
EvilSpaniard

It's jumping puzzles. They're fun jumping puzzles and the levels are well designed. If you like jumping puzzles you will like this game. If you don't like jumping puzzles you will hate this game.

Sometimes you make squares go to sleep, and also sometimes you change the gravity or die.

I reccomend this game.

Goodnight.
