3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2016
One of my favorite games I've played this year (and I've played about 30 so far), possibly one of my new favorites of all time. A challenging and rewarding first person platformer. Think of it like a first-person Dust Force. I recommend this for anyone who likes that sort of game and who isn't put off by the first-person aspect or the challenging platforming.

Pros:
+ Atmospheric and well integrated soundtrack (ambient, electronic, drum and bass type stuff). Fits well with the gameplay without making the classic indie game mistake of loud music that's only 30 seconds long and plays on a loop. There's a great variety and it doesn't distract you from the game. The sounds that play as you perform actions in the game even blend in with the music, which is a nice touch.
+ Precise controls. You have a lot of air control. You have a lot of ability to react to things.
+ Lots of variety in how you can proceed through the level. There's a lot of room for creativity, especially once you master all the movement mechanics.
+ Cool atmosphere.
+ Consistently fun gameplay. There's very few pauses in the gameplay. When you die, you immediately get to try again.
+ Great flow. It's hard to describe it, but I just found myself constantly engaged throughout every stage.
+ FOV controls. I get motion sickness pretty easily and it wasn't a problem with this game.
+ Leaderboards and tons of replayability. Even if you don't want to compete on leaderboards, there's plenty of replayabilty in finding all the secrets and collectibles and I think you can even unlock stuff by doing that.

♥♥♥♥:
- Difficulty in being aware of your hitbox. This is kind of a problem. To mitigate this, I think they tend to avoid situations where your knowledge of the hitbox is the key to getting through a section, and I think you get a sense of it as you play more, but it can still sometimes be frustrating when you collide with something or you miss somethign because you didn't have an accurate sense of where you were. However, I think that being aware of where you are in the world is just a part of the challenge and fun of the game, developing your spatial awareness skills. It's pretty impressive to think that, given only a 2d view, you can still quickly develop a rough understanding of where you are in 3d space.
- Potential for frustration. If you keep trying and failing on the same section over and over, you might get frustrated. They mitigate this by giving you a quick respawn time so you don't have time to be frustrated. I'm someone who gets frustrated easily, though, and I never had any really upsetting moments with this game. However, if you aren't actively noticing and figuring out why you died and what you should do differently, you'll probably get frustrated more easily. If you just play an autopilot and wonder why you keep dying, you may not have a good time with this. If you want to be able to clear certain sections, you really do need to devote some time to thinking about what to do. I think the checkpoint placement is just right, though. It gets farther apart as you get further in the game.
 
textbirds
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juin 2021
A lot of times Bandai games does not allow you to rekey your keyboard. This time however, I was able to rekey everything just how I liked it. Thumbs up to Bandai for this one! Now, go back and fix the rest the games that you didn't allow rekeying everything!

I will not play this game anymore than I already did. You may ask "Then why did you give it a thumbs up?" And I would have to say "That's a good question." Because of two good reasons: the first reason is I am terrified of heights! With graphics and environment on this game are extremely well done, I was having to wipe the sweat off the palm of my hands every five seconds for the whole 15 minutes I played. I love the game that scares me, and I love to play games that have lots of heights in them. But when they're this hard and there are checkpoints saves, my nerves just can't stand it. Checkpoints saves p*ss me off as it is. But when heights are terrifying me, and I have to do the same section multiple times because it's extremely difficult and does not let me save when I want to, it's more than I can deal with.

But, it is very unfair for me to give a bad review on this game just because I don't like the way it saves. There are a lot of people who will absolutely love this game, and who don't mind having to redo the same stages over and over to win. I think the fact that it scares me so much with the heights makes me tense up and miss jumps probably more than I would if it wasn't so scary.

THE GOOD: The graphics are beautiful. The handling of your character is excellent, the jumping and movement is very precise. The character moves very quickly. The graphics really look great. The airborne controls are very precise. You can rekey every key if you like.

THE BAD: Just be ready for it to drive you nuts trying to do the same place over and over because you can't save whenever you want.

THE UGLY: My sweaty palms as I am terrified by the extreme heights!

I see no reason to give a bad review just because I don't prefer the way it does they did the save game. I'm not even going to ask for my $2.50 back, because it is such a beautiful looking game. The devs have obviously gone through a lot of effort to make this a really sweet looking, and playing game.
 
RadRick01

Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2019
Deadcore ist ein 3D-Jump'n Run in futuristischem Design. Wir rennen und hüpfen hier durch ein ungewöhnliches Szenario das uns an einer gewaltigen turmähnlichen Konstruktion hinauf in schwindelerregende Höhen treibt. Das nenne ich 3D mal interessant ausnutzen. Optisch wirklich sehenswert mit leichten Plattformer-Elementen, wir kämpfen zwar nicht, müssen aber häufiger auf Schalter schießen um sie aus der Entfernung zu betätigen. Schickes Game für Freunde des gepflegten Rennens und viel Hüpfens. Die Steuerung ist aber gewöhnungsbedürfig, ich hatte anfänglich Schwierigkeiten die Sprünge richtig abzuschätzen.

Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2016
Une tour infinie, exhalant des vapeurs électrochimiques et nauséabondes, se dresse devant vous.
Quelle est son origine, et pourquoi vous ferez vous agresser par des tesseracts enragés me direz-vous?

Qu'importe la présence de ces IA informes, car ce qu'elles ne savent pas, c'est que vous êtes le nouveau messie, armé de courage et d'arrogance.
En effet, il se trouve que l'arme trouvée se requiert très utile pour augmenter vos capacités de nano-grimpeur.

Au fur et à mesure de l'ascension, le sommet de cette diantre tour pointera son ombre ou lumière.
Découvertes de journaux électroniques, multiples bonds, brefs élans aériens, tout les moyens seront bon pour gravir le monolithe conducteur.

Ninja du futur, hâte-toi car les portes de la tour electrinfernale s'ouvriront, mais personne ne sait pour combien de temps.
Grimpe, saute, tue, annihile, dépêche-toi...

N'entends-tu pas la haine de la tour? Ne sens-tu pas son appetit de chair, esmoignant de ses pores quantiques?
Dompte-la tour, tour-billonne ou tour-noie mais vite, le temps ne t'a-"temps" pas.

Doom-like (FPS) magnifique, nerveux, plateforme, univers SF, taillé pour le speedrun, hyper bien optimisé.
Valeur sûre.

Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2015
A fantastically mind bending puzzler in the vein portal with it's use of non-euclidean physics and various simple but very well executed mechanics to build unique and challenging levels. And for those who like to speedrun it's got quite a few great tools to cater to it including leaderboards and a dedicated speedrun mode, for the collecters it's got a bunch of replayability by going back in and redoing levels and finding new paths that were previously inaccessable due to a lack of upgrades. I'd very much recommend this game to any of those who enjoyed the portal series and those who enjoy mind bending puzzlers in general.

I wanted to like this game but the brutal difficulty curve did not allow it.
The first 2 (3?) levels are fun, the rest feels more like a job or assignment to finish a game.

Would not have bought this knowing what I know now.

971 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2019
What initially started as an interesting concept and enjoyable game quickly turned into the embodiment of malice and hatred that I now feel for it deeply.

The 3D platforming concept was neatly executed most of the time, and the game succeeded in keeping the gameplay fresh by introducing new mechanics and mobility tools, all the while keeping the experience simple enough to be easily understood most of the time, while making the game challenging all the way through.

What I definitely liked about the game was the possibility to forge your own path. This includes both multiple routes a player can take to get to the end of the level, taking on challenges more suitable or preferrable to tackle (not to mention it gives a lot of replayability value), as well as the aspect of being able to completely omit the paths presented to you to gain access to the goal via quite unpredictable means.
One could think the game is pretty linear with their straightforward, although branching, paths, but the game turns more and more freeform when you decide NOT to go the straight path. There's unlockables and upgrades scattered around everywhere, some well hidden, some difficult to access, but being able, and even willing, to find a way to reach and collect them, can completely change the outlook on the game.
Moreover, the collectibles allow you to access newly unlocked areas of the map by essentially materializing the new sections, further increasing the replayability value and freeform aspects.
Same goes for dash/jump and ammo upgrades. Although it is entirely possible to get through the game without any upgrades, the game rewards collecting the secrets by increasing your ammo capacity, jumping and dashing distance, reducing the energy cost of the dash etc.
Even though my own playthrough was, for the most part, pretty linear, I've since then watched the video of somebody collecting all of the unlockables, and the way they moved around the map and the areas they've accessed made me realize that despite playing the same level, we were playing a completely different game. Which is very much a big plus as far as replayability value comes.

Now, the game's interesting mechanics and the freeform playstyle possibility aside, there are certain grievances I have about the game.

For starters, the game is incredibly infuriating when it wants to be. The enemies in particular serve to be a nuisance rather than a threat, although they become a nuisance to the point of popping one's vein at times. With the exception of one, the enemies don't kill you, only red walls/floors do. The enemies instead either push you out of the map or hamper your control, slowing you down, breaking your vision, overall just taking control away from the player. That wouldn't be such a bad thing by itself, except for the fact that the game is very particular on how to get through certain sections. If you don't succeed to get through a certain section of the game flawlessly, you can be sure the mobs will screw you over. They are an obstacle as any other, but they purposefully try to block you from progressing through the section. And when you're required to make a dozen split-second decisions to get through a section, a Companion Cube-esque enemy pushing you off the ledge in mid-air can screw over your whole run. It's especially frustrating because it was not because of my own mistakes and poor execution of the section in front of me, but by taking away my control over the situation that I fail during those times. And there's few things as rage-inducing as making me fail not by me failing to execute something properly, but by taking away my control and seeing everything crumble in front of my eyes (That's why people hate Mei in Overwatch).

Another really frustrating thing is how enemies push you off the platform, and then you have to spend the next 20 seconds falling down the level before you die. It takes a long time, and I sometimes wish the enemies would just kill me on the spot instead of making me sit there and wait (Turns out this isn't the case and I'm just dumb, you can click R to respawn immediately). God forbid it happens during a particularly difficult section that you have to repeat 10+ times by itself, and add to that half a minute long respawn section, and the swarm rooting you in place while two cubes push you into the wall and down the platform, and you have yourself a perfect recipe for what is cunningly concealed as a platforming puzzle game, but ends up being a rage-game experience comparable to the likes of Geting Over It.

Oh, and I may not have mentioned how the long, split-second perfect requiring sections with a minimum margin of error and a randomness factor from hostile mobs taking away your control need to be repeated all over and over and over again from the very beginning 7 platforms ago because the checkpoint system is really scarce in some of the most absurdly difficult sections in the game.

Another thing I have a problem with is how pixel-perfect the game sometimes wants you to be. It's really difficult to measure the exact size of your character in relation to the obstacles you're seeing. There are certain specific obstacles that especially infuriate me because of it, namely the ones in which you're required to dash through a tight gap between the red walls, and if you do it at a wrong time, a split second too soon or a split second later, you might either get your forehead vaporized, or your legs sliced off. Thing is, you're just a flying gun with no model to represent your body, so you can never really know how close you are to touching the red floor.

What the game often lacks is the clarity of what is happening with the introduction of the gravity field mechanics. In reality, the game has no floor, the platforms and enemies alike fly, and all the rotating mechanisms can appear on the floor as well as on walls and ceiling. And there are sections which require you to switch between multiple gravity fields pulling you in multiple directions, and you really lose the sense of which direction you're going to fall towards when you jump out of it. Granted, some sections are more clear about it than others, but for the most part they're really unintuitive.

I'd give this game a 6.5/10. Overall, the game itself is incredibly infuriating and sometimes quite confusing, it's very particular with its execution of certain sections, requires you to be way too perfect at times with a very low margin of error while introducing hostile enemies meant to break your run at the same time. However, overall I'd say the interesting and fresh mechanics through and through, as well as a freeform approach to clearing the level, not to mention the introduction of collectibles that actually reward the player for the effort of getting them, all in all provide an interesting, challenging, although sometimes clunky and even more often unfair, experience. The game would probably get an additional 0.5 or 1 score if it wasn't for the annoying enemies and/or if it were more clear about the fact that it's a rage game as much as it is a platformer.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

Beginning of the game was fun, but when the annoying blind jumping through gravity blocks that deactivate while being bombarded by un-killable enemies that knock you back when they re-activate, while randomly wandering around and not even resetting when you die. They just clutter everyting up and become an additional faux difficulty that was completely unnecessary. Will not be recommending the game because of this, but without the enemies, would have been an extremely enjoyable game to 100% and would for sure have recommended. Let me know if an option to remove the enemies will ever be added, then I will definitely play again.

The game is beautiful to look at and fast. But it is not a good game.

Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2016
If you like hard and frustrating games then this is the perfect game for you. Imagine a really tough minecraft parkour map with slow shooting turrets whose bullets just push you, laser walls, moving laser walls and flying cubes that can use a wave attack that simply pushes you. And that's just from what I've experienced in the short time I spent playing this game, I shutter thinking of what other obstacles they've added to the game. If you see this and like what you've read thus far then don't think, just buy!

3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 avril 2016
Mechanics are way too random at times and impossible to learn and repeat, so they require trial and error, a very bad design decision in a game focusing on speedrunning. When there is no chance to memorize and improve there is nothing left but to pray that the gods of RNG will look favorably upon you. Music is nice, and so are most of the game mechanics but the RNG makes it impossible to recommend.

Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2017
This game starts as being extremely fun and very nice to look at. Paired alongside some tight controls, difficult platforming, and a good soundtrack, I was really excited about what the game had to offer. However, soon the beautiful clear blue skies disappeared and were replaced with dull, dark skies and the platforming became a chore as they shifted from being fun, straightforward, and challenging but rewarding, to gimmicky gravity change mechanics that were at times confusing and always unfun. Also, while the activate gun is a nice touch, I kept trying to reload it by accident and then I'd hit the key mapped to teleport you back to your last checkpoint, an annoying inconvenience if you've just cleared a difficult section.

(\/)orphball
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2016
If you were born sometime in early 90's or a little earlier, you were propably a teenager when the best multiplayer shooters and thir modding scene lived their golden age. Before the age of DLCs, stripped of modding support, where games were accepted and loved "as is" and it was just that, instead of continous tracking of the developers on various forums, having all kinds of outragous postrelase changes and hated additions, mandatory microtransactions or always online forcing for no reason... those were the days.

DEADCORE, is definitly a game that time travelled ahead of it's age. It's simplistic, pure, does what it does as is from the (virtual) box and have this great retro feeling lingering in it's atmosphere, while it takes advantage of some modern features is a good way (such as steam workshop integrated so downloading player created content is easier than it was back then).

GAMEPLAY is rather simple - it's a speedrunner puzzle platformer, much like Portal, only without portals. The gameplay is fast, forgiving in a just comfortable time period to achieve the feeling of progress, just to throw in the good old ruthlessly precision demanding sections every now and then. You will fail, you will die, and you will retry over and over again because it's fast, engaging and fun down in it's core gameplay. Retrying takes less than a second and you'll never face a painfully long to skip game over screen, and this paired up with the excellent fluid gameplay, the surprisingly artistic abstract level design (it plays a more functional part in the whole, so a portal-like minimalistic thing would work great, but still it manages to show some jawdropping backgrounds), the sometimes logic, sometimes speed and skill, but usually both demanding gameplay makes DEADCORE a worthy challanger to Portal and similar games.

Two negatives here, sadly strenghtening each other: DEADCORE, has no story. I'm not saying this is bad, because it doesn't needs one. Or a coherent universe, or characters and any kind of conversation, it's pure perfect gameplay only. Still, that is likely the first thing that keeps it back from being more widely known and appriciated for what it does. Second thing, is actually the same as the first - motivation. When you are in the game, it's absolutely fantastic gameplay hooks you in - but when you finally quit, you'll never really have any motivation to launch it again the day after. I'm totally in love with speedrunner FPS mods for various oldschool multiplayer FPS games like Quakes etc. and DEADCORE is excellent at that, but as a singleplayer game it lacks the motivation multiplayer games offer with the presence of other players (online leaderboards aren't that motivating for many). The puzzles wouldn't have a place here then because you'd see others doing it so it's instantly solved, but it and also lacks the minimalistic interaction or feedback with/from... anything (like GLaDOS) and the lack of either is really leaving an empty space that isn't filled and it really feels.

If these aren't a problem for you and you are looking for a great modern game that gives away this retro skillful smart speedrunner vibe, look no futher.

DEADCORE, is for you.
 
David / Waveshaper
637 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2014
Mirrors Edge on crack. 10/10

Sorry, if you want an ACTUAL review, here.

When you are dropped in here, you are told two things. theres a tower. get to the top. got it? good. NOW GO.

The presentation in this game is done rather nicely. the suspence made be the enviorments and music is what drives you to reach the top. the constant lust to know WHY the hell you are here. gameplay is smooth, if you liked bunnyhop, quake, or practically anything fast, this game will satisfy you. The difficulty is just right, keepiing it challenging, but fun.

10/10

Caessens
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2021
The environment feels sticky, the player character feels slippery, jumping and double jumping is inconsistent, and the frame times get awful whenever an enemy is on screen. Standing on and jumping off moving objects is glitchy and weird. The horizontal dash ability has no horizon indicator and the game requires the player to navigate through extremely narrow vertical gaps, which means being slightly wrong up or down will result in death. Hit registration on the switches, fans, and launch pads is iffy and sometimes doesn't register that you activated/deactivated it. I'm sure the velocity of the projectile is an intentional mechanic, but it doesn't *feel good.* Many of the jumping puzzles don't reset to a consistent state on respawn. Many of them are easier to skip than to go through, despite the skips feeling glitchy and unintended. Some of them just require trial-and-error to find the safe spot to carefully squeeze between objects you can't avoid. The enemies also feel off and not very fun for many of the same reasons.

I feel like I should state that I usually like speedrun games and parkour games. This just isn't vibing with me at all.

It's like Kreedz Climbing Maps and Portal had a beautiful, dark dystopian cyber-baby. It's pretty unforgiving and doesn't last very long (story mode will take you between 2 and 4 hours, depending on skill). But man, it's a lot of fun. Speedrunners will have a blast. Highly recommended.
 
mortal

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2016
While I like the game's artstyle and I think checkpoints are well paced, some moments are very frustrating. Especially the gravity fields, I was so confused at one point that I had to resort to a walkthrough.

The shockwave drones (are they called Troopers?) are also very annoying, because they can still block your way even when deactivated. And the laser tunnels where you must dash through are quite strict.

Overall, it's a very hard platformer that does not suit everyone. I do not regret playing this game because of the sense of accomplishment it gave me, but I wouldn't recommend it either.

BasketCase
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2015
Great 3D platformer that encourages going as fast as possible. Some of the new abilities and techniques may seem overwhelming at first but stick to it, you'll figure it out quickly and it'll almost come as second nature. A lot of the jumps are skill based and require some quick thinkign and that's where this game shines. Flying through the air at high speeds avoiding all these obstacles gives you such a rush.

If you've played any mods or jump maps for classic FPS games like Half Life or Quake, you'll fit right into this game. The main story is only about 3 hours but you can really get a lot of value out of this game trying to climb the leaderboards for speed running time.
 
Frankie Spankie

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 septembre 2015
All right. So there is something I need to immediately put out here. This game isn't ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Portal, nor is it a "spiritual successor" by any regards. Those that say this are people who obviously haven't played the game or looked at the screenshots on the store page. This is a game that I can "recommend", but only for those that don't mind difficulty. If you're hoping to sit down and get through this game for the first time in one sitting, you are doing nothing but lying to yourself.

Now we got that out of the way, I can answer the question "so what is Deadcore?" Well, it is an FPS with heavy platforming elements that has a hard requirement for twitch-like reflexes. The art style of the game is very cyberpunkish and often makes me think of a "Tron meets Blade Runner" kind of thing. It looks amazing in motion, which is what you'll be spending most of the game doing. Yep. Moving. A lot. Most likely trying to dodge the rude obstacles that want to ruin your day.

Not really that much more to say about it. Other than it is a game meant to be speedran.

Good luck!
 
Sundae
394 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 aout 2023
I can see how speedrunners would enjoy this. But starting with level 4, this just became frustrating more than fun and the end of level 3 already was annoying enough. So, enough for me, certainly am not the target audience for this. If you're looking for high precision super speed platforming that you can learn and then just get better at over and over - sure, this is a great game for you. if you're someone who thought they'll be playing a puzzle platformer - this is not for you. This is much more timing / speed stuff than actually figuring out anything. the path is straight forward, it's all about execution.

Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2023
I decided to give this a shot, however with my PC hooked up to my TV I play pretty exclussively with a controller. Although there was no controller profile for the game in place, the default profile seemed to work quite nicely already. However, the game soon introduces fast paced shooting mechanics which don't really bode well on a controller without some form of aim assist. Of course, I don't expect the game to have aim assist as the game doesn't have controller support.

And that's my issue. The lack of controller support is what killed it for me, and even trying to improvise with Steam Input doesn't put the game into a particularly playable state with controller.

Quite challenging but also entertaining. I am far away from being a speedrunner - but even I mastered at least the first level (in about 1 hour after being shot, fell from the borders, jumped too far...). WASD, jump, double jump and dash are the game-meachanics. You have to activate and deactivate stuff.



Graphics are quite well optimized and fluid, story is as good as non-existent - but what do you expect from a game that exists to show off (or hide like me) and practice one´s keyboard´n´mouse skills...

0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2016
I got this game in a humble bundle so didn't pay full price.

DeadCore is a first person platformer that for me just didn't feel right. The game is supposedly made for speed-running but to me that didn't seem to be the case. In a game so heavily focused on precision jumping the fact that i couldn't jump precisely (no fault of my own) isn't very good. Whenever i moved or jumped everything felt badly put together and just had a general feeling of just not right-ness. The in-game world is rather nice i suppose but shadowed by it's poor controls. If you're into speed running then maybe pick this game up but otherwise i'd leave it be.

Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2016
I feel slightly conficted on this game. I like the visuals, controls and puzzle aspect of DeadCore, but I don't like the emphasis on trying to complete levels as fast as possible and flawlessly. It feels like if Portal 2 had less thinking involved, a ton more cognitive coordination required, and an emphasis on speeding through each level.

Something else rather critical to point out: there's not really a story from what I've seen so far. Basically there's nothing to motivate you to complete the game beyond just for the sake of beating it. The bare gameplay mechanics are not enough for me to keep coming back to complete it.

Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2016
1 very good and 1 very bad review:

Good - If you've played jumpmaps on Quake (or perhaps surf CS) and Portal you gonna LUV this!
The game "goes" as fast as you can manage it and I love that. There's a lot of side-jumping to find hidden items and you can also "glitch" a lot by jumping on edges. which actually makes the game more fun than feeling it's broken.

Bad - Only thing I can't talk well about are the requirements, they're off the wall. I'm running 6core 3.2 CPU, 6BG RAM and HD 5500 1GB. But I can only play this game on LOW and on the absolute LOWEST resolution which sucks b*lls. At least the game runs smooth then and it looks like it's 10 years old, but I dont mind that much.

Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2015
well, i havent played much, but im rally not impressed so far. the videos make it out to be a sort of fast paced hi flying game, but atleast for the first few levels, its a tedious tightrope walking simulator.
it all feels floaty and at the same time too sensitive. all too often youll find yourself jumping up into the air and spinning around 360 just looking for the next place to jump, or worse, you already know where to go but its just so tedious. artificially tedious, as well, by limiting the amount of ammo, whoops, you shot that turret twice? well now you must restart to get more ammo. because you need it to open doors.
one of the few games that i would definitly prefer playing on a controller. but it doesnt support them.
its a solid game i suppose, its just not fun. unles you LOVED the feeling of grinding in tony hawk, eternally, pass on it.
ive got other games for about 99 cents that had simlair gameplay and were more fun.

7.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2015
This is pretty much Dark Souls the fps platformer. I do not agree with people who bash this game due to difficulty, Yes its hard but thats why I have enjoyed it so much. The more difficult something is the better you feel after completing it. I don't want to just play easy Mario platformers all the time.

Every genre deserves a good hard challenges. There will always be multiplayer for challenges for normal FPSes and MOBAs. But games like platformers and RPGs need preset challenges due to the lack of multiplayer potential. Yes we need mario games and skyrim (compared to dark souls) for more causal players. and we also need games like Deadcore and Darksouls for more hardcore players. Deadcore is a great game if you are up to it, and I do not think that Deadcore should be critisized for its difficulty.

Also I think TB bashed this game for stability issues when this came out in early access, however I found no problems

Évaluation publiée le 12 avril 2015
For those with speed, precision and dexterity, I'd recommend you to check DeadCore out.

My first playthrough took more or less 6 months (not that I played the game every day, but still), and the second one about 9 hours on the same day I finished my first one. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that the levels do have variations so that you don't always have to follow one certain path to play through them.

Highly recommended!
 
Nikumubeki
266 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2015
Portal style, Unreal Tournament speed.

At 57 minutes of playtime I feel it's time for a "I know everything about anything" review.
DeadCore set's itself apart from Valve's aforementioned puzzle-platformer within the first few minutes of gameplay when it cranks the speed dial to 9, setting a frenetic pace that thankfully is still manageable without top of the line hardware and I-frame perfect movements. Challenges are simply designed, but punishingly brutal after the firsat dozen or so. Thankfully respawns are instant and checkpoints are beyond plentiful.
The game's visual design at first glance might seem too basic, but I really grooved on the shiny-black-shapes-tastefully-Tronlined-floating-in-an-endless-sea-of-clouds it has going on. HUD elements are all gathered neatly on your Switch Gun (does what it says), giving the player a clean view in a mannar similar to Dead Space. Story is told though text logs found thoughout the game, though they can easily be ignored if the player wishes to focus solely on gameplay, a thing I found refreshing.
Controls with mouse and keyboard were tight and responsive, air control is precise and predictable, a must for this type of game. Sound design is similarly simplistic but satisfying, with more subdued music that I enjoyed as it lends well from the experience without distracting from the gameplay. Puzzle design is very three-dimensional, always requireing the player to think "around" instead of "forward"

All in all an awesome Firstperson-Puzzle-platformer that get's right in the sweet spot for gamers wanting their constant adrenalin rush with zero downtime, add to that a solidly meshing theme of visuals, gameplay and music and you've got yourself a great experience. 8/10


♥♥♥♥
- No Controller support as of this review, some of those jumps I really felt uncomfortable with using WASD, really missed my stick then
- Cannot keymap to extra mouse buttons, Since I'm relegated to my five button mouse I tried to map the Dash command to one of the empty ones, no luck, it's stuck at E

Évaluation publiée le 1 aout 2022
Looks great, but overly difficult in irritating ways. The challenges are not particularly, puzzle-like; the difficulty is only in the reaction times needed to get through the fast moving environment. Constantly being reset at the last part of a challenge is frustrating. If this appeals, you'll enjoy.

If you prefer similar games with an emphasis on puzzle solving, play Portal or Talos Principle instead.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 mai 2016
I enjoy games with simple mechanics and an emphasis on speedrunning. But this game suffers from the same issues as Cloudbuilt in that it is far too complex. I only managed to get up to level 4 and I gave up half way through it because rather than offering lots of small simple levels, the levels are vast and complex and a nightmare to navigate. It is not easy (at least for me) to find which way to go as there are lots of paths. There are also far too many environmental death traps to navigate. By the time you get to level 4 it's no longer about being quick, but actually just getting through the game. Where Cloudbuilt fails because of its complex environments, extreme pace and many enemies, it at least manages to keep levels short and makes it clear that being fast is what's important. Deadcore, on the other hand, fails because it offers collectibles and long levels. The only thing that makes it remotely apparent that this is a speedrunning game is the timer on your weapon. I'm not sure if I misunderstood the game, but it seems to be that this is more of a "deathtrap navigation puzzle" game than one in which you are under time pressure; at least in the first run. The core mechanics are very promising, as is the general aesthetic and design. But it suffers from complexity which makes it difficult to enjoy and recommend.
 
nO_d3N1AL
143 produits enregistrés
0
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2018
This is a speedrunning game and nothing more. There is no story, youll get a few different abilities that you can use to speed run. There isnt any puzzles or dialougue to speak of. The athestics dont change ever which means you really better like black metal cubes and rectangles with some glowing blue bits that are placed high in the sky so that the devs dont have to actually design any kind of environment. The path forward looks the same as the path you just came from and all the random towers and will get confusing on more than one occasion.

If you are not into speed running, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!. If you are, then i guess youll like this?
 
Puddle
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2016
Absolutely amazing first person speed run precision platformer. The sense of speed, control and freedom you get when using your various powers is great.

Level design is amazing. There is a clear path you're supposed to take but you are at no point stopped by any kind of invisible wall. If you find a clever way to skip a section and shave off some seconds off your timer then more power to you.

Soundtrack is great. Artstyle is also beautiful and very fitting with the soundtrack. Performance is solid and game looks and feels great at 144FPS. Only downside I can think of, which is a minor nitpick on the visuals, is the lack of better AA. Since the artstyle is very geometric/TRON-line, there are a lot of straight lines which don't look as well as they could with some better AA.
 
Cyborg Pirate Ninja Jesus
580 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
This game is absolutley amazing, even from my 33 minutes of playing.

Music and visual style are superb. Multiple paths allows for lots of choice and eventual replayability.

Lots of opportunity to cut down time in levels. A story that isn't shoehorned in, collectibles and songs to boot!

For $9.99, this is well worth the price, whether you are a hardcore speedrunner or a casual puzzle platformer fan!

Non recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juin 2015
This is the kind of game which makes me wonder what the developers were thinking during its development.

"The player just beat 3 levels of enjoyable and well thought out puzzles, what can we do to challenge him in the last 2 levels?"
"How about endless trial & error passages without checkpoints?"
"YOU'RE PROMOTED!"

Yes, this game only has 5 levels. It took me about 2:45 hours to beat - 45 minutes for the first 3 levels, 2 hours for the final 2.

Starting at level 4 I became annoyed of the game, although it was somewhat enjoyable. Still, I'm not motivated at all to replay the game and get the collectibles I missed.
I haven't tried the speedrun mode yet, but it seems to have a lot of level segments as well as completely independent courses. Looks kinda promising.

I'm not sure if I should recommend this game, but I guess for the 2,49€ I spent on it it's worth giving a shot.

Update: Nope, speedruns are only the trial & error parts from the "story" levels. Don't recommend.

Évaluation publiée le 29 janvier 2017
Fun and fast first person jump and run. Difficult and sometimes frustrating but the excellent controls and the Tron like style keep you going.

There is a high replayability, because there are several routes to finish a level.
Recommended.^

I have to warn you about 2 issues:
1) The game is frustrating; the checkpoints are too far away from eachother.
2) They screwed up the rocketjump. It requires 100% precise timing and just doesn't work as
well as e.g. in Q3 Arena.

Non recommandé
38.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier 2016
I do have to praise the asthetics of this game. And the ending was kind of cool.

Now for the negatives (disclaimer: my computer is a few years old and is not a gaming PC)...

If you played Portal, and thought this would be more of that sort of fun (as I did), you should know that this game is not like Portal. In Portal, the levels were basically designed for you to succeed once you figure out the puzzles. In this game, there are more demands on the user to get the right timing, the proper precise movement/alignment, and to react quickly to everything around you. Also, in Portal, you would probably die a few times as you go through it, but your respawn checkpoint was always close so you didn't lose much progress. Not so here; completing a section requires a series of complex maneuvers where you can easily screw up one of the steps. I died a total of 1,034 times my first time through this game. So, if you enjoy a trial and error process where you constantly die, you may enjoy this.

I also found the game glitchy. Maybe it's the age of my machine, but there were many times the game would lag momentarily (consistently at the same places), and it affected the simulation enough that I wouldn't be able to complete my maneuver. Also, it seemed like sometimes my second jump wouldn't respond (and more rarely, even my first jump wouldn't respond). Also, the target areas seem very small, so you have to be extremely precise. Additionally, your gun projectiles seem like they're infinite speed (i.e., you have to click on exactly what you're trying to hit, not try to lead the target so that the projectile actually impacts the target when it reaches it on your screen).

All that to say, my experience was more aggravating than enjoyable. I hope yours is better.
 
macsforme

0.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2017
I'm going to leave this game a positive review because at the end of the day it's aa decent game. However I feel like it doesn't do what it was meant to do well if that makes any sort of sense. I went into this game expecting a parkour game with some puzzles as thats what was advertised. Not really the case. At certain points it honestly just felt like a platforming bullet hell. And a damn good one at that. But that's not what the game was meant to be. I'll probably get some grief for slapping the term bullet hell on it, but when I'm trying to shoot a robot, while dodging lasers, and immediately having to shoot a moving target while jumping over more lasers so more robots don't push me into other lasers you get the same hectic feeling of a bullet hell all while trying to be accurate. I dont necessarily think that's the point of the game and it's not what I was looking for but it's still an alright game. The world feels very alive with all sorts of moving parts and such. I felt like I often had different directions to go which made it feel less than linear which is always great to see. Worth a try if what I described sounds like your genre

Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
First day and 92 minutes into the game and I'm loving it! I'd definitely compare it to Portal 1 and 2, but without all the comedy relief... You learn what to do by making mistakes through trial and error, well that and exploring, using your common sense, and keeping your wits about you while doing more and more manuvers to get through the endless maze... The music goes from Sci-Fi ambient to Sci-Fi fast thrill/ action like. And with the beautiful 360 degrees views of endless sky to endless abyss, it will keep me engaged and immersed for sometime... I believe this will/ would have great replay value too... Definitely worth the $10.00 I paid for it on release day (Oct. 17th, 2014)!!! :) ♥ ^5

Non recommandé
0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2016
Okay, this is an unfair review.

Let this be a warning to unfortunate people, like myself, who grew up (and continue) to use game controllers for FPS games. I knew there was no controller support when I bought this game, but in the end, I just don't have the keyboard-mouse skill to advance very far in this game.

Maybe I'll be able to pull it off one day... until then: Controller FPSers, beware.

EDIT (in reply to helpfulness of this review):

There's no neutral review, and I'm disappointed that I cannot play this game, so it's a negative. I feel that "negative" reviews on games with an overall "positive" rating (this game, has an 86% Very Positive rating) are more instructive than the "positive" reviews. Potential buyers read reviews before they read the forums in most cases. The caveat of telling review readers my opinion treats the game in an "unfair" manner and describing why clarifies my review rating.

I'm not hating on the game, or giving a bad review out of buyer's spite. I suck at keyboard/mouse FPS controls and I wish there was controller support. Controller support is within the developer's control. I knew that going in there was no controller support, but I wasn't prepared for the high difficulty level of the FPS platforming.

The difficulty in the game design is perhaps another point to let people know about. I made it through "A Story About My Uncle" (another FPS platformer) without a controller just fine, and didn't think that it would be a problem for DeadCore. But it was a problem, and I couldn't enjoy this game. I was hoping my experience could help people to understand that.

1,525 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 octobre 2016
What a trip!
First things first: the look. This is a game with a unique atmosphere that emerges from the cool art style. When you stand high up in the sky, beneath you the hundreds of meters you have already overcome, between flying cubes and moving monolith formations and all of that infront of these epic cloud backgrounds - you feel like in a stylish sci-fi movie. You can tell: I really like the look of the game.

The Gamplay - I came, I saw, I failed
This is a great, challenging and fast paste platformer. I don`t get why some people complain about the diffculty. It is challenging, no doubt. But it is not frustrating by any means. The process goes usually like this: You arrive art a new checkpint. You scan the structure of the challenge in front of you. You try, you fail. After failing a few times you start to understand what you have to do to get pass that point and you think: "No way! No ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ way anyone can do this! But you try and you fail. Like a lot. BUT because you restart the second you "die" and and you will always know what you did wrong. There is a great level of fairness to this concept. You don`t get really punished when you die. Instead you get slightly better every single time. Because you get an inch, a beam a platform further than the last time. Because you have a lot of little successes in between, there is no frustration. And then the feeling, you have when you mastered a diffcult passage where you failed dozens of times! When you recognize the skill you developed while failing 5, 10, 30 or even 50 times - this is a good example of "easy to learn, hard to master". Failing. Getting better. Succeed. This is the very core of gaming. So to all of you who think this game is too hard, I have just one advice: get gud! ;)

0
Recommandé
41.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2023
パルクール系のアクションゲーム
この手のFPS視点のゲームって、視点だけFPSで銃を使わないで走り回る事のが多いけど
このゲームに限っては、エイムもある程度要求されるので人によっては辛いかも
後半になると空中制御中の狙撃や（酔う人が酔う！！）
画面が反転した状態でピンポイントの場所に狙撃しないといけない場面が出てくるので
それが楽しいと思えるか、辛いと思ってしまうかどうかで
このゲームの評価はだいぶ分かれる所かも
空間認識能力を向上させたい人にはおすすめの作品

追記：本編は何度も死んで、難しいけどリスタすぐできるから
トライアンドエラーでクリアできるって感じだったが
本編の収集要素解放（真エンド到達した頃にはアンロックされてるはず）した
SpeedRunModeっていう選ばれしもの専用のマゾモードがあるけど
後半はいわゆる判定がクソ狭いグリッチを使ったランがデフォみたいな
相当テクい技術を使わないと、開発者が想定した時間内にクリアすることがほぼ不可能になってくるため
操作性は比較的良いゲームではあるものの
CloudBuiltとかあの辺りの比較的カジュアルなゲームを期待してプレイすると
理不尽とも思えるぐらい恐ろしく難易度が高く感じたので
全実績解除とか完全制覇を目指すのは、相当難しい部類の作品だと思う
自分には無理そうなので諦めます…（げんなり）
見かけはパルクールゲーだけど、SuperMeatBoyみたいな
1ピクセル単位の操作調整とか好きな人にこそ向いてるゲームだと思う

stress/10
 
Jaiwoy
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2015
DeadCore is a first person platforming game. It has a futuristic setting and the whole game will throw you for a trip.

I don't think there is much in the way of story, just scattered words and logs across the game. Not really a big focus.

The main gameplay has you jumping and sprinting around. It starts our very simplistic but as they give you new mechanics things can start to become very challenging. I would highly recommend you don't play this game if you have some type of motion sickness as the gravity sections might be difficult to take. That said, the gameplay is very smooth, unique, and fun. Not many platform games give you this much freedom to move around with, and very rarely do you see first person platform games at all. The game has 6 or so levels, and took me about 3 and a half hours. The game also has collectibles you can find which would greatly add to the gametime, I personally didn't go for them. The game greatly encourages speedrunning, with leaderboards and even a speedrunning mode. Hell there's a clock on the Gun at all times. I can see how the mechanics could be creatively used by speedrunners to get through levels quickly. I'm usually pretty competent at platformers and even I had a lot of trouble in some sections so I would say this game could be pretty difficult for more casual players. It could do with more checkpoints in some sections.

The overall look and feel of the game is something to be admired. While it can be a little monotone at times, the emptiness and beauty of the levels isn't lost on me, and some of the crazy mechanics will surprise you. I feel the gravity mechanic will be either greatly loved or hated, depending on your perspective, but it is something to appreciate that you don't get to see much in a first person game.

The game also includes a weapon and enemies but this is either meant to be underutilized or just meant to give you more things to do. Enemies are just there to be shot once, to stop them for a moment, while you continue platforming. I feel it's unecessary.


Pros

-Solid/Smooth Gameplay
-Very Pretty Aesthetics
-Creative Unique Mechanics
-Speedrunner Support
-Challenging
-Interesting Level Design
-Collectibles!

♥♥♥♥

-Uninteresting/Lacking Story
-Might be too challenging or needs more checkpoints
-Somewhat short without looking for extras/speedrunning
-Droning Music
-Annoying Sound Effects (in some areas)
-Sometimes level design can be confusing
-Enemies and Weapon feel somewhat pointless

I liked DeadCore a lot. I feel that if it was a longer game there could be a lot more creative mechanics added instead of relying on the few ones the game has. It might not become your favorite game, but I would recommend everyone at least takes a look to appreciate what is being done here.


7.7/10
 
Remster
627 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout

It's better than watching paint dry, but your money is better spent elsewhere.

Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2020
J'étais vraiment tenté par ce jeu, j'y ai joué pendant 30 minutes: malheureusement je dois déjà y mettre une évaluation négative.

J'ai un écran 165Hz, le jeu tourne bien à 165 fps mais les mouvements sont "bridés" comme si on était en 60 fps et c'est très perturbant.

J'ai été bloqué par un casse tête dès le début du jeu avec lequel j'ai été tué une bonne vingtaine de fois et j'ai l'impression que je vais y passer une bonne heure de migraine sur le même casse tête et ça m'a rebuté...

Le jeu avait du bon potentiel mais malheureusement pas très bien mis en place... :/
 
Rysanlos

556 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2018
DeadCore ist ein verdammt schlechtes First Person Jump and Run Game mit kleinen Shooter Elementen.

Die Grafik ist aus meiner Sicht grotten schlecht. Also da gibt es schon einiges besseres. Immer die selben Texturen und alles sieht irgend wie so kantig aus. Also überhaupt keine Runden und schönen Texturen. Obwohl ich eigentlich nicht so viel wert lege auf Grafik, aber mein Gott mir taten nach einer Stunde die Augen weh.

Das Gameplay ja was soll man dazu sagen ist einfach nur verdammt schlecht. Hier und da mal bissel von Würfel zu Würfel springen, mit der Waffe einen Schalter abschießen und Fallen ausweichen. Das war es eigentlich schon. Das was mich an diesem Spiel mit am meisten gestört hat, die Steuerung und einfach diese unfairness in diesem Spiel. Es ist gewollt das der Spieler gefühlt 1000x stirbt und es irgend wann schafft. Ich habe es meistens immer nur aus Zufall hinbekommen nach meinem gefühlten 1000x Rage. Außerdem finde ich das die Steuerung einfach mal ausgesetzt hat. Man drückt springen und irgend wie passiert nichts. Es fühlt sich alles einfach schwammig und überhaupt nicht fertig an.

Aus meiner sicht ist DeadCore nicht mal im Sale sein Geld wert. Aufjedenfall die Finger von lassen!

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2017
Produit remboursé

我必须得说，这是一个相当惊艳的游戏！
尽管我玩了不到一个小时，就来写这篇测评，但它的确给我带来了前所未有的体验！
还记得，在玩蹦极、过山车那些极限项目时的心态吗？
“哦，千万不要掉下去了！ε＝ε＝ε＝(#>д<)ﾉ”
但与众不同的是，这个游戏留下了“怦然心动”或者是“小鹿乱撞”的心理体验，却让游戏的画面、音乐，特效等场景，替代了许多恐惧元素，而带来了前所未有的惊喜与怦动交加的体验
就好像，见goddes前：尽管知道或不知道 可能{一无所获}/{有戏}的情况下，却仍然带着喜悦与勇气去面对时的感动。
又或者，稀饭的女孩，就在旁边的感觉？
卧槽！这游戏还玩出了恋爱的味道？？喵？

嗯，想起来了，那个名词叫“忐忑”再加上”欢喜“，喵~

反正，17块钱绝逼值了，如果我之前玩过，卖7-80或者上百我都乐意。
真的是，前所未见的心理体验。重点是，这种体验居然在一个游戏上呈现了


妙哉！O(∩_∩)O~
 
猎菊志士

1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juin 2015
At first this game is kinda fun, notice the "kinda." Cause at about level 2 they start throwing suprises at you. In this game I like to go fast, but this game forces you to slow down if you dont know whats coming beforehand, And thats just flat out BAD DESIGN. you're meant to go fast in this game so why do you force me to stop to precision shoot some fan blade? WHY do I still get thrown back if I shoot an enemy watch it start to retreat back into it's shell of broken dreams, but then touch it a milisecond before the animation finishes? WHY DID YOU ADD AN UNNEEDED GRAVITY MECHANIC?! thats right, a gravity mechanic. you can tell by this point you're probably pretty close to the end of the game, so they added a CONFUSING, USELESS gravity power. I was struggling my way through this to see the end, but this is where I stopped. You're supposed to go through this gauntlet of reverse gravity platforms, an every time you jump into a new one they get harder, but you will NEVER reach the next one because you either: A. Jump to short and have to start ALL over. or B. the double jump flat out just doest work. It doesn't help that when you actually make it to the next platform you are IMMEDIATELY assaulted by lasers and turrets. so in short, this game gets really stupid real fast. play it if your blood pressure is too low.

Évaluation publiée le 18 juin 2020
Как говорил Кутрапали - да, но нет.
Игра несомненно привлекает внимание - она красивая, динамичная, заставляет мозг думать активнее, искать решения максимально быстро. Но в какой-то момент она превращается в квест "пройди-ка эту хардкорную задачку 100500 тысяч раз, чтобы наконец у тебя получилось пробраться через все лазеры с первого раза и без ошибок". А где наш респаун? А наш респаун ой как далеко. И ты понимаешь, что данный конкретный уровень - он просто insane. Тебе нужно стать буквально чемпионом, морским котиком, военным десантником, лучшим из лучших из лучших сэр, чтобы пройти все лазеры и засейвиться на новом респауне.
Хочу ли я играть в такую игру?
Однозначно не хочу.
Удачи всем морским котанам!

discoball
239 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2017
TL;DR : There is a reason mixing first person and platforming is generally considered a bad idea. You're too concentrated on what's in front of you to both be aware of your environment and see where you're jumping. It can work when it's a secondary aspect of the game or when every little detail has been balanced and polished to perfection. This is not the case here. After an hour, the game was uninstalled. I don't doubt new game mechanics are introduced later on, but I couln't put up with it any more. It just isn't fun.


Visually, while passable, it looks pretty bland. In a game where all the action takes place in the sky, the least you'd expect is a beautifully rendered skybox. Instead you get a static one, cheap medium-res clouds in-between, and no fancy light effects.

Looking at the screenshots, you could think this has some light elements from Magrunner, The Turing Test or Portal in it, but really this is a parkour game. As such, making every element of the environnment easy to "read" should have been a top priority. Yet, it felt esthetically uninspired and artificial to me, but more importantly, hard to read as everything looks so similar and dark.

Let's talk about physics a bit. See that moving platform or that giant rolling cylinder ? Well, you can jump on them, sure, but you'll stay in place while they slide or rotate beneath your feet, leaving you to fall to your death. In this world, friction and Newton's laws are seemingly optional.

The worst part though is performance. For a game like this, you'd expect, and really, NEED silky smooth framerate. Instead you get constant micro-stuttering, no matter which resolution or graphical setting you choose. Even at 60FPS, this feels like a 20FPS experience. After a few minutes, I was starting to get a light migraine.

Have a look at the discussions if you think this is just a case of bad luck on my part. This has nothing to do with bad drivers, and better hardware won't solve anything. That the devs themselves can't see and won't fix this is mind boggling. To add insult to injury, some random guy found a partial fix : https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/DeadCore#Stuttering
I say partial because while this makes the game playable, I still found that the game felt smoother when forcing 30FPS+Vsync in the options, which says a lot.

Maybe buy Deadcore on a sale if you're really into the speedrun aspect, otherwise I don't see the point.
 
Mario Rosso
1
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
34.3 h en tout

964 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 décembre 2016
Some may complain this game is all too frustrating. It can be, but that does not detract about how challenging and wonderful this game is. You need to time your jumps or you will fail multiple times, but that is the point. It isn't meant to be an easy game, but one where it provides a constant challenge.

The graphics are incredible to look at it too, and the audio effects are spot on. If you want a challenge for a low price, pick up this game. I bought it on sale for $2.49, and I can easily say it's provide more gameplay and fun then games worth $20.

And one thing I also say, if you get frustrated don't give up. And if you're a casual gamer, this game isn't for you. It is brutally challenging, but that is what I like.

This game is for one who has high levels of persistence and will never give up. If you are this person, again I recommend this game highly. If you do not have these attributes and prefer a casual game, this may not be for you.
 
giancarlo1985
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 octobre 2017
Even though the controls, overall, feel smooth, it's impossible to platform when you can't see your feet. Your fast movement speed, which is obviously there to increase the sense of flow, more often ruins the flow when you over-compensate on a jump and walk right off a ledge. The combat makes it even worse, as you're trying to move quickly to avoid being shot.
Also, the game is poorly optimized. I don't have the most powerful computer in the world, I'll admit, but it can run way more visually impressive games than this with no problem. Even at the literal lowest graphics settings, there's still a slight input lag on button presses, which makes the platforming even worse than it already is.
There are parts of this game that I like, such as the use of musical audio cues - as well as the sound design overall - and the unique visual aesthetic, but, unless you have a beefy computer and you like platforming in first person, I can't recommend this game.
 
Wülf Boi

You need to have perfect timing and precision else you're pretty much screwed.

Also I cant continue playing since im stuck with 3 of those knockback cubes in a room where I have to shoot 3 buttons to get to jump on a booster and guess what those cubes just ♥♥♥♥ on me everytime because they dont stay down for long after you shot them and even those buttons have a timer. Btw I made it on the booster ONCE and you know what happened? It didnt boost me high enough so I fell down with those freaking cubes again....

Don't get this game if you don't like giving it your all the WHOLE TIME!!!
I mean games are supposed to be fun and challenging right? However this game just ♥♥♥♥♥ on you with the difficulty.

Also I just got this game from Humbe Bundle so I basicly didn't have a choice since I wanted Dark Souls.

[Why did you play it then?]
Well I got it basicly for free with the bundle so I said: Why not try it out.

Graphics are ok but you know what they say
It's not about the graphics it's about the GAMEPLAY

Non recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 février 2016
Brilliant graphics and gameplay that's οrgasmically similar to the Metroid Prime series.
Has some very fun gravity-warping mechanics.
BUT: The main flaw for my tastes is the steep difficulty and the nature of the difficulty.
Basically: I just couldn't get the hang of the rocket-jumping mechanic when it was introduced, and I gave up at that stage.

Also there's zero story if that matters to you. "Will you be able to reveal the secrets that lie beneath this fog-ridden world?" No, because there are none. It's a tower of blocks. The blocks can be fun, but the game's description alluding to lore is deceptive.
 
Leonhard Euler

6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2019
Was gonna write a proper review but seeing as this game isn't even worth trying to finish past Level 4 with it's ridiculous design choices, the absurdly perfection demanding hit boxes for switches and the annoying pests that come in the form of flying robots and turrets serving no purpose other than ♥♥♥♥♥♥ with your aim...I think I'll pass on that, too.

For the record, my aim is pretty decent with FPS type games but when you can literally miss an object by ZERO PIXELS(yes, I have stood still in game and found this happening) it stands to reason that the devs themselves might either be missing some screws upstairs or they're just complete a.ssholes.

But I digress. I'm sure someone like Shroud would love this game.
 
RockyVega
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2018
Отвратительная игра. Понравились только первые уровни с гравитацией, все остальное кал. Начало слишком простое, конец слишком сложный. Вернее он не сложный, а дроченый. Ты 30 секунд прыгаешь до сложного места по каким-то даунским ловушкам, и каждый раз когда ты дохнешь на сложном, приходится ретраить. Особенно это вымораживает когда идет инверсия. Времени подумать вообще не дают, пропрыгал до следующего микрофрагмента и просто не видишь куда дальше идти и сразу хуякс, получи лазером, тормоз. Мобы тоже чисто для галочки и создают сложность исскуственно, иногда этот пидор встречает тебя прямо на джамп паде, а иногда его вообще нету.
Ещё очень радует сама механика передвижения. То тебе едва не хватило деша, то одного миллиметра из-за корявого дабл джампа, то ты попадаешь в гравитационную аномалию и крутишься вверх-вниз со скоростью 180об\мин. Эти постоянные недолетания и искуственное замедление темпа убивает весь "спидран".
А как я ахуел когда узнал что в игре снаряд летит куда быстрее чем мы видим, по этому вентиляторы для меня были адом.
Графон очень слабый. Скайбокс выглядит клево, но такое ощущение что это один большой костыль, особенно на последнем уровне. Анимация пушки полное говно, мододелы в л4д2 делают лучше.
Я хотел поиграть в эту игру ещё с 2015 года, тогда я даже скачал весь ОST и слушал его, в прицнипе слушаю до сих пор. Музыка в игре вообще не заходит, либо она как-то криво работает. Постоянно какой-то эмбиент, до ДнБ дело почти не доходит.

В общем я крайне разочарован в игре, не рекомендую никому
И умоляю, не сравнивайте эту игру с порталом и митбоем, это не нечто среднее, это куча кала.
 
Kookoorooza
368 produits enregistrés
0

Non recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2015
This game has challenges full of good ideas, unfortunately, the buggy physics allow you to make exploits OR make you lose a bit unfairly.

But let's get to the point, the levels clearly lack of signs, making most of the game a frustrating "die and retry" for hardcore gamers. Many times, I asked myself: "Where am I looking at? Is the exit this way? Where do I have to go? Am I stuck?".Furthermore, I think the team had to pay taxes on the checkpoints and the numbers of levels, since the checkpoints are very sparse and the levels soooooooo longs. I guess the developpers were not thinking that some people might enjoy a play of 30 mins.

No editor bundled with the game.

I wouldn't recomand that game until the points I mentioned are fixed, unless you are a huge fan of Shootmania platform.
 
MMz
758 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
13.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2018
Game was great until I ran into the unfixed patch at the generators, which closed the way back if you exit the game.
Thus stuck with no way to complete, and a lack of desire to frustratingly learn how rocketjump or fail 500 more times redoing a path I had already taken just so I could sit for 4 hours trying to do the bugged area all in one go so I could get back out.

I just unistalled and put the game into my crappy games folder to rot (right next to dragon age the game that never let me past the start screen, to actually enter the game. At least dead core was a lot better than that).

Were it not for the un-escapable generator bug. I would have actually recommended the game.

Works perfectly on Manjaro linux. Deadcore is just an all around excellent first person speedrunner, Sometimes the platform hitboxes can feel a bit too edgy making movement feel the slightest bit clunky but otherwise if you have even a slight interest in speedrunners or just first person platformers in general, this is a must buy.

Évaluation publiée le 12 décembre 2018
Produit remboursé

The mechanics in the game have potential, but the overall feeling of the game makes it hard to play.

The biggest problem with the game has to deal with a lack of information, leading to mistimed boosts and frustrating mistakes.

If you are looking for a fun platforming experience, play something like Cloudbuilt. This game feels too slippery and difficult due to the game being too tight for an FPS platformer.

Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2017
I wish I could love this game, I really do; there are so many good things to talk about with it. But the simple fact of the matter is that it runs like garbage. Even on a very high end rig, the constant framerate stuttering makes this game basically impossible for me to play without developing headaches. It has had this problem since launch, and considering that it hasn't been fixed after 3 years, it likely never will be. Cannot recommend, unfortunately.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier 2023
3D-platformers are already bad enough idea and with timer + shooting even worse. There are expections like Clustertruck and Running Fred, since they are more classic move-forward-runners, but this one is just meh. I would rather play any 2d one like Super Meat Boy Forever or Never Give Up, or even Cloudberry Kingdom.

Also note - just platforming and meeting timers should never be a whole gameplay, in projects like Tower of Guns 2 or Unreal Tournament 3 you also jump a lot, shoot and do it fast to win, but there is also GAMEPLAY, an actual one. You know, with builds, competition, progression. DeadCore feels more like show-off: "here, we can do 3D"!

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 septembre 2015
和传送门唯一的相之处就是主角都拿着不能杀人的枪
如果你喜欢玩i wanna 系列游戏的话，推荐这款游戏～
目前玩了三个章节，难度还可以，不过已经有鬼畜的兆头了
1.操作：需要适应主角位移的惯性和速度，刚进游戏的时候把握不好，最基本的跳台都不好跳，习惯之后其实有种飞起来的感觉233
2.游戏性：目前来看除了基础教学，后面很多地方有岔路，目测一周目是没法拿全收集要素的，主线故事就隐藏在收集到的文本中
3.游戏比较虐心不太适合操作不好的玩家，如果对自己的方向感和操作没有信心，你要有打不通的准备，另外这个游戏虽然主体考验跳台和方向控制～也需要射击的精准度，玩久了比较耗神，只有bgm没有语音剧情和cg略显单调
好想@散人＝。 ＝ 适合抖m的游戏～
 
Som's mobile
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2014
Basically it's like somebody started programming a Quake clone in Unity and gave up when they realized nobody in the team was up to programming enemies. So you're left with a very niche product - an obstacle-course-in-the-sky game with floaty jump mechanics, deliberately obfuscated introduction to new features, and some nice skyboxes. It's only a "Shooter" in the sense that you have a remote control to switch hazards and jump pads on or off temporarily, and probably some form of rocket jump, but the game feels so much like a student project painted over with pretty graphics that I couldn't see any appeal in getting invested.
 
daesuphrasis
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Évaluation publiée le 9 septembre 2021
DeadCore

=== ( 🎯 Difficulty ) ===
☐ No Difficulty
☐ Easy
☐ Standard
☐ Big Learning Curve
☑ Hard (Couldn't finish the final level)
☐ Impossible

=== ( 👪 Audience ) ===
☐ Everyone
☐ Kids
☑ Teens
☑ Adults
☐ Mature

=== ( 👀 Graphics ) ===
☐ What Is This?
☐ Bad
☐ Acceptable
☐ Good
☐ Great
☐ Stylistic
☑ Beautiful (Best thing about the game)
☐ Masterpiece

=== ( Sound/Music ) ===
☐ Bad
☐ Nothing Special
☑ Good
☐ Great
☐ Beautiful
☐ I´m Gonna Cry

=== ( 🌏 Story ) ===
☑ This Game Has No Story
☐ Nothing Special
☐ It´s Alright
☐ Well Written
☐ Epic Story
☐ Thinking About It, When I Sleep

=== ( Grinding ) ===
☐ Nothing To Grind
☐ Isn't Necessary To Progress
☑ Average Grind Level
☐ A Lot Of Grinding
☐ You‘ll Need A Second Life For Grinding

=== ( 💎 Price ) ===
☐ Free
☐ Underpriced
☑ Perfect Price
☐ Could Be Cheaper
☐ Overpriced

=== ( ☣ Requirments ) ===
☐ A Toaster Could Run This
☑ Low
☐ Average
☐ Above Average
☐ High End
☐ NASA Computer

=== ( ⏰ Game time/length ) ===
☐ Really short ( 0 - 4 hours)
☑ Short ( 4 - 12 hours)
☐ Average ( 12 - 24 hours)
☐ Long ( 24+ hours)
☐ Multiplayer/Neverending

=== ( 🐞 Bugs ) ===
☐ Game itself is a bug
☐ Lot of bugs
☑ Few Bugs (Character wouldn't jump on the odd occasion
☐ Nothing

=== ( Controller Support ) ===
☐ Yes
☑ no

=== ( Enjoyment ) ===
☐ I´d Rather Watch Grass Grow
☐ Hard To Enjoy
☐ Repetitive
☑ It's Okay
☐ Fun To Be Had For Sure
☐ The Kind Of Fun You Will Remember
☐ Life Changing

=== ( Replayability ) ===
☑ One-Time Experience
☐ Only For Achievements
☐ If You Wait A Few Months/Years
☐ Definitely
☐ Infinitely Replayable/Multiplayer

=== ( Worth Playing ) ===
☐ No
☐ Wait For A Sale
☑ Yes
☐ I Can´t Recommend It Enough

TOP FUN THINGS TO DO:
⭐️Solving a puzzle or getting to the right platform.
⭐️Sight seeing.

THE UNIQUES:
💎Brilliant visuals.

PLAYER GAMING REQUIREMENTS:
💼Platformer.
💼Sci-Fi.
💼Parkour.

VERDICT:
Deadcore gave me mixed feelings, the visuals are absolutely stunning, I would find ways to get into the perfect position just to see the amazing view but on the other side, I found the last 2 levels pretty grindy and ended up throwing in the towel on the final level due to a minor jumping bug and simply getting lost since you're not exactly shown what to do or where to go.

The game is insanely hard so i'd recommend taking your time and enjoying the view or else you'll end up frustrated and not enjoying the scenery as much. If you're a HUGE fan of puzzle/platforming games then you should enjoy this game immensely, if not... i'd suggest looking elsewhere.
Total Score = 57/100.

SIMILAR GAME LIKE THIS? / REVIEWER PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE:
Portal, Cyber Hook

GAMEPLAY:
Your objective is to climb a gigantic Tower: on your way to the top you will have to fight robots guarding the Tower but also to handle tricky platforming sequences, sometimes both simultaneously.

■■■■■□□□□□ 5 / 10
I'm impressed that this was made by a 5 man team.

RECOMMEDED SPECS:
OS: Windows 10
Processor: Intel i5 quad core / AMD FX-6200
Memory: 4 GB RAM
Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 660 / ATI Radeon HD 7850
Storage: 4 GB

Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2015
YUCK. I HATE this game. I hate first person platformers, and I especially hate heights! If you happen to like jumping from floating box to floating box in a first person view and aren't troubled by vertigo, then you may enjoy it. But I was constantly tensed up and gritting my teeth (NOT in a good way) and feeling like I was about to fall off my chair, and almost had a heart attack every time I missed my jumo and fell fown throughh the sky.

That being said, the visuals were beautiful, and if it were flat on the ground I would probably like it very much... but that would defeat the entire purpose of the game. I want to make it clear that my dislike of this game has nothing to do with any flaws in it, it is entirely due to very bad vertigo on my part and a hatred of platform jumping in a first person perspective.

I got this game included in a Humble Bundle, I didn't select to buy it for itself.

Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2014
Задумка вроде бы хороша, башня, восхождение, я обожаю высокие здания. Графика также вполне себе на уровне.

Но... геймплей в этой игре есть прямо-таки что-то неадекватное. А точнее, неадекватны как мне кажется её создатели, которые похоже плохо себе представляют скорость мысли и внимательность среднестатистического геймера и просто человека - здесь они делают рассчёт на каких-то мировых чемпионов или людей со сверъестественной скоростью реакции. Большинство же с такой скоростью просто на клавиши жать не умеет.

В общем, комфортной игры не ждите. Что вы точно приобретёте, поиграв в неё полтора часа - так это головную боль.

34 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 octobre 2014
Seems pretty cool - you race to the top of a mysterious tower by jumping from platform to platform using your reflexes and timing to get through various traps. The pace of which you jump from obstacle to obstacle got to the point where it could be pretty intense, but it was somewhat broken up but the laser tunnels that seemed to kill you no matter how dead in the center you were, or you'd get through them, and the last would melt you.

Then the gravity mod for your switch gun. Now it's a piss poor puzzle game with extremely disorienting camera flips each and every time you enter a purple field. The game's momentum simply stops when this happens. Now you must sit around at the same section wondering what the hell to do for several minutes at a stretch trying out several different things while the camera flips you around and ruins whatever plan you may have had. Then cubes and robot bugs fly after you and bounce you around to make it even more hilarious.

I can recommend this for the first big section before the gravity mod. But for me, it managed to stop the pacing of the game. I often asked "What am I doing?" as I would try to figure out a plan and then lose my spot when the camera changed. If the camera changed slower, and was more clear as to where you just came from, and what angle, it wouldn't be as much of an issue. But as it stands, I'm not entirely sure how that would work.

8/10 for the parts up until the gravity mod
5/10 after a while with the gravity mod
 
Spook Rooster
9
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

The graphics are nice in a minimalist way but still have some gloss.
The environment is unique and piques your curiosity for the first hour or so.

You only occassionally find the "secret" items that reveal what passes for a story making really large gaps in an already meager story and thus ruining any chance of actually engaging the character and motivating them to contunue the increasingly monotonous activity.
