0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 avril 2017
After trying this for several minutes and getting stuck on only the THIRD level in the game. I have to say that I simply cannot recommend this game to anyone that isn't a god.

#1 This is NOT a game for players with hundreds of hours of video game playing experience.

#2This is NOT a game for players with hundreds of houts of speedrunning experience.

#3 This IS a game for players that enjoy ridiculously hard challenges with the only true goal being to get the fastest time possible.

I Love speedrunning games, playing through games like Sonic Adventure, Jet Set Radio, Mario 64, Mirrors Edge, and more. Yet even I, with hundreds of hours of experience (See number 1) cannot even complete the THIRD level in this game. After a half an hour, I gave up.

What frustrates me the most isn't necessarily the concept, I was fully behind that. No, the biggest problem with this game is the way the game makes things challenging.

The hitbox on your character is too big and hitboxes on targets are too small and sometimes seem to simply not register. This problem is exagerated by the fact that you cannot see either your character or your drop shadow. Honestly, this game would be much better as an OTS-3PS (Over-The-Shoulder Third Person Shooter) where you could see your character and surroundings more clearly and could more accurately make positional judgements.

Also, just to elaborate on how this game's challenge compares to other games:

There are two types of challenge in video games. One of these is exemplified by Super Meat Boy, where the levels contain a myriad of obstacles and one hit kills you instantly. Yet, Its short bursts of challenge and creative design choices keep you engaged for hours. This is "Tough but Fair" which is what difficult video games SHOULD be.

The other type of challenge is exemplified right here in DeadCore, where challenges are thrown at you at a breakneck pace and you are expected to learn from what you did wrong and then do it again and again until you get it right. You are also relying incredibly too much on simply getting "cycles" or simply seemingly random variables. This is not "Tough but Fair" this is just "Difficult for the sake of Difficult."

If you want to play a better, faster, more fun version of DeadCore then go play Cloudbuilt. It's here on Steam and it is what this game wants to be, fun to play and fun to speedrun.
 
(GH) InTheGameKiah
0
16 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2014
Actually this is a nice game but I hate the fact that you can't change the controls the way you want. Like many games DeadCore uses the WASD-Controls. And yes you can change this, but actions that should be made with the mouse can't be with Keyboard controls and the other way around. As an old Quake-Player I don't like the typical WASD-Controls, where W is for walking forward. I would prefer to have this action on my right mouse-button. But that is not possible.

Also while this is a Jump&Run-Ego-Shooter where every millisecond counts and where precision is needed in order to play it, the player should have the option to use the keybinds he wants to use. The common WASD-Controls are not pretty precise and make this game nearly unplayable for me.

Sound and graphics are great for a game that uses the unity-engine. But since the developer doesn't give you the freedom to change the controls at your will I have to give a "thumbs down".
 
EVIL NEON
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2014
DeadCore 1.0 : Le Blast est Cheater et permetter de monter tout en haut d'une tour en spammant ! ( On Voller la Propulsion du Blast faisait tout le taff pour finir une map ! ) Se qui était dommage pour un Jeux SpeedRun ^^ !

Depuis la Mise a jour résente , DeadCore 1.1 : Le Blast n'a pu d'effet repoussant , donc maintenant on doit suivre la route enfin on peut racoursir la route grace au Blast et au Racoursi créer par les Devs ! Mais il y a toujour le Dash Bug qui permet sur les plateformes bancale de monter en hauteur avec vitesse ( on monte pas trés haut mais sa permet quand même de gagner pas mal de temp se Bug ou se Dash Voulu )

Les + :
- Graphisme Magnifique !
- Demande pas énormément de ressource pour un jeux sorti en fin 2014 !
- Le SpeedRun existe vraiment
- Les Niveaux sont vraiment "HardCore" ^^
- Succés fesable , pour les farmeurs de Succés ( a l'époque du Blast les succés étaits tout simplement trop facile ) maintenant il y a de la difficulter ^^ !
- Durée de vie du Jeux ! ( 19,7h pour juste finir le jeux et avoir tout les Succés , j'ai pas vraiment farmer les SpeedRun ) donc pour les amateurs de speedrun il y a quand même plus de 40h de jeux vue la difficulter du jeux !
- Dev a l'écoute de sa communoter sur le Forum Steam !!!!!
- Rapide a télécharger ( très léger ) , un petit Jeux qui change ^^ !


Les - :
- Bug Dash , qui vous permet de couper toute une hauteur c'est pas très beau sa !
- Blast qui a autant d'utiliter que un Tir simple maintenant ! ( et avant il était trop cheater ! Il n'y a pas encore de Juste Millieu ! )
- L'impossibiliter de voir les Replays des Joueurs SpeedRunner ( car défois il y a des temps fait mais on se demande comment ils ont fait se temp sur cette map , faudrai vraiment un system de Replay ou autre ! )

Très bon jeux a par quelque défault mais les Devellopeurs réagise ^^ ! ( Il vaut l'argement c'est 9,99€ )

GoatKuna
535 produits enregistrés
1
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
39.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2017
Haven't seen any platformer that's so lenient with letting you choose your own paths. To everyone saying the level design is counter intuitive and whatever, you clearly haven't played the game enough to see where you can and can't go. As soon as you get the "rocket" jump, you can basically skip major portions of every level as long as you know what you're doing.
The first runs are frustrating because you haven't understood you shouldn't be taking the path they put in front of you at all times.
The 1 hour "devtime" for the main levels from start to finish is rather misleading. There's most likely no way you'll beat that on your first run, as you don't know the levels and mechanics, but once you do, it becomes a joke that they set it so high.
Movements can take time to get used to, and the laser hitboxes are plain wrong for whatever reason(though the issue is probably with the character hitbox instead), but they can be skipped like 80% of the time anyway.
The game has a built in framerate cap, even if you disable vsync and everything, I'm pretty sure there's literally no way you'll get it to go past 45fps, even when the fps counter says otherwise. This was probably done because of how bugs with the physics, which are already bugged with the limited framerate.
The only issue with enemies, that can still be avoided with enough practice, comes up when they stay behind corners and push you off the map as soon as you turn them.
 
Gian800

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2017
This game is in my 'absolutely horrible' category.

Pro
- graphicaly is nice
- some good music

♥♥♥
- from the begining there is no tutorial and nothing is explained
- collectables are useless, who needs these ridiculous achievements
- some glitches where you get stuck
- you can avoid some areas completely by jumping high enough and dashing
- no quicksave, checkpoints are placed at places so the dev laughs at you replaying useless sections 10x time
- levels so hard that i thought this was made for asian level
- invincible enemy, and the player is a loser with a weapon with limited munition
- everything is in a rush, timed and cannot be reactivated
- you need to die just for munition to reset or reactivate puzzles
- double jump works when the game feels like it, cant run or duck either

3/10 rating

After dying 100x of useless deaths and getting to the gravity sections, i just said no,
this is a waste of time, repeating sections that i completed 10x times and still putting me back so far just because
they think it's funny or a "game mechanic", challenge or i don't know what, it's not a challenge to complete those sections just to die on the next another 10x so the total will amount to 100x, it's boring, also might point out the fact that not everyone is honest like me and will "fly" trough the level achieving the best times and be at the top ranking not so legit, what's then the point of rushing all the game.
I don't know just my opinion, playing for 20+ years, why should i buy another game from you guys, you actually anoyed me.

A fun FPS platformer. The level design isn't quite top notch and can be frustrating at times but the mechanics are interesting and it's satisfying to finally clear some of the more well designed parts. If Neon White was up your alley, this might be too. Get it on a sale if you're interested.
 
Iconoclass
248 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier
Neon White would be a high bar to reach, but this game struggles to be anything interesting. The vast emptiness makes it very hard to judge location for anything. The jumps are super shallow, requiring a ton of them just to handle some simple stairs. The red walls are very hard to judge against your hitbox because it's unclear where the rest of you is from your POV leading to many random deaths including some red walls that blindside you entirely. It might be that the game controls better when you have the full toolset, but I'm not willing to keep going through the uninspired levels to reach them all. The dash was already a major letdown. Secrets are similarly haphazardly placed, which takes out a lot of the joy of finding them, especially when the level prevents backtracking.

glooga
1,149 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2023
En étant un amateur des platformers a la première personne, celui ci est vachement tight, les timings sont serrés, les temps de réactions courts, et les checkpoints bienveillants (pour la plupart). Il faut garder en tête quand on achète ce jeu qu'il est TRES TRES court. Et qu'il est designé pour être speedrunné.

Il n'y a pas vraiment d'histoire mais l'esthétique futuriste est plutôt chouette. Avant de l'acheter, je vous recommanderai de jeter un coup d'oeil à "A story about my uncle" qui a une histoire, une progression plus fluide, et qui est un jeu bien plus polish je dirais.

Deadcore vaut quand même le coup, mais soyez certains de ce dans quoi vous vous aventurez.

Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2023
игра интересная, схожая с игрой Portal. Задумка такая же, загадки, прыжки. Но порой не можешь понять куда идти (сгораешь и сидишь на локации минут по 20), так как теряешься в пространстве, когда меняешь поле гравитации, то к стенке, то к потолку и надо успевать вертеть камерой, чтоб направление поймать для очередного прыжка. Есть иногда прохождение данной локации 2-мя способами, если ты заметишь его.
Жаль она короткая, часика 4 где то играется сюжет. Но есть спидран в игре (отдельные локации просто на скорость, не по сюжету)

I bought this like seven years ago and never beat it. I have... beat it... now...

honestly it was pretty easy, and if you are of a high skill level this game will probably take you a little more than an hour.
if thats the case, I encourage you to go for 100% and beat the devs' times on the additional levels. its a simple game made by about six people, but those guys had heart I'd like to believe. its kinda sick sometimes

is it worth 10 dollars? nah
is it worth 5 dollars? maybe
get it on sale

final time for story completion: 36:51

631 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2022
Overall fun game, but it will test your patience. The biggest problem of Deadcore is that you simply lack perspective when you are in first person: Environmental awareness is extremely important in Deadcore and only seeing what's in front of you makes it that much more difficult to know what's happening around you. You cannot Judge enemy distances and behavior/status behind you nor the status of moving objects, you easily misjudge jumps and laser-fence distances relatively to you (it often felt as if it was random whether i touched them or not). The one i didn't have a lot of problem with was the gravity-changing parts where your whole perspective also shifts along with the gravity mechanic but I'm pretty sure that it will be extremely confusing for a lot of people.
But apart from that, i think Deadcore is a fun platformer and the great thing about it is that you can learn to skip parts or make your own routes by learning the mechanics and understanding how maps work, i would almost describe it as a sandbox platformer where they give you a bunch of tools and up to you to complete the track, whether you follow the outlined path or us clever ways or going faster and around obstacles.
The difficulty steadily increases with a few peaks here and there but i was never stuck too long at one part.
I think the setting for the game is great, you are on floating blocks that all harbor around this impossible tower and you climb it all the way to the top and it is actually very encouraging because sometimes you look down and see all the progress you made in 5 minutes. The game looks overall visually pleasing and they really nailed the skybox, however, i think the basic blocks could have used some more variation in color and texture because it did feel like an asset-flip. The soundtrack is forgettable but the sound design is great, every action gets responded with a pleasing sound and it also helps to bring across the scale of the whole setting but I'm still unsure as to how there can be that much reverb in the sky lmao, because the sounds basically have no surface to bounce of off but that's an unimportant detail.

If you like platforming and fast gameplay, check this one out for sure, but expect to maybe get frustrated at some parts, but as i said, there are so many ways to go out of the ways of the annoying obstacles.
 
Dampfsalzig
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé

I think the main phrase for this game is "if you want to stop, just don't".
This game is a good game.
The thing is, this 50 fps limit is really REALLY annoying. Had to set up my GPU to 40 FPS + VSync 30 FPS ON.
Plus the hit box includes your body, which is pretty disturbing when you try to get through a rabbit whole.
Otherwise, everything is good if you hate your life and wanna yell at your screen.
One peace of advice: enjoy the moments when you know what you're doing. It might be difficult, but always remember "at some point the difficulty will be the least of my problems".
In fact, if you think you're good at video games, don't by this game.

Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2022
Incredibly fun, fast and addictive 3D platformer. An absolute adrenaline rush all throughout.

Controls feel fluid and responsive, once you get the hang of them, you'll be double-jumping, air-dashing, and "rocket"-jumping gracefully all over into infinity and beyond... all while dodging and shooting occasional enemies that try to push your off platforms.

Graphics and sound design are very good.

The only people I wouldn't recommend this game to are those who get easily frustrated by trial-and-error (is not that bad anyways), and those who suffer from motion-sickness, vertigo, or general disorientation (because you'll definitely die if you play this under those affections).

P A R K O R E
 
Radifax
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2022
7/10

Deadcore is a relatively short first person puzzle platformer where you make your way through the wreckage of a civilization and up a tower, finding out what happened to this civilization on your way up. I enjoy puzzle platformers, especially those that aren't at the most extreme end of the difficulty curve, and I was pretty happy with Deadcore, spending a few more hours to get all of the collectibles in the normal/story game mode (there is also a dedicated speedrunning mode) after spending about 8-10 hours on my initial playthrough. Deadcore incorporates a few different mechanics over the course of the game (double jumping, dashing, rocket jumping, changing gravity, etc.) and all of its mechanics really work smoothly and effectively, without feeling janky or particularly unclear - except, in my opinion, for the rocket jump. Fortunately, the rocket jump is the last ability you acquire and though I found it very finicky to use, it can also be almost entirely ignored, unless you're trying to do some serious speedrunning/skipping. While I personally enjoyed the gravity-changing mechanic and don't mind my perspective flipping around as I go from moving sideways to falling upwards to going back to falling downwards, if you are susceptible to motion sickness, its worth noting that this is something that you really can't get around within this game.

Deadcore's puzzles are approachable (and sometimes with a bit of creativity, skippable) and eminently solvable, without really forcing the player to consult a walkthrough to figure out an obscure solution. In fact, on the two occasions where I checked a walkthrough, I usually found out that either A) I was using the right solution, but executing poorly, or B) was overlooking a simpler solution. The gating of progression through collectibles works really effectively, and the game's stages are short enough that its not really frustrating to go back and try a new path through a level to get other collectibles. These are areas where these types of games can easily come up short, but I was really impressed with how well Deadcore was built in this regard. The game's story is solid and I like the way its presented, being entirely skippable if you like, or you can opt into it by collecting "Logs" which illuminate a bit of what happened before you came through these ruins. The story is coherent with the game's world at large, and in combination with the music, there's a sort of dark and mysterious intensity to your adventure through the remains of this world, without being overly so. This was very much a game where time quickly disappeared without notice as I was working my way through difficult platforming sequences, and I really enjoyed it overall. There is certainly room for the game to be improved, but what is here is a really good effort by 5 Bit Games that makes me excited to see what else they could give us. If you enjoy puzzle platforming and don't have motion sensitivity issues from perspective changes in first person, I'm sure you'll enjoy Deadcore quite a bit.
 
Hasekbowstome

Évaluation publiée le 2 mars 2022
Stroy

通关用时：2:53:03
极佳的风景√
作为玩完二创再回来玩原作(死核本核)来说体验很棒
推荐打折的时候入

再说说难度，我看评测里大部分人都觉得“难度中上”，但我不这么认为，我没有什么跑酷游戏基础，在我看来本作的难度主要分为这几方面
1.路线 容易路痴 耽搁时间
2.有些点流程较长 难度较高 存档点较少
3. 反重力区域对晕3D的人不友好（我刚开始也有点晕晕的）
还有非常shabi的NPC啊啊啊啊给爷死
(我觉得最难的就是这NPC/doge1 太烦了)

但其实，真的不会很难(前提是你不晕3D)
再分享一下我是怎么逃课的吧
1.地图的建模实体都能踩(红色的不行 烫脚) 很多时候可以配合NPC或者二段跳来偷鸡
2.如果你熟悉起源引擎并且有练习过KZ/bhop 那么你上手起来会非常非常非常舒服
3.常用R回档 本作大部分情况是可以无脑冲的 停顿下来反而不好容易过 当然 我说的无脑冲 不是指不看路 而是一口气冲过去

由于我是一周目，并且没有看任何教程，所以收集是随缘的，考虑二周目收集100%

目前的收集进度：
Sparks 4/10
Logs 8/20
Tracks 3/20

Skills:
SwitchGun Dash G-Mod Blast
Ammo+ Gauge+ √Rocket jump+
Ammo++ √Refill+
Ammo+++

技能方面我不知道为啥就解锁了俩个 ？？？？
¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿
二周目再说吧
-------------------------------------------------------------------
二周目
通关时长：2:15:38
Sparks 4/10
Logs 11/20(+3)
Tracks 8/20(+5)

技能无增加
——————————————————————-
三周目
00:40:56
在开始三周目之前 我已经提前做好了全收集 所以三周目解锁的是true end
技能拾取了一个ammo++

游玩了speedrun
正在做成就，目前剩下Inner Power和5 Bros未完成
——————————————————————————

The game is a stuttering mess, even with 3k$ pc. Playable but not perfect.

Originally I left a negative review on this game for that reason. But then, immediately after I wrote my review, I randomly decided to play the entire game and finish it in 4 hours. Worth it.

I would say that it's definitely for the hardcore audience, it wasn't easy. By the end it felt like I achieved some thing truly great, like climbing to the peak of Mount Everest .

Felt about the same when I finished a game called "Celeste", if you liked that game or games like it and you are up for the challenge, try this one.
 
Duvdev
271 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2021
乍一看画面很过时，但游玩的时候会发现画面其实并不那么影响体验，甚至越看越顺眼。他没有明显过低分辨率贴图，光效做得也有模有样，可以说在日厂相当良心了。

前两关游戏体验非常好，基本一遍过，卡关也没有很令人沮丧，但也能感到难度循序渐进。到了第三关的大概是第三个dash走廊死活过不去了，这里本应该dash两次过，结果不知为什么第二个dash怎么也发不出来。反复sl好多次没有任何进展，没来也没什么emotion attach，就直接删了。看评测后面可能会更难，也算是逃了一劫。

感觉这里并不是什么操作问题，也不应该是故意设计的难，只是和某种机制共振使得dash失效了，属于设计之外的糟糕体验了。

平心而论这里打差评是非常不客观的，但是鉴于如果没有遇到这个我就肯定打好评，也就没什么偏颇了。


-----------------------------
因为没什么好设备，就单独分了一个组叫gog，包含了本作。结果发现了一堆以前玩过印象不好的游戏居然不差，也包含了本作。

那时候真是蠢，我现在回来都发现了dash要充能。简单sl了几次就把之前卡关的地方给过了。

当时也可能是在玩黑魂吧？应该不是，黑魂的时候六亲不认。反正就是好日子过久了挑三拣四。

改成好评的原因是，这不比ghost runner燃？

---------------------------

真是太好玩了。真是太好玩的前提是，ce内存加速0.5倍，享受太空失重的感觉。

所以说这个跟幽灵行者是一类游戏，或者说具象化的卡点玩法。对我个人来说这个不好练，也没什么意义。这一关过了，下一关继续坐牢，甚至让你重新过一遍上一关还是坐牢。

太空漫步就不一样了，太空漫步即使不是一遍过也能在耐心合理的范围内过，而且给你进度的满足感/正反馈，让你越玩越想玩。

最近下了好几个gog里的感觉玩法很不错的游戏，都很喜欢。总算有起床充满期待的感觉了，就像过年一样。现在还真是在过年。

----------------------------

这个游戏很奇怪，你玩的时候爽得不行，没通关放下来的时候也百爪挠心，但是通关了就寸止，一点都不拖泥带水。

大约是因为游戏体验介于折磨和爽快之间吧。即使太空漫步了也还是会烦躁，不仅因为开挂了还是有一定难度，还因为流程实在是太长了。

结尾被恶心到了，进了光就没法继续探索了，眼前一圈明明有失重机制没去看也只能视频通关了。这显然应该做成独立的最终关。

不过也无所谓，没什么内容。结尾没看懂，查了一下成就还有真结局，全收集，视频，视频看一下还是没看懂。无所谓，这个游戏享受的是过程。

就是完全没有任何留恋，同时也没什么怨言，明明玩的时候那么狂热，这可太奇怪了。

接下来用我的ce大法通关一下altf4和之前那个地狱跑酷XD
 
Maborosi

JulysFire
882 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2021
AGDQ, here I come!
I've played movement based FPS games for some time now, but I think that Deadcore is exceptionally good at making you feel like you're good at the game. The controls are responsive, deaths feel entirely your own fault, and the levels are challenging without being overly frustrating.

It handles well, while looking visually appealing without dropping frames. The cybernetic environment is visually striking, and I often found myself glancing up at the leviathan tower I was climbing, the distant summit slowly drawing nearer.

It's worth mentioning that there were a couple of negatives, namely:

1. It's pretty short, and only took a few hours to complete on my first run-through, and this is factoring in the detours that I took to find collectibles.

2. The gravity mechanics that were introduced later into the game were initially novel, but ended up just being a bit clunky and disorientating.

Either way, this game is definitely worth picking up. It's an enjoyable - if brief - adventure through a unique setting.

7/10
 
Dr. Adam
787 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2021
DeadCore is a fast paced first person platformer with puzzle and a few shooter elements. It's got a nice although simple cybernetic aesthetic and it's not overly long.

Would I recommend the game? That's... kind of a difficult question to answer. I guess it depends on how much you want out of the game and how much patience you have. If you only want to play through the game once (casually) then yeah, the game is a nice experience and worth taking a look at for its unique elements alone. However, if you want to speedrun or otherwise spend a considerable amount of time with the game, you need to know that its mechanics and level design can be pretty janky. This jankiness can present itself as launch pads that launch you at half the force they're supposed to, or moving stage elements of whose unknown position can decide whether you live or die, etc.

The game implements surprisingly little elements (mechanics, enemies, traps) but presents them in varied and creative combinations. It also features a pretty open level design which can often break the level's progression, such that you can skip huge portions of the level if you find these shortcuts. I'm pretty sure these shortcuts are intentional, and they encourage revisiting levels in case you want to set better times or find alternate ways to finish them. What the game does lack a bit is story. Essentially all story is presented through text logs, many of which you have to go out of your way to find throughout levels. You can finish the game with minimal knowledge of the story, but it is there for those that want it. The music is fine; I wasn't personally blown away by it but I liked it well enough. The visuals can get pretty repetitive at times, due to most of the environment being built out of the same assets but in slightly different configurations.

Getting all achievements is very doable and will only require a bit of time. The hardest one is probably finishing the entire game in one go in under an hour. This sounds pretty tough, but after playing through the game normally, you'll likely have enough skills to pull it off. On my first speedrun attempt I finished the game in a little over 40 minutes, and that's with several huge mistakes/deaths.
 
Pwnage Block
3,152 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juillet 2021
因为比较喜欢这样的科幻感，于是入手了。
可实在太难了！！！

Aruhito
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2021
High-Octane, quick paced, platformer. The environments are starkly beautiful, the action is sharp, precise, and pinpoint in approach, and the controls feel great.

The story plays second fiddle to the game's primary imperative of precise, accurate, high-ropes platforming and navigation in the truly magnificent and ethereal landscapes that the creator(s) have crafted for the player. In all fairness it might be a disservice to label the structures that the player soars through as, "landscapes," as the only thing terrestrial about the entire experience is that the planet sits below you engulfed in storms.

I strongly recommend this game, solid worthwhile experience with more replayability than most mainstream titles.
 
MilesFallt

Évaluation publiée le 23 juin 2021
This is probably one of my favorite FPS platformers. It's surprisingly open in the routing you can do, and the surrealistic/abstract world settings I think makes for some particularly enjoyable level design. I don't think this game will cause you to like the genre if you were hesitant on it in the past, but if you like these style of games you won't go wrong here!

ShaK'hamas
362 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 mai 2021
Not without its downsides, a good game aimed at speedrunners and veterans more than casuals and beginners. Simple lore wise, it's a constant challenge that consists in solving multiple puzzles at the fastest pace possible, without losing control of the situation even when the entire map starts rotating around yourself. It gets old pretty quickly, but thanks to stunning backgrounds it can offers quite the sight. My biggest complaint doesn't come from the lack of checkpoints in the final zones, like many say, but rather from the cube NPCs. They're exponentially annoying, and their sheer numbers IS NOT something that adds to the challenge, but rather something that makes the game's last stages superbly annoying.
 
Mr Quasar
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

31.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2021
Focus, determination, precision, timing... these are the skills you hone as you play Deadcore. An absolute must and a bargain at the price. I can't think of a more polished 3D platformer, maybe Ghostrunner in that frenetic action sense. I felt really in the zone playing this, even when working hard to pull a series of moves together to beat an area. This made for brilliant feelings of elation when success was achieved, and winning over the game was a very memorable achievement for me. LOVED THIS GAME. A+

Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2021
Really good and very demanding, but you have to be into these sorts of games naturally; if to enjoy them.

This is not Kovaak's aim trainer or Desync, this is not Speed Runners from Hell, the closest title would be Impulsion, and DeadCore is different and broader in many ways.

The Style of the game was very striking as well, for something that is bland by default it really has some very strong scenic moments that leave quite a breath taking impression.

Évaluation publiée le 8 novembre 2020
Покупал в 2016 году,пишу обзор только сегодня (я ее только что прошел). Эта игра заняла 1 место на моем ПК по количеству удаления-скачивания (нервы дороже), это наверное одна из самых трудных игр за последние 10 лет, Последний уровень это сущий АД, если бы дали на выбор пройти Portal 1-2 с перевернутым монитором или Dead Core с нормальным монитором,я бы выбрал Portal. Несмотря на directx9 картинка дает фору многим современным играм,а музыка в стиле Drum & Bass еще больше украшает игру. Скажу одно,на второй раз проходить уж точно не стану, достижение Store Complete за полное прохождение есть только у 12% игроков (на момент написания обзора). Вообщем название игры говорит само за себя, дерзайте) слабонервным не рекомендую.

dietrichdoh
283 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mai 2020
死に覚えパズルアクションですね
箱コンでは感度を上げても下げても照準あわせが全く上手くいかないので
開き直って敵を片っ端から避けて857回死にながら進みました

5ステージあり、難易度がどんどん上がっていくので最初の楽さで舐めていると地獄を見ます
初見クリアタイムがそれぞれ20分→30分→1時間→2.5時間→4時間で後半がキツかった

特定エリアで重力の方向を変えるフィールド発生装置が登場しますが、多分これが3D酔いする人にはやばい
スイッチを入れてフィールドに突入すると柱に立てるよう視点が90度回転します
フィールドから出るとまた90度回転して元の視点に
つまり地上→柱→柱って飛び移ろうとすると
地上→(90度回転)→柱→(中間は通常空間なので90度回転)→(柱が近くなるとまた90度回転)→柱
自分は混乱するだけで済みましたが、視点の回り方がえげつない上に多用されるので三半規管に自信がないとやめておいたほうがいいです

銃もギミック稼働用で、敵に撃っても3秒程度行動不能にするだけなので武器じゃありませんし倒せません
障害物競走なのでFPSっぽいのは見た目だけなのも注意です
クリアした後に二度とやるかク〇ッタレ！と叫びましたが、アイテム取り残しが大量にあるので多分また走ります、オススメ
 
0syake
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.3 h en tout

Good game, good graphics, good gameplay, good story, a bit short, but the fact it supports Linux overrides any disadvantage.

SamodjyKemaz
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2020
Very satisfying game. It was neither too difficult or too easy. At most, I had to redo a given checkpoint section maybe 20 times, but considering the span of time it takes to get from one section to the next skillfully this likely took up to 5 minutes or so at any given section. Luckily, these sections were scattered about and they would not put a difficult section back to back. The most difficult section, which was an outlier, is on the last level, the 5th, where 3 platforming 'towers' (there is really only the one main one, but they are summits in themselves) must be reached at the top to activate an individual laser from each to a central location. There is one 'tower' in particular where a checkpoint is far from its predecessor, and I likely spent 20 minutes on that one. Each individual obstacle however is easy enough on its own, there may be a trick to the timing and spacing of abilities, but as a whole they conglomerate make a very quick, enjoyable parkour game.

The game, as others have said, will take at least 3 and at most 6 hrs to complete, I came around in the middle with about 4h 30 in-game. There are no unfair mechanics insofar as a regular play-through concerns. I have read that some had issues with the anti-grav levels but I personally found them easier than the rest of the platforming. I purchased this game on sale for $2.75 CAD and this is one of the best cheap games I have purchased, hence the reason in writing my second review.

The game itself is beautiful. It is always mesmerizing to look at the clouds and exterior environment, it has an otherworldly effect. It is like looking at renaissance murals.

TL;DR DeadCore is a high speed, enjoyable yet challenging, visually appealing game with a difficulty that is just right.
 
Doctor Memehattan

19.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 avril 2020
This game has such great control, and allows you to do the dumbest things. You can jump around the level almost however you want, and there's tons of ways to do it. Do the obstacle proper, jump over, under, off to the side, or maybe to the top of it to blast yourself through a huge chunk of level.

The freedom, and mobility allowed is insane. It's one of my favorite platformers, and it's because it allows for so many paths, by it or yourself. No solution is final, and there's very few limits to what you can do.

Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2020
I can see what the developers were trying to do with this game as there are several exhilarating moments moving through the levels. Then the fun stops as there are countless amounts of cheap frustrating deaths that stop all your flow in its tracks.

Some of the most frustrating enemies that you aren't equipped enough to deal with because you can't kill them only deactivate them for literally 1 second or less, then they are right back on you ready to make you extremely angry.

maybe it's just me but beating all the dev times is an act of madness I had enough of the game after playing each level once and getting frustrated.

Not recommended.

冷门神作，几年前玩一半的游戏，重新捡起来通关玩依旧觉得十分有趣。无论是氛围，音效，分散式隐晦剧情还是关卡设计都很出色。在尝试中去思考，去探索，整体难度对于手残党可能偏高，但难度层次设置十分合理，很有挑战性。相比现在很多游戏溢出的浮躁下，只能说这才是游戏。平台跑酷类10/10

Évaluation publiée le 8 février 2020
If you're a FPS fan......if you pride yourself on precision and fast reflexes.....If you enjoy looking ahead and wondering how the hell you are going to get to your destination...but you know all the tools are in your hands. Then you will love this game. It's hard at times, but that makes it much more attractive. It also brings with it a sense of freedom in what feels to be open world even though it's a linear game. It's a nice balance. I haven't played it for over a year after completing it, but I felt it deserved my upvote after just seeing it still in my library.

Aun siendo un juego que ya tiene 6 años, sigue siendo una pasada, tiene una movilidad y control del jugador pasmosa y muy divertido de jugar, los puzles son interesantes y el parkour muy bien diseñado, tiene cosas que puedes romper (saltar desde no se debe o subirte a sitios que no deberias) pero encaja muy bien ♥♥♥ el juego y el 90% de esos casos llevan a easter eggs o coleccionables, asique:
Si te gusta el plataformeo/parkour: RECOMENDADO.
Si te gusta explorar: RECOMENDADO.
Si te gustan los juegos que te retan a ser mejor, y a superarte, no se porque aun no lo has juagado.

Lo compre cuando costaba 20 euros y los vale completamente, ahora esta a 10 euros, hecharle un vistazo los vale completamente.

Fruit Salad
257 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2020
Ignoring the secrets, the game is a fun 2-hour jumping and shooting experience. I naturally found 15 secrets and could probably go back and find the missing 35 secrets but with the game having the same futuristic look for all 5 levels with no variation, it just doesn't feel satisfying finding them with how similar the levels all feel. The gravity sections are pretty disorientating. I didn't find myself being slowed down by them due to playing games of this nature before, but I can see how would confuse newer players. They feel really nice to get through quickly however and really give you the feeling of being a gravity-bending parkour master.

The amount of ammo the gun has is fine for most of the game but you start to feel starved for ammo once you get the Charge Blast, although I should mention that there are ammunition upgrades hidden somewhere in the game that I didn't find so you might have a different experience compared to mine. The game is beatable without ammo upgrades as most enemies just try to bump you off the stage but can be avoided instead of disabled with the switch gun in order to save ammo. There might be a bonus ending if you collect everything since the final level ended with the press of a button and everything falling apart with the game hinting at the fact that I missed a couple of things.

Overall, a good purchase if you want a fun first-person platformer. Quick enough to speed through and has some things to hold you for a couple more hours. The level design could use some variety to make finding secrets and exploring a bit more fun but it's pretty difficult to change up the setting when the game is centered around sky towers and robots
 
Mahko
867 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2020
Celles et ceux qui recherchent un jeu du type "SuperMeatBoy mais en FPS" peuvent se jeter corps et âme dans Deadcore. Le jeu est bien conçu, l'expérience très difficile, la direction artistique inspirée et lisible, le contrôle du personnage principal réussi : les amateurs de speedruns et de défis ardus seront ravis. D'autant plus que le level design et les pouvoirs du personnage permettent de vraiment naviguer à sa guise dans l'environnement et de créer ses propres chemins vers la fin de chaque niveau.

En ce qui me concerne, bien qu'appréciant des titres comme Celeste, l'ajout de la 3ième dimension associée à des changements de gravité et des passages labyrinthiques dans la seconde moitié du jeu m'ont frustré plus qu'amusé. Pas de la faute du jeu en lui-même, même si j'aurais aimé que certains checkpoints soient moins éloignés les uns des autres, ou que le positionnement des ennemis soit moins aléatoire. Pour moi, ce fut une succession de "try hard pendant 10min pour 1 seconde de satisfaction".

Je recommande donc ce jeu malgré tout, pour les joueurs expérimentés qui savent à quoi s'attendre. Pour les autres qui sont, comme moi, rebutés par les jeux focalisés sur le "défi pur" et la "difficulté" : passez votre chemin. Pour ma part, je ne toucherai plus au jeu, même pour débloquer la "vraie fin", la fin normale me suffit amplement.
 
lecasualgamer

Solid controls, interesting setting. Lots of depth to the movement which advances with your skill. Lots of fun to explore the levels and find new ways to beat them.

flamingfejjery
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 décembre 2019
I got this game in a bundle from Bandai Namco which I mostly purchased for another game. It's made the bundle worth the price I paid in spite of my strong distaste for that other game.

Pros
  • Solid first-person platforming. Reminds me a bit of Quake 3 jump maps without the bunny hopping.
  • Lots of alternate routing seems to be available, with no invisible walls to get in your way.
  • Seems like it would be fun to go fast in, though I'm not a speedrunner and haven't watched the current record runs.
  • Flawless native Linux client (I use arch btw.)

♥♥♥♥
  • The player's aerial hitbox feels quite weird when jumping through laser windows - your entire body is lower than the camera would suggest. This is especially noticeable once you get the dash.
  • FoV caps at 90, which gives me headaches after a couple hours. 110-115 would be better. Note that this is a problem with a majority of other current first person games as well, but older shooters tended to provide higher FoV caps and / or allow the player to change it via a console.

tl;dr: Gameplay is fun; recommended.
 
Em ・∀・

NoMoreMind
337 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 septembre 2019
This game is pretty amazing! It's a strategic, puzzle, platformer and its centered on this largely scaled tower climb as shown in the image. I'm still in the early hours of trying it out so I haven't quite discovered it all, but if you like platforming and puzzles, this game is a must for you. The music is better than I expected, and the graphics, well they're nothing to get overly excited about, but they did great with what they had. The mix of lightning, wind, varying clouds, color and the like have an interesting appeal, and are a nice touch for the backdrop. The levels start out easy and progressively get more challenging. The level layout and design is very capturing. There are checkpoints scattered all throughout the courses, and each one is timed. Obstacles vary from pitfalls, to lasers, turrets, robots, and gravity vortexes. Overall this game seems very entertaining thus far for the simplicity of it. Very pleased with my purchase.

6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 juillet 2019
Das Spiel war schon extrem schwer. Doch wenn man den nächsten Checkpoint erreicht hat, fühlt man sich um so einiges glücklicher. An vielen Stellen denkt man, dass diese nicht lösbar wären, doch desto öfter man Fehler macht, desto besser wird es. Ich habe kurz und knapp 6 Stunden gebraucht bis ich es an die Spitze geschafft habe. Klar ist das lang aber sehr viele Gebiete scheinen wirklich unlösbar, bis man sie halt mehrere Male ausprobiert hat. Was das Spiel noch schwerer gemacht hat, als es ohnehin schon ist, waren diese nervigen Würfel, die einen dauernd runtergeschubst haben.

Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2019
１面あたりは普通のジャンプアクション
そこからだんだんと要素が追加されていく感じ
技術で差が出るのがくるくる回る風車のターゲットや軍団で来る敵オブジェクトを素早く打ち抜けるかで
クリアしやすさが変わってくるところ。

後半の重力反転紫エリアとかで進行方向分からなくなったりしやすい
とりあえずラインに沿っていったり、フチをそのまま進めば地面に立てたりする

２週目は能力も最初から開放されてるので
タイムアタックしても
１週目でいかなかった別ルートに挑戦してみるもよし

収集アイテムで世界観の分かるログが見れる感じ

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2019
I got to a level I couldn’t beat and punched a hole in my monitor. Now I have to spend a couple hundred bucks to get a new one.

Jokes aside, Deadcore is an undeniably fun game with intuitive, easy to learn mechanics. You run, you jump, you shoot, then you repeat. That is the game. If it sounds like it could get a bit boring after, say, 4 hours I would have to agree with you. I capped out at about 5, and haven't played in a while. However those 5 hours I played for were quite enjoyable and worth the $1.19 I payed for the game (hehe I love sales). I'm actually not going to bother giving this game a rating our of 30, Instead I'll just recommend that you pick up a copy if its on sale. So check this game out next time you find yourself aimlessly scrolling through the "under 12 dollars" section on the Steam Featured page.

annku

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2019
DeadCore ist ein Platformer in einer Science-Fiction Welt. Man spielt einen Roboter in First Person. Die Mechaniken sind interessant; Doppelsprung, Sprint und die Waffe die man besitzt, um Objekte zu aktivieren, machen das Spiel sehr abwechslungsreich, ganz leicht ist es auch nicht. Die Level sind vertikal sowie horizontal aufgebaut, die Umgebung sieht atemberaubend aus, das fiktive Design der Zonen passt sehr gut ins Bild. Auch wenn nicht all zu lang, für 2,50€ im Summer Sale definitiv einen Kauf wert

794798484
205 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juin 2019
DeadCore c'est un platformer-FPS avec un gameplay ultra agréable, basé sur la vitesse et l'élan.

Le jeu est assez beau et a une bonne ambiance, même si c'est un peu dommage d'en avoir qu'une (ou 2) durant tout le jeu. Le level design est vraiment bon, je n'ai jamais été perdu et les indications textuelles sont bien intégrées à l'univers. L'OST est OK sans plus, le sound design propre et le jeu est vraiment plaisant à jouer en général.

La difficulté est assez bien dosée et demande une dextérité et un temps de réaction un poil exigeants, mais réussir certaines phases apporte ce sentiment de speedrun enivrant. La rejouabilité a été travaillée avec un mode speedrun justement, et un NG+ avec toutes les capacités débloquées qui rend le jeu encore plus rapide.

On peut quand même déplorer le manque d'histoire intéressante (il y avait du potentiel), quelques glitches et surtout des ennemis qui font vraiment tache et rajoutent un côté aléatoire et frustrant qu'on aimerait bien enlever.

Ce jeu reste très bon donc bravo et merci aux 5 mecs qui l'ont créé.
 
DineAuZor

4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juin 2019
What can I say, this game caught me by surprise! It's amazing! I have only played it a couple of hours so I can't comment about the length of the game, but so far I'm really enjoying it! Fast, puzzling, and fun!
Be warned though, this is a game where on some levels you have to respawn and respawn and respawn
If you don't have the patience then do not play this game!
Overall if you're into speedrunning time of games then I fully recommend this little gem!
 
Devil's Toast
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2019
This his how the new Doom should handle. Fantastic air control right from the start and what seems to be the best (bar Warsow, perhaps) dash implementation I've seen in an FPS.

While gameplay is fantastic, the technical aspects are not great. It says 150 fps but it looks and feels like 60. Mouse lag and all. This is not how 120 Hz should feel like.

The game is totally worth it. One cannot overstate how it is for people with the skills and patience to play it. I bought DeadCore just as I finished The Talos Principle. I've been having a blast lately

Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2019
The bastard lovechild of Portal and Super Meat Boy. If you like Portal's aesthetic and SMB's masochistic level design, this is the game for you. Campaign is very short but with some replayability for speedruns and collectibles.
 
Averant
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2019
This game has a real “virtual reality / cyberspace” look to it, which I really enjoy. The game mostly revolves around getting good at platforming and timing, as you’ll often have to do things like shoot “buttons” that change gravity at a specific time (for example, you jump off a platform with certain death below you, but you shoot a button to change gravity so that you can start walking up, but you can’t shoot it too early because it’s only activated for a short amount of time).

The game has a puzzle element to it, but none of the puzzles are extremely difficult to get around, and this is coming from someone with pretty little patience for doing the same puzzle over and over again without finding a solution.

Overall, it was fun to play. It’s not a favorite of mine for anything, but it’s worth buying if you’re interested.
 
Minimend_Theta
244 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2019
This is really sad. This game has very positive aspects : the overall cyberpunk look, the music fitting ambiance, the pretty original concept ... but why is it ruined by the boring hardcore sequences you need to chain like 30 or even more times before you can reach the next so far away savepoint - when stupidly easy locations are filled of them ? Meaning of "earn reward" is okay but here it tends to be "free frustration" grind. It's sadly ruining it all :(

你隔壁老陆
65 produits enregistrés
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2018
パズルアクションというよりはランにFPS要素としてスイッチを銃で押させるゲーム

■良かった点
難易度はやや高いが楽しいと思える程度
リスポンが細かくあり、再スタートも早くストレスがない
クリアだけなら言語関係なくクリアできる
世界観、BGMが良い
■悪かった点
重力床のギミックに関しては切れ目でどうしていいか分かりづらい場面がおおくあまり好きにならなかった
隠しアイテムで解禁される資料などは英語

ゲームとしてはCloudbuiltに似ている、あちらが好きならおすすめ
4～5時間でクリアと少し軽めだが、これ以上あると飽きもあるし十分楽しめた
75点　正規値で十分価値あり、セールなら買うべし

Wonderfull atmospheric 3d-platformer, the gameplay aswell as the atmosphere are just an incredebile experience giving a certain "rush" to literlly speedrund this game fullfilling you with enjoyment. the game itself may be a bit short but the speedrun aspect makes up for it. i replayd the game many times due to the "rush" and you will get it aswell. the whole leaderboard system giving the game a competive touch will keep you busy perfecting every course to the best. in my opinion a must have for every parcour/plattformer lover especially for the competetive or those who enjoy great atmosphere and challenging parcouring.

JOHNNY GUEGGU
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2018
FPS Platformer in wich you climb a Tower. Pretty simple and damn good. After your first play through you will have unlocked some new abilities that let you rush through the early levels in no time. On top of your Double-Jump you get a Dash, Rocket-Jump and you will be able to change Gravity in specific places. The levels have multiple routes, some are easier some are harder, but you will check them out to unlock extra levels and music for the Speedrun modus. Some of these routes will only be available with the new abilities.

On your first play through I would recommend to ignore time. Also on your second one. Don't let some hard sections (this game has some) stop you. With a bit thinking, YouTube, or later with your new abilities they will be easy. Make your self familiar with the levels, try new routes, try to find shortcuts, or make them yourself with your Rocket-Jump and Dash. It is pretty interesting that this game is built to be abused and the normal way to go can completely be ignored. When you know where you have to go, the question how to get there has multiple answers. If you liked Mirrors Ede and Portal, I can fully recommend this game. 9,99€ is a steal if you are into these games and like speedruning and trying to get a better time again and again!
 
Mecha-Sol

-Zephyr-
92 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
36.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2018
do you like speed running, problem solving, and a crazy archaic mysterious atmosphere?

Deadcore is a game that combines puzzleplatforming with quake-like movement and shooting using a switchgun, which can both activate elements of the environment around you and deactivate enemies that might hinder your progress. The game formula is simple, reach the top of the tower (5 increasingly difficult stages) through the acquisition of power ups such as a air dash, double jump, blast shot (allowing for rocket jumping) and a gravity toggle, as well as collectibles such as music, gun upgrades, and sparks which both unlock divergent paths to finish the stages.

Pros:
- Very reasonably priced game
- immensely clever level design that often left me disoriented but always looking for new routes
- the speedrun mechanic once you git gud
- the music (is fantastic)
- sense of mystery and vertigo

♥♥♥♥:
-relatively short game (3 hrs on first play thru, but eventually got it down to about an hour) but for speedrunning this is a plus for sure|
- it starts INCREDIBLY TOUGH for those unprepared and only gets harder. The game ONLY gets easier with the few scattered power ups to increase dash counts and ammo as well as your own skill.
- YOU WILL DIE ALOT. at least in the beginning runs, you should expect 200+ deaths on a first attempt. On my speedrun attempt after getting all the sparks, I was able to die less than 20 times.
- Some areas might have some framerate issues, so heads up.

Overall, an incredibly fun game. The game is very fair in the spacing of checkpoints and the multiple paths make it a delightful open-ended experience which constantly surprises me with the secrets it holds. However, if you are easily frustrated and don't like dying 50x to the same obstacle, candy crush might be better suited for you. That said, if you enjoyed Portal 1 and 2 and need something a bit harder with a much higher payoff for getting better at the game, then dig in. It's a wonderful experience for any puzzle-shooter junkie and I couldn't recommend this game enough.
 
DanSy

One of the first ever games I got on steam.

A depth defying 3D platformer. The soundtrack is great, the graphics are vibrant, the controles are easy to master and there are limitless playthroughs. Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mai 2018
This game is simply great. I went in knowing little to nothing about this game and was blown away by the challenge and creative level design. It's tight platforming, but a forgiving respawn system keeps you pushing forward. The only fault is that the color scheme in this game gave me a headache after extended periods so I couldn't play more than 1.5 hours at a time. So far, I'm loving this game and I wish others knew how great it was. I picked it up in a random Humble Bundle, but I honestly strongly recommend this game, even at $10. If you like being rewarded for exploring off the beaten path and for feeling accomplishment after surpassing a challenging platformer section, you will love this game too!

Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2018
爱他，就给他推荐这个游戏
恨他，就给他推荐这个游戏
这游戏是人玩的吗！
看评论有些人拿这个游戏和传送门比，但是说实话吧……这游戏给我感觉就是一个跑酷游戏，和传送门差很多
解谜部分比较少，基本上就是玩家不停秀(song)操(ren)作(tou)
游戏画面很炫酷，很有科幻感，动作十分流畅，不停爬塔这个设定也让人觉得很帅，地图设计也很强大
不过游戏很多部分明显可以看出缺乏后期优化更新和修BUG，可能是这个项目没有得到足够的重视吧，毕竟从数据上来看销量也不怎么样。这里只能惋惜一下了

559 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2018
DeadCore is one of those games that you just. Can't. Put. Down.

Starting at the bottom of a -very- large tower, your only task is to climb as high as you can. Sounds simple, doesn't it?

Not really. Prepare to have your reflexes tested to their limits.

Twitchy jumps, moving platforms, laser gates, timed switches...muscle memory is simultaneously your best friend and your worst enemy.

Every level gets harder...

Good luck.

16.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2018
Deadcore is a great platformer that combines ambient puzzle solving and fast paced platforming. the controls are responsive, the levels are really tight and allow exploration without cluttering your mind with too many path ways, I will say this though, the game can bring out rage at some of the puzzles but once you complete them you get this sort of feeling like you just climbed a mountain and every other time you go through the levels you feel like you mastered it, hence the speedrunning aspect. Overall This is a really fun game if you want a challenging but fair puzzle platformer.

Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2018
A lovely little platformer with a consistent aesthetic and multiple completion paths. Honestly a big miss when it comes to storytelling, but the gameplay makes up for it. This will be appropriately challenging for more casual players but very experienced players might only be put to their paces trying to speedrun, and even then I have some doubts after looking at those speedrun times. Overall a very positive experience, though, easily 8/10 or better.

This is a game that doesn't seem to be as well-known as some of the more popular platforming games are. I admit, this game is by no means easy, and it can get a little frustrating at times, but the music, the graphics, and the gameplay itself are good. This is a fun, albeit challenging game to play. Felt the storyline could have been a little better, but I still had a lot of fun playing it. If you're really into platforming games, I'd say this game is definitely worth a try. If nothing else, it is fun, challenging, eye-candy in terms of graphics, and it has a really good ost used throughout the game.

cheesy
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2017
Definitely not a bad choice for my first speed runner game. Both of the soundtracks are amazing (one for the main game, mostly atmospheric, the other for the speed run levels, mostly techno). Various abilities and powerups are acquired throughout the duration of the game, each increasing the complexity of gameplay, making for a long, tough grind. Checkpoints minimise the punishment of mistakes, and are laid out fairly far between, giving a noticeable yet bearable level of challenge.

All in all, highly recommended.

Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2017
This game is the best game i've played in a long time. To start with, the mystery of the whole game is what really gives it atmosphere. The soundtrack is beautiful, with DnB to Chill. The idea of the logs with the information on what exactly is going on is genius, and the fact that you have to go that extra bit extra to get those logs and the truth was a brilliant idea. And then the sparks. Amazing idea that if you push a bit harder earlier, things will get easier later. I also have really enjoyed speedruns. They really emphasise SPEED. Its always fun to see who is faster and better. And the final touch, the gameplay. Its so diverse, and the atmosphere around it just helps the frustration of failing to feel better, and keep you going. The mechanics are so unfamiliar and yet so easy to catch on to. Overall, I definitely give this a 9.5/10, as it sometimes runs slow. I would also recommend Valley, SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell and A story abput my Uncle.
 
Mocha

694 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 octobre 2017
J'ai jamais trop joué aux jeux de plateformes et je n'aime pas du tout les die&retry, je ne sais pas vraiment ce qui m'a poussé à acheter ce jeux, surement son petit prix pendant une période où je ne savais pas à quoi jouer.

Mais finalement je ne regrette absolument pas ! J'ai surkiffé ce jeu !!!

Ces sensations... du pur bonheur ! Dès que le dash est débloqué le jeu part sur un gameplay trés rapide, trés nerveux et surtout trés fluide.
Le plus gros point fort pour moi est le lvl design maitrisé de bout en bout avec plusieurs niveaux de lecture et une monté de la dificulté bien gérée. On reconnaît d'un coup d'oeil tout ce qui est suceptible de vous désintégrer, les élements à activer, les checkpoints, les élements de décors, etc. Si au départ le jeu ressemblera à un plateformer "classique", trés vite le choix d'avoir une vue FPS prends tout son intérêt et offre un gameplay trés riche qui exploite bien l'espace avec des mecaniques de controle aérien ou de changement de gravité. Le jeu ce transformerais presque en puzzlegame par moment ^^

Observer son environnement sera trés important. Assez régulieremnt pendant votre ascension vous aurez le choix entre deux chemins, à vous de choisir celui qui vous semble le plus simple (ou le plus rapide ;) ). Vous trouverez aussi des collectables tout au long des 5 niveaux, ça sera des musiques, des logs (morceaux d'histoire), des boosts pour vos capacités ou le plus intérressant, des "Sparks" (2 par niveau) qui vous dévoilerons un chemin bien plus rapide pour arriver en haut mais aussi bien plus compliqué !

Si les graphisme ne sont pas fabuleux (bien que tout à fait correct, surtout pour un jeu semi-indé) la DA, elle, est sublime avec une mention spéciale aux éclairages.

Monter au sommet de la tour une première fois devrait vous prendre entre 5 et 8 heures selon votre niveau, c'est peu mais c'est à ce moment la que le jeu commence vraiment, en effet dès que vous finissez un cycle, vous pouvez en recommencer un autre en gardant toutes les capacités et les sparks débloqués et pu***n comme c'est juissif de refaire en moins d'une heure ce qu'on à fais en 6 ou alors de le refaire tranquillement en cherchant tous les collectables !

Ajouter à cela un mode speedrun où vous pourrez refaire séparement chaque niveau pour essayer de vous hissez dans dans les scores mondiaux. Mode dans lequel vous trouverez de nouvelle map débloqué en trouvant les fameux sparks.
Au final on se retrouve avec une durée de vie tout à fais respectable surtout vu le petit prix du jeu.

Par contre, un scénario quasi-inexistant. Pour ce genre de jeu ce n'est pas important, mais c'est à souligner.
 
TurboPoney
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2017
This game does a very good job of giving the open world illusion in a 3d puzzle game. The different paths feel interesting and rewarding instead of other choices in games that are there for the sake of choice. The ways the player can maintain momentum as he bounces and dashes around is truly amazing, letting long strings of jumps, dashes and falls feel very rewarding. The difficulty curve is just right, constantly rewarding the player for the next obstacle course well done.

This is what sonic in 3d should have felt like; bouncing and shooting around as you traverse an interesting world in feats of skill.

Évaluation publiée le 23 septembre 2017
Beğendim.
Oyun çok hoş özellikle atmosferi.Oyun bir sppedrun oyunu.Birazcık teknolojik bir görünümü var.Oyuna ilk olarak storyden yani hikayeden başlıyorsunuz.Bir silahımız var.Bu silahla çeşitli noktalardan geçis noktaları açabiliyoruz.
Uzun süre oynandığında bağımlılık yapabilecek bir oyıun.Beğendim açıkçası.
Her pazartesileri steamde belirli indirimler oluyor,bu oyunu rastgele indirime girdiği zamanda denk gelip aldım.İndirime girdiğinde alınabilecek bir oyun.Ama indirimde almanızı öneririm ben 18 lira değer mi bilemiyorum.

Genel olarak güzel,oynattırır kendini yani.Radarınıza alabilirsiniz.

Recommandé
31.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2017
Un jeu comme l'on en voit plus, avec un esrpti et une âme "à l'ancienne" qui veut et pronne le dépassement de soit !!! Et quelle jouissance de revenir aux premiers niveaux avec les aptitudes et abilités gagnées aux suivants !
J'écris rarement des commentaires, d'ailleur c'est mon premier , mais je dois le faire l'honneur des heures passées dessus.
Un graphisme ayant l'air minimaliste, mais les textures et shaders soignés, donnent libre court à une fluidité nécessaire pour et une FPS maximale pour la vitesse requise à l'accomplissement des missions les plus ardues, sur les plateformes les plus modestes aussi !
Tout ce que je regrette est d'avoir fini le mode histoire aussi vite... Malgré cela, reste le mode speedrun et toutes les autres maps à débloquer ... tout simplement génial !
(P.S. : j'ai juste mis la musique au minimum pour faire jouer ma propre playlist ;=) )

Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 septembre 2017
Ich hatte das Spiel vor Ewigkeiten mal in einem Video gesehen und dann vergessen wie es hieß und daher nicht mehr wieder gefunden.
Durch einen Zufall bin ich dann vor ein paar Tagen wieder darauf gestoßen und habe es mir gekauft.
Der Anfang vom Spiel erklärt die Spielmechanik und Steuerung ganz gut, so das man schon schnell einfindet.
Später nimmt das Spiel dann aber derart an Schwierigkeit zu, dass es auf einem dauerhaften Trial & Error hinaus läuft.
Es gibt Passagen in dem Spiel wo man sich nach dem 100. Versuch fragt, wie man das schaffen soll.
Bleibt man Hartnäckig und schafft es dann tatsächlich, kann man es oft selbst kaum glauben und freut sich darüber, nur um dann vor der nächsten schier unlösbaren Aufgabe zu stehen.

Auf diesen Faktor baut das Spiel, ähnlich wie Portal und Portal 2, auf.. allerdings mit einer ganz anderen Spielmechanik.
Mir gefällt Deadcore und auch wenn es mir manchmal den letzten Nerv raubt, nach dem Rage Quit starte ich es irgendwann doch wieder um es nochmal zu probieren. :)

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2017
This one is unique. The closest game I could compare it to is Portal, yet it's still so different. This is more of a fast paced obstacle course involving a gun that activates switches and deactivates enemies for a few seconds. There isn't much a story, but the gameplay, visuals, sound, and music is where the game truly shines. I always appreciate a good story, but it isn't always necessary to me. Now here's the real warning: THIS GAME IS DIFFICULT! Not quite at the tier of Dark Souls, but I guarantee you'll get stuck often in the later levels. Hidden throughout the story levels, they have music tracks; logs, which contain lore; power upgrades; and sparks, which unlock speedrun levels and the game's real ending. It reminds me of Doom's secrets, and it feels so good to discover them.

Now for some ♥♥♥♥:

-Not the best performance in 1440p or 1080p even with all of the graphic settings on low in The Void (level 3) and The Storm (level 4). This is with a GTX 970 FTW+, i7 2600k and 16 GB RAM. (I've noticed a developer say in forums that they built this game with 30 FPS in mind. That's really not a good idea. Most PC gamers want 60 FPS. If we wanted 30, we would go buy consoles.)
-Rarely when loading a saved game, my character is stuck in the ground. A simple respawn fixes it.
-When I try to exit the game, the background of the title screen remains and it never ends. I have to alt-tab and then close it outside of the game.
-Some shadows flicker when facing nearly any direction.

If you aren't afraid of difficulty, then get it. It's cheap.
 
Lieutenant Raepfist

0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 aout 2017
From the time I spent on this, its good and responsive. Good starting point for people new to "speedrunning." I like the tools available, forcing you to think of different routes each time you fail. A little slow for my tastes, kind of like portal, but still challenging.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 aout 2017
This game is a nice challenge for both casual and hardcore gamers. The game revolves completely around movement anywhere from gravity to speed. The controls feel responsive, which is very good because some quick reactions will save your life very frequently. You will die in this game, several times. But, when you do, you feel like its your fault. Its very easy to learn what you did wrong and figure out what to do to complete a puzzle. The puzzles arent overly challenging, at least not to me. This game was designed well enough so that if youre not meant to go somewhere, you can't. There is a lot of replayability in this in the form of collectables like powerups and lore. The story isnt necessary but it certainly livens up the universe significantly. Thanks to this games mechanics, it makes a great speedrunning game, with built in support for recording times and comparing them.

If youre someone who likes medium to fast paced games, this game is a great buy. Especially for the price.
 
TheMainVeztex

Évaluation publiée le 1 aout 2017
Jump, dash, die, restart, try again and be better.

If you finished the game, try it again and try to find much faster ways. Example: Stage one first try 20 Minutes, now in lower than 4 Minutes.

Great game with some challenges.

Don't expect Portal, because it's no Portal. It's a classic Jump and run.
